Review Title: A must for splitting expenses with roommates! üö©Can‚Äôt itemize existing photo or use iPad splitscreen
Review Text:
The only things missing the ability to work in split screen on an iPad Air M2, and itemize a receipt from an existing photo. Other than that, this app has everything I need! It works really well. Alot of thought and polish has gone into it. 

Paying for premium is 100% worth it since my roommates and I need to split a lot of group purchases. With the paid version you can automatically (with little need for manual corrections) itemize a paper receipt. The only problem is you have to take a picture, you can‚Äôt use the auto itemize feature if the receipt forms from an existing photo. To do that I have to pull the photo up on another screen and use the Splitwise app to take a picture of the picture of the receipt. It seems like a glaring lack when the rest of the app is so polished. Splitwise makes it really easy to carve up any receipt, you can choose how to split it by item, by different percentages for each person, or just manually enter amounts everyone owes.

The only other feature I want added is the ability to work in split screen on an iPad. Right now I have to pull Splitwise up on my phone and set it next to my iPad when I want to review my budget, until I can put Splitwise in split screen then I‚Äôll need two devices to manage my finances. Switching back and forth over and over between apps just to review my finances doesn‚Äôt work well for me.

Review Title: Disappointing Pro Model and Broken Features
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used Splitwise for years, and while the app itself is fine for basic expense sharing, the recent switch to a $40/year Pro model has been disappointing.

Recurring expenses are confusing to manage, buried in the mobile app UI, and inexplicably unavailable on the Web app. The feature to import credit card transactions has been broken for months, and even when it worked, it was poorly implemented‚Äîautomatically canceling pending payments, forcing you to wait until transactions completed to import them. Worse, expenses were sometimes deleted without warning or interaction.

Overall, the move to a subscription model without delivering meaningful Pro features feels unjustified. This direction has made the app less functional and has ultimately lost me as a customer. I hope future updates focus on fixing these basic issues before adding a price tag.

Review Title: Good for splitting but they want to force you into their payment processing
Review Text: I like it for splitting expenses but don‚Äôt like that they aren‚Äôt allowing a user to specify what form of payment they will accept. Attaching your bank account details including your date of birth to yet another money handler is extremely dangerous in the days of rampant hacking. It has the potential to wipe you out financially. Like everyone else, I used Splitwise to divide costs from trips with friends or nights out. It was so useful, but when it became limited to three or four entries per day 95% of the utility instantly went out of the window. If you were the type of person who is splitting cost with this level of granularity, then you‚Äôre probably not the type of person who would pay for that functionality when you could do it free yourself. Which is why I now use a spreadsheet.

Splitwise was a great app before they took features away to get you to buy Splitwise Pro.

Now it‚Äôs little more than a list.

Review Title: Great app to share expenses across a group
Review Text: I‚Äôve used Splitwise now for three group trips and it has been so efficient and once you get the hang of the set up, easy to use. I like that it doesn‚Äôt ask for banking or other personal ID data that can be used for identity theft during the profile set up.
Es una muy buena aplicaci√≥n que permite dividir en grupo o o con personas los gastos muy f√°cil de usar y puede llevar el reparto de gastos en multiplicaciones al d√≠a, incluyendo los recibos
Not free to use

Very useful for group events and trips. Allows me to add Venmo as a way to receive payments but not as a way to pay people. That‚Äôs why I gave it 2 stars. Buggy and makes no sense why I can‚Äôt pay with Venmo.

Review Title: Previously 5 stars but now will not open
Review Text: Have used this app for over 3 years and loved it, pay for premium. Now in the past week it will not open without crashing. I updated the app and even my iOS and nothing has helped. Frustrated!!
Doesn‚Äôt work, no matter funding option I choose

We have used Splitwise for 3 girls trips! It‚Äôs so easy to pay for activities and meals. 1 credit card per expense. Servers can‚Äôt believe it! 
We all take turns and settle up at lunch before we leave each other.

Used to be free with some ads, but now they limit you on number of items to add per day, make you wait time between entries. 
All that unless you pay $5 a month. What a joke.

Do not use, do not waste your time.
App is behind a paywall, can‚Äôt be used
Such an amazing tool for our vacation, we were easily able to keep track of who spent what and who owed who. It‚Äôs a no-brainer when doing trips with friends or family.

Splitwise introduced a paywall that limits you to three expenses daily and artificial wait times within the free version of the app. Aka ‚Äúpay us for no extra features, we‚Äôll just stop intentionally screwing up the UX.‚Äù I‚Äôm deleting this app and I encourage everyone to find an alternative.
I solve this app until they set limit and if over the limit you have to pay.
Please give more than 3 accounts to link for auto transaction import. For paying customers this should be unlimited, or at least more than 3.

One time purchase should be an option. It‚Äôs math and accounting. It hasn‚Äôt changed in a long time. Why would anyone pay for this as a subscription. Reasonable one-time purchase or no deal. Used for years, switched to open-source version. Get ‚ÄúSpliit‚Äù, ditch this garbage.

Why did they have to start charging an outrageous subscription just to use some basic features. Not only they drown you in ads but you also have to pay an expensive monthly subscription just for the basics. Ridiculous they have successfully ruined the app.
This makes settling group expenses so easy and quick!

Terrible app; not user friendly; not transparent. Since people use various payment platforms ; and they are not linked, it is hit and miss whether it all gets recorded. You can only see one element at a time. Algorithm is overly complicated- better to use a spreadsheet.
It would be nice if the transactions were shown the member was involved in
Adding contacts difficult. Venmo only with paid account? Lame.
With limitations in number of entries you can log, the app has become useless. It is unfortunate, since this was one of my favorite app when it came to finances.
Extra transactions, splitwise is a pain and wants SSN to complete in app transactions. Extremely inconvenient.

Review Title: A great tool for friends who trust each other
Review Text:
I use this with housemates and with friends where it's alright if stuff evens out eventually. And for keeping track of rent. A great little tool.

The (paid) receipt scanning function was really convenient, if slightly janky in workflow, when I was splitting restaurant bills regularly with my polycule.

Review Title: The free version is not that great anymore
Review Text: Free version is very frustrating.  It used to be a great app now it limits all how many expenses we can enter per day.
Why would you offer Google login on the web but not allow the login in the app.  Horrible design.
Limiting expense input to 4 per day in order to get people to buy pro is absolutely ridiculous. I can understand premium features like attachments but 4 INPUTS PER DAY, it is so petty.

Review Title: Free version too limited- pro is too expensive
Review Text: It‚Äôs really good but paying a subscription for a money managing app makes no sense and is beyond greedy.

Review Title: There are many alternatives to this app
Review Text: This thing used to work, now it wouldn‚Äôt let you use it after a certain number per day. There should have been a warning instead of letting us ad expenses and then told us we can‚Äôt use until we paid. Moving to other apps and telling all my friends. Like all others. Such a horrible tactic to get people paying

Review Title: Was great until they limited the free functionality
Review Text: This app was my go to for a long time for traveling with friends. Recently however, they‚Äôve made it very difficult to use this app since they started severely pushing the pro version. They limit the app to adding 4 expenses a day which, on the go, makes this app almost useless as I now have to add my expenses into my notes app and add 4 a day (it seems it‚Äôs a 24 hour period) until I‚Äôm caught up. Again, great functionality, but their push for the pro version has ruined the app for me. Will be looking for a replacement app.

Review Title: How did we survive before splitwise?
Review Text: This has saved so many headaches and let us enjoy group trips worry free. Love that you can record small group expenses within larger groups - makes those quick coffee trips for the early birds easy! Thank you splitwise!
This should be a one time purchase if that not a subscription
Everyone who uses this app is a nickel and dime loser.

Terrible app. Great until you realize you can‚Äôt actually pay people through the app unless you want to give away your social security number‚Ä¶ why do they need that?? Not to mention money people pay you through the app ‚Äòexpires‚Äô after a certain amount of time if you don‚Äôt go through their sketchy service. Just allow people to connect their venmo & bank accounts instead of trying to be a bank‚Ä¶ would give 0 stars if I could
Free tier basically useless at this stage.
Why are expenses limited to 4? Scam. This was my favorite app, now it is the worst ever

I have an account for a year now, very happy with how the app works. Simple and efficient. But I setup my account using google id. There is no option to log in using google id on the app. Therefore I have to use the browser version.
Pay us $40 to save couple of numbers ü§£ are you insane? It‚Äôs gigabytes of data at any other cloud provider. What am I paying for - a compute heavy 2+2 calculations? Thanks bye.

User Name: gxhdhhd oh eu OB d hi jdidb
Review Text: Way too complicated

Somehow contacts kept getting added twice (same names and phone numbers) and the app does not let you delete or edit after group creation - tried to delete one duplicate and the entire group itself deleted at the very end of trip so now no one can recall or keep track of what was spent all week long‚Ä¶

Review Title: Limited Expenses?! That‚Äôs Garbage, No Thanks!!
Review Text: Back to Microsoft Excel I go‚Ä¶
Very confusing. Does not provide net balance one owes

Was a great app but now it‚Äôs almost unusable without the overpriced subscription. I would understand not being able to connect bank accounts, locking certain features or multiple groups behind a paid tier but limiting it to 3 transactions per day (two of which you have to wait 10 seconds to enter) is just annoying. Don‚Äôt get me wrong I‚Äôm happy to support and pay for a useful service but $4/month or $40 / year for a slightly more convenient version of something you can setup in a (free) google sheet to me isn't worth it. 
If there was a less feature rich version (just the base manual expense splitting functionality) that I could pay one time for I‚Äôd absolutely do it.

I used to use Splitwise which was great for group trips, but now they limit how many charges can be added per day. When you hide basic app functionality behind a paywall you will kill your user base. Back to manual tracking and Venmo it is.
If you use this app and send money via Venmo it will just say pending for months at a time and you will never get your money even if you verify your email. This company is a scam.

Just got back from a trip with friends and began entering all the expenses I covered, only to find out that the app now only lets you input 4 expenses per day. Limiting users to just 4 expenses is ridiculous. I don‚Äôt remember it being this way before. The app is basically useless now unless you want to pay a monthly fee.

Review Title: Worst app ever - Basically a Pyramid Scheme
Review Text:
It‚Äôs more efficient to hand write a spreadsheet than to sign up for this app, link your info, expose your bank account information, make edits & changes.

It‚Äôs like a pyramid scheme. You have invite your friends to this app, pay the app monthly to unlock your own payment
Used to be good, now they‚Äôre just greedy. Ads I can deal with but forcing me to pay a subscription to enter more than 4 expenses a day is just a blatant money grab

The app will sho an ad every time you try to ad an expense, and most of the times, the ad will not go away, making it impossible for you to add your expense. It is a shame that a good concept gets messed up by an useless UI.
It‚Äôs a no from me dawg
Limiting to 4 transactions a day is craaaazy
Introduction of daily limits = time to go back to spreadsheets. You can do something else with your egos than sell out to the VCs, you know.

Splitwise makes our trip so much easier! Don't need to spend long hours to calculate interpersonal debts. Very convenient and helpful. Recommendation for even better functions: 
1. Hope there could be a view of individual expenditure count for each group. (Besides how much we owe the others, we would also like to know how much we spent ourselves.)
2. Hope there could be support for currency conversion, e.g. a simple button will allow all debts change to one currency selected at a rate input manually.

Review Title: Great tool when traveling with friends
Review Text: Very easy to access, sync automatically between devices. I will give a five star if this can be output as Excel to computers.
Just 2entry free for the day? It‚Äôs just data entry app
There is a limit quota of the expense each day
Free version allows only 2 entries per day. PRO version is too expensive.

Review Title: I cannot change language to JP
Review Text:
Hi team,

I am using this app with my close family and friends I think function wise this is a very useful app.

BUT there is one big problem. The words written in Japanese is very hard to understand. I want to Change the language settings to English to not mistake anything I‚Äôve input for my family and friends.

Would you be able to fix the Japanese or be able to let me change the language settings to English?
I have tried to change settings from inside the app and from the settings app from my iPhone but both did not work.

Also one more advice specifically for Japan.
We do not use .00 for our currency YEN. 
 (Unless you are active in the currency market) 
So if you are able to erase the .00 that will make Japanese users very happy‚ò∫Ô∏è

Thanks for all your hard work.

Review Title: Daily expense limit and ads ruins all user experience
Review Text:
Ive recently switched to Splitwise from another similar app, overall happy with most functions of Splitwise, practical (such as recurring expense) with good UI. 
However, after a few expense entries (reddit says 3), i have to wait for 10 sec ad before adding an expense, and soon after is blocked by ‚Äúdaily expense limit‚Äù unless I pay for Pro. 
This is hugely frustrating user experience, a very bad monetization strategy if you-dev team think people will be willing to pay for the trivial expense entry function given lots of alternatives and low cost of switching, why ruining it all?
Terible update with forced limit
The free version now limits only 3 expenses per day, and the paid version costs way too much.

Hello splitwise team!! Why have you put an limit to the number of transactions per day!! Why you want to earn money by putting an limit to it !!
Splitwise pro is not required at all this is the worst part of it.
I really loved splitwise app but now you guys have let down everyone and it is very irritating!!
Nobody is going to 700Yen per month just to add expenses and split them it real madness!!

I‚Äôd consider myself a light user of this app, use it a few times a year to split expenses with friends. It‚Äôs unusable now without  paying, you get three expenses a day, which renders it useless.

A once good app ruined by forced subscriptions. 6000 yen a year, is this company smoking crack? I‚Äôm going back to Google sheets, until I find a good alternative

App is now useless, rate limit kicked in after just one expense today. Trying to make people pay to use the app‚Äôs most basic functionality was never a good idea.

I use to recommend this app to everyone I went away with, and it was great at simplifying payments. However, in the most recent update, the developers have made this app far less usable to encourage you to pay for the premium version. It is my view that features should not be removed to encourage people to pay for an app, but instead they should be added. I can no longer recommend this app to friends and family as a result and will be looking for an alternative.

I have found that the app ‚ÄúSplid‚Äù is a great alternative! The free version is great but I opted d to pay the one off fee for that app rather than pay for Splitwise indefinitely, especially when I would only be able to use Splitwise with other paid users since the most recent update.

Recently and without warning Splitwise has adopted a limit to the number of expenses you can add per day for free. This is particularly annoying when trying to add all of your expenses for a recent trip for example. 

In addition it now spams you with adverts to upgrade to the pro version when you try to add an expense. 

I have been using Splitwise for years, and it‚Äôs such a shame to see such a formerly useful app succumb to modern predatory practices.
App only lets me do 4 expenses per day on the free version of the app.. not useable now unfortunately.

Review Title: It‚Äôs good‚Ä¶ until it isn‚Äôt anymore

I am ok with ads but limiting the number of transactions I can have a day? Nah that‚Äôs the last straw. You have changed, I am not good enough for you anymore. I am sure you will find someone better and willing to pay for your service. I hope you reconsider your decision and this is not goodbye and we will be together again, hopefully. Btw for anyone reading the reviews, I recommend Tricount.

Review Text: I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for years and the price tier just for adding multiple expenses a day doesn‚Äôt make any sense

Review Title: Used to be good, now they‚Äôve hidden the useful features behind a paywall
Review Text:
I submitted the following feedback to Splitwise customer service, which is my sentiment.

‚Äú
I am a longstanding user of Splitwise, and am familiar with your app. You‚Äôve made a change to your functionality recently, which is really annoying, and I wanted to give you feedback on this.
 
I am a free user, and have used Splitwise for a while. I use it primarily for house expenses with my housemates, and for holidays. The general approach I do with both of these is gather expenses, and then, at the end of the month (or at the end of the holiday) I upload all of the expenses in one go. 
 
However, what I have noticed is that you have now 1) limited the number of expenses one can upload in a single day; and 2) for the last couple of expenses of my limit, pound me with advert after advert, lasting ten seconds long, encouraging me to switch to Splitwise Pro. This is very irritating, and massively erodes the user experience. 
 
Now, I know what you‚Äôre going to say: ‚Äúit‚Äôs only ¬£4 a month, it‚Äôs half the price of a London pint, surely you can cough that up‚Äù. And indeed I could. But here‚Äôs the thing. I have, for years ‚Äì perhaps 6 years? ‚Äì used Splitwise and I have been just fine as before. I have never felt a need to switch to the Pro option. Obviously preferable to you would be to encourage me to the Pro option, but your solution to this is not to make the Pro option better ‚Äì and thus more attractive ‚Äì but instead to make the free version worse. If I want to get what used to be free, I now have to pay. This is clearly a recent decision, as I‚Äôve gone many years without ever encountering such limitations from you.
 
I really resent this style of commercialism. It doesn‚Äôt make the Pro option more appealing, it just makes Splitwise as an app less appealing! If you play this kind of game with me as a free user, and take stuff away, what‚Äôs to stop you doing it again. ‚ÄúOh, sorry, you want to upload unlimited expenses? Now you have to upgrade to Splitwise Pro Elite‚Äù, etc etc.
 
It also comes across as rather desperate. I mean, ten second adverts about Splitwise Pro if I want to upload an expense! How much do you want me to switch to your paid service! It reminds me of when someone at work wrote a colleague a sonnet to ask her out ‚Äì I mean chill out man, you ever heard of trying too hard! Surely the solution is to extract more money out of the advertising revenue stream and retain the original perks of free membership, are you really in that dire financial straits?
 
All of this is to say, I really do like your app, and would like to continue to use it ‚Äì but this change in functionality is not more likely to make me pay what is a small fee to move to the Pro option. I am more likely to create a google sheet, and ask friends to upload it that way.
‚Äù

Review Text:

I think it just makes it easier to put in so that when others owe something specific you‚Äôre not having to remember how much change you got.

Maybe if the person who has paid has their share autofilled when the totals from the others are input when splitting unequally. Just an idea, maybe I‚Äôm just bad at maths.

Review Title: Best in class but aggressive monetisation
Review Text:
No question Splitwise is the best in class group finances/bill splitting app out there.
The vast functionality and ease of use makes it the #1.

However, recent extreme aggressive pushes of Splitwise Pro have really ruined this app.

Splitwise Pro is a good offer and a good monetisation option, extended the feature locks and adding Timer ads/rewarded are understandable for monetising this free app.

However, core functionality breaking restrictions is an incredible extreme step that I feel is too far and also could result in a collapse of user base and NPS for Splitwise.

I would recommend instead Rewarded Video placement (ads for adding transactions) and IAP for 1 off group (e.g cheaper one off payments for groups).

But to break the app when people need is too radical so I can‚Äôt score this app more than 2*

If this is resolved with a more fair monetisation system I will change this score

Review Title: A use case for bad monetization strategies
Review Text:
I‚Äôve been using this app for years. Its not perfect, but the free version always fulfilled my needs. I use the app for tracking shared expenses and group expenses. I used to recommend and invite all my friends to this app, bringing the developer at least a dozen other users. 

Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend it any longer.

In the last few months, the developer has been incredibly aggressive with pushing users into the paid version of the app. They‚Äôve limited the number of expenses you can add per day, making it harder to use the app when needed. Sometimes I do my accounting in batches, now I can‚Äôt. This causes me to forget expenses, losing track of them, and ultimately rendering the app useless.

They‚Äôve even gone as far as clawing back features that were once free, such at attaching photos to expenses, which is a pretty basic feature in similar apps.

I understand the need for monetization, it‚Äôs a business after all. However, it should be done by adding value to the user, not taking it away. 

Why not give users credits by watching ads, for example? Why not give users who share the app credits? 

This app just isn‚Äôt good enough to charge a premium subscription, in no world is it worth it. You‚Äôre charging for very basic functionality, clawing back features that justified the use of the app in the first place to convert users into buyers. It‚Äôs just bad practice, find a way to add value, or get more creative with your monetization strategy. 

I can only imagine this move will result in a drop of long term retention, losing users you might have paid for, who also invited their friends. The network effect is probably the best thing this app has going for itself, a way to grow organically. Chasing your long term users away Is a race to the bottom.

Review Title: Splitwise Update Review: Forced Expense Wait
Review Text:
Splitwise recently introduced a significant change: a forced wait between adding expenses. Previously, users could swiftly input expenses, enhancing efficiency and convenience. However, this alteration disrupts the seamless experience, requiring users to pause between entries.

While the intention behind this change might be to encourage people to sign-up to their ‚ÄúPro Version‚Äù, it feels restrictive to users accustomed to the app's fluidity. The forced wait interrupts the flow of entering expenses, potentially leading to frustration, especially for those managing multiple transactions.

Given that this restriction wasnt there when I started to use the app, adding that now only shows the approach - ‚ÄúMake them captive and then make them pay‚Äù!

Won‚Äôt recommend. Rating. - 1/5

Dear Splitwise Team,

Splitwise is undoubtedly the best product in its category‚Äîintuitive, reliable, and incredibly useful. I have been a long-time user and admirer of the platform.

I would like to offer a suggestion that I believe could significantly enhance both user experience and your revenue model.

Many users‚Äîmyself included‚Äîuse Splitwise primarily for short-term group travel, where expenses need to be shared over a limited period. In such cases, the current monthly or annual subscription model may not feel justified, as it is not relevant to the duration or frequency of use.

A per-trip pricing model, limited to a specific number of days (say, 7‚Äì10 days), could cater perfectly to this use case. This would encourage more casual users to upgrade for the duration of their trip, without the hesitation that often comes with a longer-term commitment.

I had previously suggested a similar model to Slido, and they later introduced both monthly and per-event pricing‚Äîoffering flexibility while expanding their paid user base.

I truly believe that a flexible per-trip plan could unlock a new segment of paying users for Splitwise.

Thank you for the great product, and I hope you will consider this idea.

Best regards,
Anil Kariwala

We use the Splitwise app among roommates in Ecuador, in general love it. We love that the expenditures added will auto-load little icons when the words are recognizable like ‚Äúgas‚Äù, ‚Äúelectric‚Äù, and ‚Äúwater‚Äù, but what would be so hard about having that feature in Spanish too? It really does make it visually easier to keep track, so I‚Äôd just love to see y‚Äôall make the same thing function for words like ‚Äúluz‚Äù, ‚Äúagua‚Äù, ‚Äúarriendo‚Äù, ‚Äúcombustible‚Äù - terms that are consistent enough throughout Spanish-speaking countries (and Spanish speakers w/in the US) that they‚Äôd be easy enough for a user to figure out. I mean, if you already have the rest of the app and its features available in Spanish, why not that last little detail? ü§î We wish we didn‚Äôt have to put things on the ledger in English all the time for the helpful icons to appear, because it feels snobbish and exclusionary of our housemates who are not Spanish-English bilingual.

Review Title: For meals, promises a lot, delivers on little
Review Text: When using this app on my phone, anytime I switch over to my calculator app to crunch some numbers, it closes out of an expense I‚Äôm working on. This drives me 100% absolutely nuts because there‚Äôs no way to save a draft, your progress, nothing. I had to redo one expense 4 times. That aside, it took me 15 minutes to figure out how to split a simple lunch bill among four people because (1) the UX is a real problem; (2) what in this good Earth is this ‚Äúshares‚Äù feature that has little to no use in real life because no restaurant designs their menus this way and nobody orders this way; (3) not enough development is put into the dollar amount entry feature and why does it give me so many problems about the sum not adding up when I clearly know that it doesn‚Äôt and am trying to fix the issue but the app won‚Äôt let me leave without deleting everything‚Ä¶ I literally needed to find out what the tax rate was for certain restaurants (ones that charge hidden taxes, a fight for another day) and it wouldn‚Äôt let me do that without restarting completely. I literally would rather pull out all my hair and an abacus than deal with this app another time and any friend of mine who suggests using this app is disinvited to future hangouts until they learn the error of their ways or this app fixes its problems.

I used to LOVE this app! I‚Äôve used it for years between different groups of roommates I‚Äôve lived with, and to manage personal expenses with my partner. I love the interface of the app, how easy it is to use, and the different options for dividing expenses. That all changed today. I opened the app today to add in my expenses for a couple recent grocery shopping trips for my roommates and each time I wanted to add an expense I had to wait for ad to play, which was new and annoying, but I dealt with it. Then after I added 4 (just 4!) expenses I was met with a pop-up saying that I had reached the maximum number of expenses I could input today and I had to either upgrade to the pro version or wait until tomorrow to input more. I commonly put in 10 or 15 expenses all at once so I only have to do money management once or twice a month. There is nothing in the pro version of this app that I will use and it‚Äôs not worth the money just to be able to add my expenses when just a month ago I could add as many as I wanted to for free; which is why I specifically downloaded this app, as a free way to manage expenses with my roommates and partner. I will be deleting the app today and switching to a different app that allows me to do the same things Splitwise used to do for free.

I love and use this app constantly, to the point that it would make sense for me to use the pro version. So I did the 1 month free trial (thank you) but it didn‚Äôt seem worth the money. Specifically because I still can‚Äôt itemize transactions on the phone app, only the desktop, and the charts aren‚Äôt really helpful. In regards to the charts, if I could tap on a section of the pie chart and have every transaction that‚Äôs in that category shown - that would be Very helpful. Also, it‚Äôs not very clear on the charts if the total amount shown is the total of what Both people spent (and then split) or if it‚Äôs what I specifically spent after splitting expenses (again, would be very helpful to know/have both options). Last feedback is that it would be great if when using the itemized feature, that items could be split by a custom % instead of only 50/50 or 100/0. Fingers crossed these updates are doable! I tell people about this app all the time and it makes my like So much easier by removing the stress of remembering debts, but the above would really help a lot.

Completely counterintuitive dumpster fire of an app that is supposed to make communal payments for group events simplified. Instead I‚Äôm capped at 5 submissions a day and then demanded to sign up for PRO or wait 24 hours to get the rest of my requests out because I guess regular splitwise can only handle SO
MUCH. We have that in common I guess. Next I‚Äôm graciously offered the ability to make requests in every currency in the universe, but wait‚Ä¶ I need to get PRO to convert requests before paying them. I guess Ill call my local bank and get the market exchange rates for that day to convert every single entry I already made into USD? Perfect! I love wasting my time. And the grande finale is IF you have the audacity to settle up promptly to pay back your friends you may accidentally RUIN everyone else‚Äôs requests that may not have been submitted. But don‚Äôt worry this only happens SOMETIMES. The one and only positive is that because ‚ÄúBUGS‚Äù it can no longer link payment through Venmo, which is its own very special disaster, that only ever wants me to open a crypto credit card. CANNOT wait to delete this app once I‚Äôm ‚Äúsettled up.‚Äù It‚Äôll only take about 3 more weeks for everyone to be able to submitted their 5 request a day.

TL;DR See end of review for a better alternative. 

This app used to be great, but I haven‚Äôt used it in a few years. Picked it back up for a road trip and found that it now bombards you with (timed) ads for premium. I wouldn‚Äôt mind dropping $0.99 on it or what have you for the week I‚Äôm going to use it, but let‚Äôs be real: a decent spreadsheet on any platform with collaboration offers essentially the same value. So, Splitwise has apparently gone the route many apps have of trying to justify the higher price with additional ‚Äúvalue‚Äù by adding unnecessary features to the premium subscription like bank sync. I don‚Äôt want all that: I just want an app that offers an easier UI than the aforementioned spreadsheet. But roping me into a subscription for that essentially offline functionality leaves a bad taste in my mouth. 

I recommend Splittr as a more reasonable alternative from an indie developer. You can use it entirely free and offline, or you can buy a 1-month ‚Äúpass‚Äù rather than being roped into a subscription you have to cancel. They have reasonably-priced long term options at the time of writing, as well.

I‚Äôve actually never left a review for a app before but after my experience with splitwise I felt compelled to do so. I‚Äôve used it for past couple of years to track expenses with group travel and also split expenses with my ex for our son. My use has been very basic and do not require the use of and of the pro features. Recently they limited the amount of transactions you can input a day to just 4! This is ridiculous as most people input all their transactions at the end of the month or at the end of a trip. The monthly fee they are asking is way to high for normal casual users who just want to use it when they got on trips with friends etc. a app that was so good and useful is pretty much ruined by being forced to watch a ad for the pro version and then being limited to only four transactions. Company seems greedy to me. I‚Äôll just go back to my excel spreadsheets. The multiple other negative reviews should be clear to splitwise they made a wrong business decision here. I guess your idea was, ‚Äúwe are getting popular now, let‚Äôs see how we can make more money.‚Äù Looks like your decision made you less popular‚Ä¶

Really disappointed that Splitwise has decided to put most of their features behind a paywall. I get asking for subscriptions for more premium actions like reporting and maybe even currency conversions, but now they won‚Äôt even let you add more than 2 transactions in the same day unless you buy ‚ÄúPro‚Äù. Their entire value proposition as an app is that people can easily add and split their expenses, limiting to 2 per day seems totally arbitrary and makes the free version useless. I‚Äôd honestly rather go back to spreadsheets for tracking household expenses with my partner than pay $5 a month just to enter 3 expenses in a day instead of 2. Didn‚Äôt even get to see what else they‚Äôve pay-gated because I hit the new entry limit and gave up so quickly. I expect there are still options out there that aren‚Äôt so stingy on their Free version features. If not, Google Sheets it is.

I used to rely on this app quite a lot and found it helpful for households and group trips, but now I can‚Äôt imagine why anyone would pay for such basic features. Seems like a cash grab where they didn‚Äôt consider customer impact or interests at all.

Review Title: Great app! But my friends can‚Äôt handle the minimize transactions setting.
Review Text:
I recently tried Splitwise for the first time for a trip with a group of friends. Some friends wouldn‚Äôt log into Splitwise. Some friends wouldn‚Äôt  check their emails. And a couple of friends couldn‚Äôt understand how everyone could be settled up if they didn‚Äôt pay back the person who originally paid for a specific item. Guys, Splitwise tells you how to settle up to reduce transactions so that everyone comes out the same. Minds were blown. I could literally sense that smoke was about to come out of their ears. Of course, it would have helped if they logged into the app, or checked their email or paid attention by the 2nd or 3rd or 5th time I told them, ‚ÄúGuys, open Splitwise! It literally breaks it all down for you!‚Äù Minimum transactions are not for the faint of heart. 

Bottom line: Splitwise is great! But after that trip, I may have lost a little bit of faith in the human race.

Review Title: Used for 3 years‚Ä¶Now I‚Äôm fed up
Review Text:
The recent update that limits the amount of expenses you can log is ridiculous. I can understand locking receipt scanning and analytics behind a paywall. I could maybe even tolerate the 10 second wait times between logging new expenses. 

However, only allowing 3 expenses a day before having to pay $40 a year per person just to add as many as you want is pure highway robbery. Your base service is not worth $40 a year. I can replace it with like 20 different apps or Excel for free, and my only annoyance would be the setup time and time lost inviting all my roommates to a new app, which they will gladly join if it means not having to shell out to a scummy company. 

At the end of this month, I‚Äôm done with this app and everyone else should be too. Stop the subscription price gouging garbage for something that should be $10 a year AT MOST with a good free option. I get that app development and hosting isn‚Äôt free. But it‚Äôs not $40 from all your users every year expensive either. Especially when your ‚Äúunique‚Äù product could be cloned in a month by any sophomore CS student at any university on the planet.

I‚Äôm someone who goes through finances once a month. I review all my transaction in all my accounts to check for accuracy and to monitor spending habits. I use that same time each month to enter receipts in Splitwise. This has worked out fine, until a couple weeks ago when Splitwise added a limit to how many receipts a user can enter each day. Now I can only enter four receipts at a time without paying $5/month. The app is now completely useless to me. 

This tactic isn‚Äôt new for app developers. When apps become moderately successful, they slowly remove all utility from their free versions in favor of pro versions. It‚Äôs a bait and switch, plain and simple. LastPass did the same thing, which drove away a chunk of their user base. Splitwise will be ‚Äúwise‚Äù to rethink their approach for the future. 

I‚Äôll be deleting my Splitwise account in favor of an Excel spreadsheet. Is the UI less appealing? Will the process be slightly more difficult? Will I be urging friends to abandon the app every chance I get? Yes, yes and absolutely.

After misleading instruction my friends and I tried using Splitwise Pay instead of Venmo or PayPal as it made it seem like it would go from one checking account to the other. This was NOT the case. It took a full week to get payments into a ‚ÄúSplitwise Wallet‚Äù during which time it was listed as ‚Äúpending‚Äù with no clarity on when it would be available. After that long wait I was informed that the money would actually just be sitting with Splitwise and not in my Checking account. Which is essentially like Venmo or PayPal only it took a full week to process and you can‚Äôt readily use Splitwise Pay with anything?!  

Do not know why on Earth they would choose to create a product that is actually WORSE than the alternatives currently supported. AND WHATS EVEN MORE CRIMINAL‚Ä¶ is they were very misleading about how this would function and that it could take essentially 10 days to get money in this way! as it takes 2 additional days to transfer from Wallet to your Bank Account!!!

So Frustrating and a shame they would release something and not be clear about it.

I recently purchased a condo that my daughter is sharing with a roommate.  Being new to the "landlord game", I immediately realized what a challenge expense sharing can be, especially with three different people paying specific bills.  

The app's focus on aggregate debts (rather than a balance-based expense ledger) was initially an adjustment for me, but the benefit of SplitWise's simplified approach quickly became apparent.   It was only a matter of days before my daughter and her roommate began using it for additional expenses like groceries, ride shares, concert tickets, etc. 

I haven't needed to contact support, but the clean & logical UI, combined with thorough & concise documentation minimize the learning curve of using the app.  After considering about a dozen expense sharing services, I had narrowed my list down to SplitWise and one of its competitors.  Thus far, I've not had any regrets with my choice!

I‚Äôve used splitwise for YEARS for group trips and splitting expenses with roommates. They‚Äôve now limited the amount of expenses you can submit per day to only 4 per day, and they force you to you stare at their subscribe screen for 10 seconds before they even let you add an expense. Literally fire the Product Manager who suggested this. I understand that Splitwise is a company that‚Äôs been around for a while and now needs to monetize, but this is not the way. I‚Äôm now looking for a different  app to use to settle up my most recent trip since we all want to pay each other back asap (we have to pay our credit card bills) but it would take us over a week to input all of our expenses with Splitwise‚Äôs daily limits. I have 30 expenses to add that I couldn‚Äôt add on the trip because I didn‚Äôt have wifi. With the 4 expense per day limit, it would take me 8 days to add them all. Ridiculous. Splitwise, change this immediately. At least give us the decency of a limit of 10 or something. 4/day is a slap in the face to your long time users.

This is the MOST convenient app for dividing payments amongst multiple people or groups. I‚Äôve used this app twice now while traveling internationally, and it‚Äôs never been so easy to record and remit debts on the go. My favorite part is that the app tallies up what everyone owes each other, and at the end of the trip when you‚Äôre ready to settle up, it does all the math for you in order to reduce the amount of transactions going back and forth. So easy. 

Upgrading to Pro, so you can convert currency with one click, amongst other perks, is definitely worth the upgrade. Especially if you frequently travel internationally with others. It‚Äôs not really necessary if you don‚Äôt leave the states though in my opinion. 

I can‚Äôt recommend Splitwise enough!! And this is coming from someone who very much dislikes unnecessary smart phone apps.

Myself and my roommates have used Splitwise for years to keep track of splitting utility and other costs.  It‚Äôs been very helpful. It‚Äôs a little uncomfortable putting all that detailed info into an app and I‚Äôm not totally sure how much they analyze it/mine it for data, which is why the 4 stars.  I should look more into their privacy policies but I‚Äôm guessing they analyze it as much as they want for their own business purposes.  Also, it would be neat if they had some kind of graph so you could see how much the group or you are spending on different categories over  time.

All in all, though, keeping it simple and uncluttered is probably the best approach.

It‚Äôs also useful because it links with Venmo and Paypal or you can record a ‚Äúcash‚Äù payment between you and someone else.

Review Title: How to ruin a 5 star experience
Review Text:
Splitwise used to be wonderful and I recommended it after every group trip as a way to track and split group costs.  During my most recent experience with the app I noticed they made some changes to their business model. Unless you want to pay for Splitwise Pro- which seems like overkill for a person who uses this app ~3x a year- you have to watch an ad (for splitwise pro) while submitting each individual expense, you can only submit up to 3 expenses per day (what??!) AND, most ludicrously, you are CAPPED at inviting people at 10 invitations. A business that limits the number of times you can invite other users to ALSO use their product must be doomed.
Splitwise- you have a good product!! Surely, this is not necessary. Google yourself. The recent feedback is not pretty ü•¥. I‚Äôd happily pay cents per transaction to avoid all this friction. There must be other way to make money than destroying what was an enjoyable user interface. Yet another subscription model. Sigh.

I‚Äôve used Splitwise for years, as a Pro subscriber. The core of their service works great but they keep disappointing me.

For example, I have an old Venmo account that I needed to create for rent, but I do not use Venmo. Splitwise does not allow you to unpair your Venmo account. I tried Splitwise Pay, their service that lets you pay directly from Splitwise. It would sometimes take more than a week to get my money and there was no way to specify in app that you don‚Äôt want to use Splitwise Pay‚ÄîI had to contact customer service and have them shut down the account.

Just a couple examples there. The final straw that made me unsubscribe from Pro and seek another service was that without fixing the gaps in their feature set, they added daily transaction limits to try to push people toward Pro, and force free users to watch ads. It used to be that you could use the core features easily and you would pay for Pro for the power user extras. Further, they made the confusing choice not to inform their existing users of this change before it took place.

And the AUDACITY to do this while basic things such as removing a payment method are missing, and have been for years, and without adding any new value to the app. They want to push people to pay them more money, without having done the work to deserve it. I can no longer recommend this app to friends and I no longer want to support them.

Goodbye, Splitwise.

Review Title: Deleting app due to expense entry limit
Review Text:
This app is no longer worth it, and I will no longer be recommending it to people. I used it in the past and had good experiences but I just went to use it again for the first time in a while, only to discover they‚Äôve added expense entry limits!!! The whole point of this app is to be able to simplify paying your friends back when there‚Äôs a lot of expenses/transactions. I used to be allowed to enter unlimited expenses but now I was limited to 4, and I‚Äôve heard other people express that they‚Äôre now limited to only one entry. Ridiculous. 

And this app is definitely not worth $5 a month, if it was $0.99 per month or a one time fee of $5 for unlimited entries then I would pay for it. I‚Äôll be deleting this app and finding another or making my own excel sheet.  

The worst thing to ever happen to the app industry is the rise in subscription models. I refuse to use and support apps that provided a service only to then screw over their current customers and charge for the same service that used to be free.

Review Title: Disingenuous - Would rather just use a spreadsheet
Review Text:
I had never used splitwise before but had seen it on other people's venmo feeds before. After using it for the first time this past weekend, I don't see myself using it ever again.

It doesn't require you to actually manually link any services like venmo or paypal before others in your group choose to "settle up". This means they send money to wherever splitwise thinks it should go, based on your email and phone number. It tried to use my email and sent the payment to a venmo account that doesn't exist. It says the payment is pending, but I know that it will never complete. PLUS the user that sent the payment now has splitwise telling them they are "settled up". This means the payment will take an indeterminate amount of time to fail, and likely the other person will just end up having not paid me. So splitwise essentially caused us to not be able to split the bills lol.

1/5 not impressed. Much easier to just use a spreadsheet if that's the only way I am going to get paid.

Review Title: Used to be great, please change!
Review Text:
I have used this app religiously for 5+ years, living with multiple different groups of roommates, going on roadtrips, with shared family expenses, etc. If nothing had changed this would be undoubtedly a glowing 5 star review‚Ä¶

However, with the update several months ago to limit daily split bills to 3, the functionality of the app is completely taken away. Very frequently, I will put more than 3 things in here in a day, and the beauty of the app used to be that multiple things could all be added and everything would be simplified with who owes what. Now I have to go out of my way to make sure I combine receipts together to avoid hitting the limit, completely defeating the purpose of the app. Additionally, the 10 second waiting period just telling me to pay for ‚Äúpro‚Äù is ridiculous. That space could be used for an ad to create a revenue instead of needing ‚Äúpro‚Äù level.

I know that a revenue must be made somehow, and I would gladly be willing to pay a one time $5 or $10 fee for this app, but it is definitely not an app that I (or hardly anyone) would be willing to pay a $5 monthly subscription for. And currently that is the only way to access what used to be the normal functionality of the app. 

You are already starting to lose your loyal customers. Please make a change before it is too late and this app is no longer a viable option for anyone!

Review Title: Disappointed In Surprise Pay to Play
Review Text:
I have loved splitwise and used it for years. However, I was disappointed in the new year by the surprise transition of splitwise pro without any kind of heads up by the company and for a new need to pay for a service that had previously been free. We have switched over to tricount, and while not as intuitive as splitwise, it gets the job done for free.

If splitwise wanted or needed to add a subscription to your base app, you should not retract a previously free service. In my opinion, the additional benefits of pro are not worth the money and the free version transaction limit seems unnecessary. Use adds if you need to make more money.

Overall, I might have paid for the pro version if the company hadnt sprung it on us. It seems disingenuous to a previously very loyal consumer base. I don‚Äôt see the need to pay for splitwise when there are other apps that do essentially the same thing for free.

I‚Äôve been a Splitwise user for nearly as long as it has been in existence. I use it to divide finances and bills between myself and my partner. Recently, they began charging an absurd about to ‚Äúsubscribe‚Äù to their service, which had previously all been free. So they imposed a strict shutoff of access to multiple submissions per day, making it so that without a paid subscription you can only add 3 expenses per day or week (some ridiculously restrictive time period), meanwhile I had been using it just fine with no restrictions to sum up monthly home and grocery bills only a few days before that. The restriction came in very suddenly. 

I understand they are trying to monetize, but they need to find another way to make a profit without charging users directly for the extremely simple services. I doubt this will happen though, so I am awaiting a knockoff version from the army of willing and annoyed Redditors, some of whom have dev/engineering experience, who are going to build their own version.

I used this app multiple times on different trips and loved it. It was such a simple and easy way to keep track of who paid for what, who owes what, etc. during a trip. I hadn‚Äôt used it for a while as I didn‚Äôt have the need, but recently went on a trip with a group of friend and recommended we all use this app to keep track of our expenses. You can imagine my SHOCK and HORROR when i found out you now can only submit 4 expenses a day! I can live with the annoying ad you have to watch, but only allowing 4 expenses a day is ABSURD! This app went from being useful to TRASH. Now I have to go find a new app (competitor) that lets me do what I used to be able to do for free. Super annoying and VERY POOR business decision on their part. I understand monetization and I fully support them having a Pro version with more advanced features. But unfortunately they‚Äôve now made the free version virtually unusable. 

If you‚Äôre in the market for a free app to easily manage shared expenses between friends, look elsewhere.

Review Title: It's the time to search another App
Review Text: I used to LOVE this app! I've used it for years. I opened the app today to add in my expenses for a couple recent grocery shopping trips for my roommates and each time I wanted to add an expense I had to wait for ad to play, which was new and annoying, but I dealt with it. Then after I added 4 (just 4!) expenses I was met with a pop-up saying that I had reached the maximum number of expenses I could input today and I had to either upgrade to the pro version or wait until tomorrow to input more. I commonly put in 10 or 15 expenses all at once so l only have to do money management once or twice a month. There is nothing in the pro version of this app that I will use and it's not worth the money just to be able to add my expenses when just a month ago l could add as many as I wanted to for free; which is why I specifically downloaded this app, as a free way to manage expenses with my roommates and partner. If this doesn't get fixed i and many other will roll over to some other app soon.

I don‚Äôt pay for premium, but I love that it will split everything equally for free!  The ‚Äúsimplify debts‚Äù feature is cool, too.  My husband, sister, and brother-in-law go out together all the time, and this makes it so we don‚Äôt have to pay each other back every time.  We just see who is behind in our group, and that person pays for the next meal/event :)  we have yet to ‚Äúsettle up‚Äù in the past 3 years, and just keep rotating who pays so it stays relatively close.  Love it!  

We also use it for trips with other people, we have told so many people about splitwise!  I just set up a group for a trip to Puerto Rico with our best friends.  We can add the rental car cost, hotel costs, meals, etc.  never have to awkwardly ask a waiter to split a check again!

No more bickering about who owes what to whom! Just use this simple to use app and get on sharing the good times with friends and family, knowing you‚Äôll each pay your fair share at the end of the day. It‚Äôs very simple to use, allowing you to enter expenses incurred by just part of a group, or allocating expenses for kids to the parents, etc. etc. in these hard times we all need to watch where our money goes but without being unfair to anyone (including ourselves!). This app does all the hard slog for you, and makes sure if there are any questions as to where did the money go that all the information is right there! Great app- we always use it when we‚Äôre out with friends out on vacation in a group!

Review Title: Love it - best app for sharing and splitting bills
Review Text:
The best application for sharing and splitting cost and bills with the group. We often travel in the group, and always challenged how to properly keep track of the bills, who pays, who owes. also being able to manage it in different currencies was a challenge. We tried many applications, none non-worked well until I just found a splitwise. it‚Äôs really doing the job!  it‚Äôs great! we use it for trips and also manage other shared finances.  it allows to settle the bill at any time. it allows to do different currencies and it allows also to attach  the picture (of the bill) and add notes. It is awesome.  I hope it will stay this way. love the application! 
Simple and provides all needs functionality. Kudos to designers and developers!

I‚Äôve been using the free version for years with my wife to track our finances. I love the no-frills, just simple 50/50 split ledger of all things where it doesn‚Äôt matter when we pay each other back, and often we just don‚Äôt and whoever owes more will start paying for things until it evens out. But without warning, suddenly there are unskippable ads to pay for pro, with a newly added limit of three transactions per day. I don‚Äôt want or need any of the pro features, I just want to enter transactions. It makes the app basically useless for any kind of normal splitting without paying $5 a month - not that I can‚Äôt afford that but I absolutely can‚Äôt abide the way they went about forcing people to either pay or find an alternative. Three transactions a day is so severely annoying that it sends the message that they only want paid users. Why even offer any features for free? What a joke

This used to be one of my favorite apps that I used pretty often. I had personally gotten at least 10-12 of my friends on this app few years back. Then this app  became one of the most hated apps I have.

It started implementing ad walls and per day limits for transactions. This made the app almost unusable for me and my friends because like most people I don‚Äôt enter my transactions daily. I generally do it all every few months.

I explored getting the premium option. Their chart analysis options are bad and the UX is not appealing or intuitive. They added the possibility of getting transactions directly from bank account which almost would have made it worth it.

I ended up buying premium for a month only to realize even their premium capabilities are pretty worthless. Splitwise lets you add accounts for transaction but they still limit you to only 3 cards! Average users have 4-5 cards if not more. So even if pay for premium, I have to still manually enter transactions for half of my cards/bank accounts. You can‚Äôt use their premium features on desktop. It‚Äôs hard to get to the connected accounts.

To summarize, this app and its developers need a solid plan and lot of UX changes to make its premium be actually attractive to users instead of just annoying/nagging them until they buy or more realistically leave.

Review Title: Splitwise sends your funds to the recipient‚Äôs email‚Ä¶
Review Text: Splitwise sends your funds to the recipient‚Äôs email instead of directly to the recipient making it difficult for them to access unless they‚Äôve already verified their email with Venmo. This is the problem I unfortunately ran into with my family so either pay outside of Splitwise or go through the verification process ahead of time with Venmo, my best advice. Other than this, it‚Äôs a great app to help divide up expenses. It was a great help for our family overall and I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll probably use it again given their excellent customer service. Splitwise was quick to respond to my questions and complaints regarding this particular situation so they are def on the up & up.

The price of the subscription service is just unreasonable. And is advertised aggressively in the app which is annoying. It‚Äôs is a useful app, although other have most overlapping features, I would be ok with a one-time payment but a subscription? No. 

A feature enhancement would be to improve what happens when you go from an equal split to a precise monetary amount for some. Imagine you go to a restaurant, you first decide we all split equally or you just want to register the money in the app so you don‚Äôt forget. But then someone had only a drink and no food so they want to be able to put their precise amount in. The rest of the group would still be happy to split equally, so easy as that, there should be a mixed mode that when you switch from equal shares to fixed amounts that the ration is still kept. At the moment you have to do all the math yourself‚Ä¶

One of my favorite apps, but a couple of things. Highly disappointed with the new free version feature where there is a delay in adding expense for 10 or more seconds to get you to buy paid version. You are better then that! I would pay for a perpetual version 4.99 or something but a subscription is ridiculous. Think of a different business model. 

Also, the pay via Venmo is not very functional. It assumes you use the same email as your Venmo as you do for you Splitwise. Anytime someone uses this feature the money gets lost and doesn‚Äôt go to the right account. I suggest changing it to be able to lookup user and actually see their picture to reduce the likelihood of error. 

I would give the app 5 stars, but the new wait feature for the free version makes me drop it down to 3.

Review Title: Suddenly charging for services that were free
Review Text:
I have been a loyal user of Splitwise for years and used it to manage utilities for the house I share with roommates. It‚Äôs always been very easy and convenient, but over the years I have accumulated more of the utility payments due to being here longest. This month, I went to add my four payments in and Splitwise will NOT let me add four list items anymore without upgrading. 

This is outrageous - I‚Äôm already spending a lot of my own money on the cost of living and paying for a significant amount of the utilities out of pocket, and now Splitwise won‚Äôt even let me settle up all of my monthly accounts all at once unless I pay an additional fee? This is especially annoying because my roommates may settle up the balances before I have a chance to add the addition expenditures - it creates more chaos overall and renders this app way less useful. One star rating unless this stupid policy is changed swiftly.

This is a great concept, and inputting charges is easy enough, but it‚Äôs not easy to find what charges are assigned to you. And when trying to make a withdrawal, the app successfully to connected to my bank on attempts multiple, and then on the final step of the process I got an error message saying there were no connected funding sources. This was wildly frustrating as I have used plaid to connect to my bank before and I‚Äôve never had an issue. I was not able to make a withdrawal from this app without paying the expedited fee. Any time I tried to connect to my funding sources without paying the fee, I got an error message, but of course, when I tried (using the same funding sources) after selecting to make a withdrawal but to pay the expedited fee, it worked miraculously. I‚Äôm sure it was a glitch in the app but it truly felt like a scam.

My wife and I have used splitwise to track expenses for probably about 8 years now. A few months back I started getting huge interstitial ads upselling the ‚Äúpro‚Äù paid version (which was annoying, but fine given that it‚Äôs otherwise free). Suddenly today I find that basic app functionality has now been buried behind a paywall, and after adding a couple expenses I‚Äôve been told I‚Äôve reached the limit of free entries and have to pay to add more today.

I‚Äôm all for supporting the developers of this app and would be willing to upgrade if there was a family plan available, however $40/yr per person is a steep ask for the functionality this app offers, and suddenly revoking basic functionality is a really shady way to conduct business. Shame on the developers for continually degrading service in an attempt to squeeze money out of their users.

Review Title: Will be transitioning to another app
Review Text:
I have been a long-time user, lover, and supporter of Splitwise for over 5 years. I spread the word to all of my friends and got many people using the app.

As of this week, Splitwise added a new feature where you have to wait 10 seconds before uploading any new expense if you have the free version and don‚Äôt pay for Splitwise Pro. I understand they are trying to find more ways to monetize and encourage upgrading to Pro, but with this feature, they will lose me as a user. This is one of the most ridiculous and aggressive ways I have seen an app harass its free users into upgrading to a paid version.

Although it breaks my heart, I don‚Äôt support and agree with this methodology and as of today have started looking for other splitting apps to migrate to. If this feature is removed, I may consider coming back but as the app stands now, I can‚Äôt continue using it. Thank you for all the good years.

Review Title: You used to be somewhat handy - now it‚Äôs trash
Review Text: Some brainiac in product management thinks that he or she can goad you into signing up for the so called premium features by limiting the number of transactions you can enter in one day and showing these stupid 10 second pauses between transactions that you enter. So instead of adding features that are compelling enough to actually pay for the premium version, they figure that they will down grade the free version and make you pay for the features that you previously had. Brilliant. This is an app that already has a rudimentary and sometimes confusing UI/UX that hasn‚Äôt been updated in years. Sounds like they don‚Äôt have a product strategy, a clear product roadmap or a way to monetize this product, which means that it‚Äôs days are numbered. Will find a different solution. In the meantime, We will use a simple Google sheet that does the same calculations instead.

Review Title: Best App 1st time it was so good I‚Äôm rating it
Review Text:
My friends and I went on a trip to France. We used the app. it exceeded our expectations. It is very easy to split expenses and adjust for personal increases. It allowed all of us to not worry about evening out bills and instead to take turns paying so that at the end of the trip we were almost all settled app. The app is very flexible in that it allows you to split costs between which ever group members have incurred the cost and it allows you to adjust the splits if necessary. For example, if one person‚Äôs share was $20 more than the others the app will account for that. 
It was also great to chose the currency. Since we where in France we used euros. Really great app even the non tech group members liked it.

Review Title: Used to be great; now pushes you into expensive subscription
Review Text:
As other reviewers have pointed out, the app now has timeouts when adding expenses and prevents you from adding more than 4 per day unless you subscribe to the $5/month ‚ÄúPro‚Äù version. This makes the app bothersome to use in the best case, and useless in others.

To the developer: it‚Äôs understandable for you to want a steady revenue stream from subscriptions. This app, however, has very simple functionality that has not changed in many years. Asking $5/month for it is disproportionate; $5-10 per year would be easier for users to accept. Also, I urge you to reconsider the hard limit of 4 expenses per day for the free version of the app. It‚Äôs a change that breaks the app for many users and pushes them away rather than encouraging them to subscribe. My advice is to keep the timeouts but ditch the limit.

Review Title: Expense limits make the app unusable
Review Text: I‚Äôve been a dedicated Splitwise user for years. I only need the basic features in my day to day, but I‚Äôll upgrade to Splitwise Pro from time to time when I need the added firepower (e.g., traveling across multiple countries, when the currency conversion feature is a HUGE help). However, Splitwise recently introduced limits where I can only add 2-3 transactions per day unless I pay for the upgrade to Pro. This makes the app totally impractical to use for its basic function: recording expenses. Rather than pay every month to make it work again, I plan to find one of the many, many other apps that do the same exact thing and download one of those instead. It‚Äôs a shame, because before today I would have given Splitwise 5 stars (I‚Äôve been a big advocate and converted several of my friends to using it in the past), but as it is now it‚Äôs completely unusable.

Review Title: Ruined by most annoying and time-wasting pay gate imaginable
Review Text:
Used to be a great app but they ruined it with the most annoying monetization they could think of. They now limit to 3 expenses per day and added a 10-second ‚Äúwaiting period‚Äù between adding those 3 expenses. Makes this app completely unusable, like they are actively TRYING to annoy people and waste their time. Nobody adds expenses as they go for things like group trips. Everyone adds expenses in bulk later. This ridiculous update makes that totally impractical.

The craziest part is this app‚Äôs whole value prop was that it SAVES you time figuring out shared expenses, but they added a pay gate that aggressively WASTES YOUR TIME! 

So while you‚Äôre waiting until tomorrow to add your 4th expense, you can easily find alternative free apps or just use a shared spreadsheet instead. Not worth paying for this, especially to company that treats their users like this.

This was one of my favorite apps being simple and efficient to use.  For users needing more features, they made a paid pro version that provides that.  Now, to promote the sale of the pro version, they actively made the app worse for free users.  There are now intentional delays if you want  register several expenses in a day (they force you to wait 15 seconds while you can't do anything), and a hard cap on expenses per day of you are even willing to put up with the waiting time.

This is an example of a team that uses resources and time to make the experience of users *worse* to drive sales, rather than making their pro version worth buying.  If one pays for the pro version, what's to stop them from coming up with a higher priced subscription and just make everything else garbage?  The design direction of this app, deliberately inconveniencing users to drive sales, is disrespectful.

Review Title: Could be a great app but it‚Äôs not.  Use another service
Review Text:
From a DevOps and Application Delivery standpoint‚Ä¶ this app is a joke for 2024 standards. 

It takes weeks to get set up due to their process, and snail-pace responses‚Ä¶ all while they reject your friends sending money to you. 

You‚Äôll have to show your social security card and passport as well as an ID, take photos, and more just to get paid from your friend‚Ä¶ but they don‚Äôt tell you that until your transactions are returned to your friends for not completing their dozen or more verification steps.

Then if there is a question or issue, it takes a week for them to send an email to you‚Ä¶ to then resolve, while your payments from Friends actually expire.

They also don‚Äôt require you to get set up before using it‚Ä¶ so then Your contstantly having to explain to people that their payment didn‚Äôt go through because of Splitwise delay at authorizing users.  And have your friends re-enter and submit for payment. 

Terrible experience.  The whole group agreed the app doesn‚Äôt deliver convenience.

Review Title: New Limitations Have Ruined the App
Review Text:
This was a wonderful app for years, but then the developers decided to push the Pro version of their app to the point where you can only add four transactions a day, which is prohibitively low even for a casual user. Since I have used the app a fair amount, I would consider paying for Pro at a rate of something like $1.99. However, even with Pro features, it‚Äôs still a very basic app and is not worth $5. The extra features, such as charts, aren‚Äôt much of a value added in my opinion given its core purpose is automatic bill splitting, which is very helpful but just a short term use. There‚Äôs no reason to have a trend analysis. 

I would suggest to the developers to differentiate between individual users who are only interested in the core purpose of bill splitting vs users who might be using it more substantially (likely a small portion of their customers).

Review Title: Why take drastic measures when you have great customer base :(
Review Text:
Forcing every user to upgrade to pro subscription to put more than 3 daily expenses has just killed the product. It was my goto app to split expenses with my friends and used the tag feature to see where I spend most in a given month. 
I know there is a generic response Splitwise team will give, about preventing spam and bots as well as telling us that communicating changes to customers over app is better than unnecessary emails.. 
Guys you are in the software world, any rate limiting or api behavior change has to be notified to the user otherwise they will be upset and there will be new startups which will capitalize on this aspect and you are at a risk of losing customers. Try to have great value added services at cheaper price. Remember Splitwise is just to put expenses and see the insights on spending, make that as your strong moat.

I use this app for tracking bills in a multi family home. It helps me a lot ! but what I would like to see is for example in a group, if it says Mary owes $100, I would like to know what EXACTLY  $100 is owed in (such as a utility, cable, etc). It doesn‚Äôt show specifics once you put the bill in, just the total amount owed. Also, I would like the option of the user disappearing off the owed bill once they have paid. This would make it SO much easier to keep track of who paid what, instead of me typing in a note every time when a payment submitted as to what bill the payment is applied for.  Thanks for reading for my suggestion. Please let me know if I am doing something wrong and these options already exist. - Jennifer

The Splitwise app is great for everything you‚Äôd expect to need it for, but the recent decision to add a daily expense limit is both terrible from a functionality perspective and also was poorly communicated to users.

I, and I think many other users, often use Splitwise for trips and other short term expense tracking where there are many different small expenses that need to be split up. This means that I‚Äôm often not using the app for months at a time and then need to add 20+ expenses all at once. With the daily expense limit, this is pretty much impossible. No way am I going to go back day after day and add a small chunk of expenses. And paying for pro is kind of silly because I only use the app every so often.

Further, rolling out this change with essentially no warning is just rude. Why??

Splitwise is a super cool idea and my friends and I used it for my bff‚Äôs bachelorette party. I have some feedback. 

-I was able to pay through PayPal but half the girls didn‚Äôt have PayPal so now we‚Äôre trying to figure out how they get their money. Don‚Äôt offer a payment until someone puts in the email associated to the account that way if they don‚Äôt put in the email for PayPal, I can‚Äôt pay them through PayPal bc now we need to figure out how she gets the money and it‚Äôs literally been taken out of my PayPal already and she still can‚Äôt figure out how to receive it.

-I didn‚Äôt see anywhere that explained what to do so as soon as someone added a dollar amount and split it between us all, I paid it. Needs be more intuitive or have some kind of pop up like wait until all your friends add the amounts before you pay so you‚Äôre not having to pay people in multiple transactions. That just wasn‚Äôt clear to wait until all transactions were added until you ‚Äúsettle‚Äù. Make that more clear somehow. Hope that makes sense?

Thank you!! Cool app idea, can‚Äôt wait to see it be more intuitive.

Found splitwise very useful for settling a 
 group cost for a wedding trip among 17 people, with numerous couples. 

It was ok adding costs using the "split by shares" feature for couples, however it would be better to be able to set the share amount on a per-person basis, as all couples were paying jointly. Without that feature it was annoying adding each cost, and when we had to add another party to the group I had to update all of the costs again. 

Also, at the end two people were owed money (myself and one other), however it was easier for me to act as the "bank" so all owed money would be sent to me and I would pay back the one other person owed. Splitwise has the "simplify group debts" feature, but that still produces a more complicated array of who owes whom. It would be simpler to communicate the final tally if there was an option to set one person as the "bank", especially since most of the people are not signed up (nor want to) to splitwise, and I am communicating the costs to them. 

Otherwise it was very useful and I'd use it again and recommend it to others!

Review Title: Used to love this app until they limited transactions
Review Text: I‚Äôve used this app for several years and loved it. Used it both for US currency and when traveling out of the country. BUT in the last week, without any notice, they limited the number of transactions that one can enter per day in the free version. I think it‚Äôs 3 (it‚Äôs not like I can find the number on their app; had to go on line to see what others had found happening).  Sometimes that‚Äôs fine, but if I go to several stores in one day, it‚Äôs very inconvenient. I‚Äôm now looking at different apps for the same purpose, since on a trip, this will make the app pretty useless. Hoping they change back, since I‚Äôd think they‚Äôll lose a lot of business if they continue with this.

Review Title: Has precious spot on my Home Screen
Review Text: I love SplitWise! Been using it for several years now, it‚Äôs now on my main Home Screen because I use it so often. It‚Äôs so much easier than constantly go back and forth for each little payment. Instead, I‚Äôm able to keep a running tab with my friends and family. And we will settle up if the balance gets too high or if we want to close it out. The Venmo integration works perfect and I‚Äôve never had issues receiving payment or paying someone. I love that you can split a bill by dollar amount, percentage, or number of shares, it‚Äôs really flexible! SplitWise is a must have for group trips!!

Review Title: Horrible Software with ZERO Customer Service
Review Text: My friends stumbled across this app and we were hosting a party and needed to figure expenses. I signed up and accidentally mistyped my email address. No problem right? I‚Äôll have to verify and then I can fix the problem? I work in software. That‚Äôs standard practice. Not with Splitwise. My friends started VENMO‚Äôing this wrong email address and have yet to receive their payments back. Change the address right? Can‚Äôt do it unless the current (incorrect) email address is confirmed. What??? Since it‚Äôs the wrong address can‚Äôt confirm. Great. Contact custom service, right? I have emailed them THREE times to fix the problem with no response. Who is QA‚Äôing this app? I don‚Äôt understand how these simple verifications are implemented in an app dealing with money and VENMO. My friends will never see that money again. Thanks Splitwise. You are a terrible app.

Review Title: Love it but could use some changes
Review Text: The app makes it super easy to split up expenses. You can create a group and choose who paid and who you want to split it from in that group if all were not involved.
