I wish it would give an option for the payer to say the bill was settled and have it close out without deleting the expense. I use it to split things with my roommates and it can get confusing sometimes keeping track when expenses don‚Äôt close. I have to make sure to add comments on them to keep track. It would be such a great feature if they would add something that would allow you to settle the bill so it would remove itself from the screen.

Every single month you guys split my bills so erratically. Your app constantly makes mistakes.. my inquiry is whether I‚Äôm
Being blocked from portions of my group account because I feel like either your app is absolutely pointless and flaw or absurdly that it does not do its task properly in any way other than the clean look of it. Every single month there have been comically large mistakes on your part. I need to know whether your app is the most inefficient algorithm or program I have ever used in my entire life OR my roommates are trying to hide real bill prices? If it is the latter than your app is cleverly designed to be fair and is difficult to alter with and so a great tool or (I‚Äôm being very sincere and not intentionally malicious) this app is so pointless I would suggest to anyone who is thinking of using it that they would be better of PAYING for a remedial calculator rather than downloading this for FREE.

I‚Äôve used Splitwise for years, usually for trips with friends, and have really liked it. It had the features I needed, and the UI is easy to navigate/use. But the limits they‚Äôve placed on free users in the last year or so are ridiculous. You can only enter 3 or 4 expenses per day, and they have the audacity to say it‚Äôs to prevent spam/bots. If that was the case, the limit should‚Äôve been at least 10-20 expenses/day (paid users get over 1000/day). I know they have to make money, but removing all value for free users is not the way to do it, especially when free alternatives exist. I‚Äôll either be finding a new app or switching to spreadsheets after my current trip is settled up. There‚Äôs also no trial if you sign up for Pro, so you can‚Äôt even see if the added features are worth paying for without paying for them first.

I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for many years and have always appreciated it very much. I loved the graphics, the seamless interface and the convenience. I had never had any issues. 

Then, just today, out of nowhere, I was using the app when suddenly an ad had to be played before adding any expenses. And then, with no warning, after adding in just four expenses, (and watching several ads for Splitwise pro), it said I couldn‚Äôt add any more expenses for the day unless I wanted to purchase the pro version. There was no warning that this might be happening soon. I was in middle of my busy day when this happened. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed. And the price of the pro version is ridiculous!! 

I‚Äôm very very upset and will be telling everyone I know (including on social media) to delete the app as it is now a big inconvenience. Very upsetting.

Review Title: Corporate greed leads to the end of an era
Review Text:
An avid splitwise user for many years, I was shocked at the recent update for the free version. Users will be limited to posting three transactions a day, and to post a new transaction, you must wait through 10 seconds of an advertisement. This has made splitwise virtually unusable. 

Splitwise was THE app for my friend group but we are now moving on to other alternatives. Unfortunately, the reasoning provided to Splitwise users (these changes were instituted due to bots/spam) is suspect and laughable. It‚Äôs clear they‚Äôre pushing users to pay for the pro version. For more information and other users‚Äô experiences, search ‚Äúsplitwise update‚Äù on your favorite search engine and go through the various forums. 

What a shame for such a great app; however, like all good things, they come to an end. This time, however, it‚Äôs due to corporate greed.

Review Title: Wish I knew about it sooner
Review Text: This app makes managing money a breeze! I only need it to track payments between people in my traveling group and it‚Äôs been so helpful, especially for those who are‚Ä¶ mathematically challenged, like I am. It‚Äôs easy to exclude certain people who weren‚Äôt involved in a transaction, or to split costs in different ways (e.g., equally, in shares, percentages, exact amounts.) I like how you can also send reminders via the app for payments if they owe you, rather than awkwardly ask people directly for money lol. I also like the ability to incorporate different currencies. This is so useful and I love it. Thank you for developing it!

This app can be so amazing when planning a big event and sharing the cost with several hosts. BUT OH MY GOODNESS....if anyone "settles up" before all expenses are entered and the whole group is ready, it cause such a headache and take so much more time and energy than it is worth. Suddenly a few hosts are not being included in some of the expenses and then trying to get everyone to back track and reverse payments is insane. As the lead host I look like an idiot because this app does not clearly explain what it means to settle up. 

There should be a way for one person to control when the group is ready to settle so no one does anything until it's time. Now I'm having to recalculate all our expenses, then ask everyone what they have paid to who and then figure out how to redistribute the correct amount owned to and by each host. Ridiculous!

I love the purpose and thoroughness of this app! Desperately needed, saves so much math headaches. 

But when I just wanted to split between a few camping trip peers, the app required unique, verified, real contact info for every single person, just to split costs for one trip. Many people need to split costs with those they may not know well, but even knowing all these people‚Äîit‚Äôs really inconvenient and sleazy to require verified contact info (clearly to try and spread the app more), but it turned the whole group off to the app and now all these potential future users associate the app with being sketchy in its user data requirements. 

Please, don‚Äôt give in to tacky behavior or ‚Äúdark UX patterns‚Äù. Only require user data when it‚Äôs actually necessary. Thank you!

Review Title: Loved but the subscription update was a massive drawback
Review Text: I‚Äôve loved the app for the past few years and think it‚Äôs an amazing product, but the recent features limitations imposed on the free version that can only be unlocked by paying, have been a massive drawback for me. When all my friends are trying to handle expense from a group trip for example, it‚Äôs a pain that we all have to deal with these limitations. And obviously we all don‚Äôt all individually want to pay for a subscription. I‚Äôve honestly just resorted back to using a regular spreadsheet because all the blockers/restrictions on the free version have been such a pain. I don‚Äôt want another subscription and don‚Äôt use the product often enough to justify paying.

Review Title: App charge limit has rendered this app unusable.
Review Text: I have used Splitwise for years and it has always been a great utility for my friends and I. I was very disappointed to find out that they randomly started to limit the number of transactions per day to <3 without a pro account (which is a monthly subscription). The company that owns the app has decided to turn on the money faucet at the expense of ALL of their loyal, long term users trust. This basically makes the app useless for people like myself who regularly submit multiple transactions in a day, or prefer to submit all transactions from a trip in bulk all at once. My friends and I have now reverted to making our own spreadsheets to track our expenses and who was involved. Regardless of how I used to feel about the app, it is now essentially useless to me with these new money hungry changes.

I loved this app when tracking expenses on a recent trip. It was so easy to add an expense then split it with all or just some members of the group. Was also easy to shift between currencies. However the reports of the totals are very confusing. For example I get a report that says ‚Äúyou owe x person $x amount overall‚Äù but then below it says ‚Äúplus 2 more balances‚Äù.  That plus 2 isn‚Äôt a clickable link and there no way to tell what it‚Äôs referring to. Add to that that the currencies won‚Äôt automatically settle up unless you pay for a pro version. The upshot is that we are plugging all of our expenses into a spreadsheet which defeats the purpose of using an app. Overall it‚Äôs got a lot of promise but needs a lot of work.

Review Title: Easiest way to split group expenses
Review Text:
I didn‚Äôt understand the benefit of this app until I used it myself. I thought, ‚ÄúI already know how to divide expenses evenly between people so what is the point of this extra app?‚Äù Well let me tell you‚Ä¶ This is SO MUCH easier than Venmo requests, spreadsheets, whatever else you‚Äôre using to track the amount each person owes. 

Use it on a group trip with friends. Use it to split up a mass lunch order with coworkers. Use it when planning a bridal shower with a bunch of girls you barely know.  I swear it‚Äôll make everything way more efficient and it‚Äôs not just a pointless app to add to your phone!

I used to love Splitwise for keeping track of shared expenses with my friends and family. It was simple, convenient, and free. However, I was very disappointed when they introduced a daily limit of three expenses for free users. This makes the app practically useless for me, as I often have more than three transactions to record in a day. I understand that they need to make money, but I think their pricing for the Pro version is too high for what it offers. I don't need all the extra features, I just want to be able to use the app as I did before. I feel like they are forcing me to pay for something that I don't need or want. I'm sorry, but I'm going to look for an alternative app that respects its users and doesn't limit their functionality. Splitwise, you have lost a loyal customer.

Review Title: Great until basic features were locked behind paywall
Review Text:
Splitwise has been a fantastic app for years, coordinating spending on overseas trips, daily grocery buying and building a house expenses. I didn‚Äôt need any of the more advanced features, as it worked perfectly fine and met my needs as a basic expense tracker. I could do analytics and arrange settle up payments myself. 5 stars for what it did.
But now the free app locks more than 4 entries per day behind the Pro subscription. That breaks the app for me, not least because I have more than 4 things I need to input on the average day but also that I tend to do in bulk a few days later. This paywall breaks the app for me.
I‚Äôll be finding a replacement app and deleting Splitwise as soon as I do. It‚Äôs been a fun ride for more than 5 years, but it‚Äôs now a ‚Äòwise‚Äô time to ‚Äòsplit‚Äô from the app‚Äîand say goodbye.

I have used it twice. The first time with good results. Second time was not effective. You have to have everyone participating to be effective. 
The first time a friend was the person who entered the amounts owed for each of 4 people. I didn‚Äôt do the work just paid out what I owed. 
The second time was between 2 people-myself and another. The other person was to be entering the amounts owed each day. She (my adult daughter) didn‚Äôt ask me for receipts/I didn‚Äôt offer receipts so at the end of our 12 day European trip, we only had entered the first day of travel. By the end of 12 days, many countries with foreign currency, we called our expenses even.

I travel 5-8 times a year all over the world
and my friends come along too. I highly recommend this app because no matter where in the world i am, i can add expense on the go and even take pics of the receipt. I then can split it right there between my friends. Sometimes we  i‚Äôll split the charges on our credit card if we‚Äôre dining but most times we split on splitwise especially when you friends are on a budget but didn‚Äôt have enough $ to enjoy other fun activities at least i can loan them and track it then be repaid in time. it‚Äôs a great app and i always use it as my go to app! 

thanks so much for this.

Review Title: Don‚Äôt keep a group too long after changing members!
Review Text:
I started a SplitWise group for crew coming to my boat. Over a few months there were 8 people involved. Some only in the beginning, some only in the middle, some only at the end. The only people involved in the group at the end had balances, everyone else was settled. I upgraded to Pro so that everything could be converted to USD instead of the three other currencies that we used while sailing, but there was an unavoidable error due to people not being in the group anymore.

Hoping for a refund of the Pro cost. If the Pro functionality doesn‚Äôt work, a refund is due.

ADVICE: Only keep groups with the same people involved. Changing people, settle the group, then start a new one. (Kinda defeats the purpose!)

Review Title: Once-great-app, now almost unusable for non-paying users
Review Text:
I have loved and used Splitwise for more than a decade - using it for various purposes (apartment roommates, friends in a new city, trips etc.) and I‚Äôve felt an intense loyalty to an app that I felt had grown up with me. 

But having recently tried to use it for a family trip I am forced to admit that I will not be using, or recommending, this app in future. My main issue with the app is that it has now placed a limit of 3-5 entries per day for a non-premium user. This is frequently insufficient - and forces me to keep a tally on a note which I then copy over to splitwise. That‚Äôs absolutely not worth having an app - a simple spreadsheet could easily do that job. 

I am also not a user who is absolutely against the idea of paying for apps that add value. But the pricing has to mirror the use case! Splitwise‚Äôs pricing is wildly outrageous, particularly for users planning to use it for trips/vacations. Most such users can expect to use the app actively for 2-3 weeks - $5/month is (imho) too much for such occasional use. 

I am sorry to move away for now - but hopefully the app will make tweaks to its pricing/free tier features in future.

Review Title: It‚Äôs ok but has major problems
Review Text:
Here‚Äôs my use case: I live with my girlfriend and we split all our bills in our household

If you delete a bill that‚Äôs been already paid: now the person who paid the bill owes the other person an amount equivalent to their half. Changing a recurring charge date or amount is truly a nightmare and will always result in a 1-2 month confusion period. 

I‚Äôve had an error that has occurred after coming back from Venmo a number of times where it says the transaction has failed. It‚Äôs a trap! If you manually mark it paid, it will just say that the other person owes you money once it figures it out later. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs their systems reconciling it or the app itself gets into a weird state that requires a restart. 

I hope the people who work on this app dogfood it because it is so painful to use. 

The moment that there‚Äôs an alternative to this app, I‚Äôm sold. To use Splitwise, you have to be a forensic accountant and the tools they provide don‚Äôt help because they lack any real granularity. 

I have the pro version. It‚Äôs offers almost no additional help.

Review Title: Great app, not so great business model
Review Text:
I would have stayed if there‚Äôs a one time payment option or free with ads. I understand developers need to make money, but I‚Äôm only using this app maybe 4 times a year without the fancy split option, I cannot justify the subscription price tag with the effort I‚Äôm saving here, it‚Äôs better than the spreadsheet but not by a lot honestly.

I hope the business model will be reconsidered. The free mode is allowing 3 entries per day, this makes the app practically unusable, tbh this is a very bad way of incentivizing users to subscribe. Honestly I think free with ads would bring in more revenue.

They recently changed the UX so Splitwise pay is the default and you have to dig to find Venmo to settle up.  Splitwise pay is a complete nightmare. My wife unknowingly used it to settle up our rent and another settle for some bills. Normally it goes to Venmo instantly and I can transfer into my account in under 3 days (it‚Äôs usually 1). Instead Splitwise Pay took 3 days for it to land on my side in Splitwise. I transferred the money for bills into my bank account while waiting for the rent to come over in Splitwise, that‚Äôs another 3 days. Then the rent finally clears, I go to transfer it and get the message that it can‚Äôt transfer because it exceeds the $2000 weekly transfer limit. I could not be more disappointed. It feels like you are holding my money hostage when we didn‚Äôt even knowingly switch to your service.

This UX is terrible. You can‚Äôt see your individual payouts from each person, nor how much they owe you. If someone deletes the expense you charged them, it deletes it for everyone else and then you have to charge everyone again. You cannot see how much you paid all together, nor how much in total you owe. The list of payouts they present is very messy and disorganized. Also, the group and non group expenses are confusing, because apparently you have to choose the group and then unclick names, if you do non group expenses, it doesn‚Äôt show on the other users end. Referring to a UX such as Venmo is something you guys should do. It comes second nature to people and would be an easy experience to have a similar UX to Venmo that is more clean and will be an easier transition for new users to understand.

This app is cluttered and requires too many taps to complete entering an expense. I used the free version, and the activity page is so poorly constructed and difficult to follow. You can‚Äôt even search an expense in the free version. It‚Äôs far too time consuming to use. This app only makes sense if you want to add an expense infrequently, but at that point, just use Venmo. If you share a lot of expenses, you spend a lot of time entering it all manually. It also sometimes erases your calculations when you switch to another app for a moment. I know you can get more features in the paid version, but for the app design I have seen already, I‚Äôm not tempted. I don‚Äôt think it should take so many taps just to enter one expense, and I think it‚Äôs unfair such a basic function as a SEARCH should only come with the paid version.

SplitWise was our friend group‚Äôs go-to expense splitting app for ~10 years. We loved it. Apparently, mining our data didn‚Äôt generate as much revenue as SW wanted, so they added a bunch of arbitrary restrictions (ex: daily expense count limits) and took away previously free functionality (ex: adding receipt images) to try to FORCE their users to convert to ‚Äúpremium‚Äù subscribers and pay a ridiculous price for an occasionally-used app. We used to use SW once per year. Paying $40 *per participant*, *per year* to get basic expense splitting and tracking functionality for a single group trip is insane. $5/ year, maybe. Thankfully, there are many free alternatives. Bye bye SplitWise, hello Tricount!  Easier to use, has all of the features we need, and best of all: it‚Äôs FREE!!  They don‚Äôt even *offer* for-pay features or have any ads.

Review Title: Paywall to Use - Free Version Useless
Review Text:
All of the features that would make this app useful are locked behind a subscription. You can not upload photos or add more then 4 items per person a day unless you sign up for a subscription. There is no option to watch ads or get around this. 

In my case I was on a trip where I didn‚Äôt have an internet connection consistently and didn‚Äôt want to open an app every time I paid for something. So everyone on the trip just saved their receipts. Went to use the app and it‚Äôs completely useless without paying. Cannot upload more then 4 items a day, so with 30+ receipts in front of me I would have to waste a lot of time coming back day after day to get them all in. I cannot upload photos anyway even if I could add more items per day. 

For someone who would only use this app once every few months it‚Äôs useless as everyone I went on the trip with doesn‚Äôt want to pay the subscription to use it. 

There are a lot of other ways the company could make money to pay for its hosting for free users but not offering any of them is disappointing. I guess I‚Äôll have to resort to simple math to divide up our trip.

The new restrictions on the free version allow you to put only three expenses in one day. That defeats the whole purpose of the entire app. I feel like if they were so strapped for cash or needed to monetize their service they could find other methods to do that. They could certainly have used advertising, and I think no one would mind. The app provides a convenience not a necessity. Splitting expenses is made easier but certainly it‚Äôs a task that can be accomplished by any normal, rational individual that has been doing it for decades manually. The apps purpose was that it provided the convenience for free and taking that away seems like probably the worst business move they‚Äôre gonna make. They have overestimated how captive their audience is, and the cost of substitution is going to be high

Review Title: I had a +$5000 balance and had no ide
Review Text:
I didn‚Äôt realize Splitwise was adding to a local account and was NOT sending received funds to my bank as they had been before. I did not ask to be signed up for this new ‚Äúservice‚Äù. 
 You would THINK they would make your balance more visible or easy to notice. But no, they intentionally hid it just out of the way so that people will be less likely to happen to find it. It is NOT seen in the account tab. Instead it is in that little icon at the top left that looks more like a calendar than any kind of wallet I‚Äôve ever seen. And even then the balance is totally missable. -2 stars for using this insidious ‚Äúdark pattern‚Äù -1 more star for it being bad enough that I personally fell for it. 

The name for it is even terrible - they don‚Äôt name the service something recognizable like ‚ÄúWallet‚Äù - it‚Äôs called ‚ÄúSplitwise Pay‚Äù, which is not indicative of a storage area for gathered funds at ALL. -1 more star. 

 I thought my money was just dwindling, which is NOT what should be happening with a money app. The daily limit of inputting transactions and weekly limit of $2000 withdraws is also frustrating when I want to sit down and do finance stuff.

We have been using this App for many years now for travels with big and large groups. App has rich features that allow for expenses to be split up among individuals into many different ways. It‚Äôs also great when you want to capture expenses on a single trip when you visit multiple countries with different currencies. App also allows for multiple people to add expenses to the same trip, when expenses are to be shared among a subset of people from the whole group. 
Make your life simple and use the app when you travel.

Review Title: A needless app for those who can‚Äôt math
Review Text:
Where do I start? From the stupid phrasing, to the clunky interface, to having to give yet another startup your financial information. I wish I‚Äôd just told the people requesting through Splitwise that I‚Äôd just Venmo them. 

I tried to add roughly the amount of what I owed to Splitwise Pay, then a couple days later, went to ‚ÄúSettle up‚Äù (don‚Äôt forget that phrase, or you want be able to easily pay the people you owe money to) and it withdrew from my account rather than my balance. Why? Because the transaction has still not shown up as completed almost a week later and already having left my bank account. Or there was some extra step I missed to use their native system. Either way, it‚Äôs garbage and I need to figure out how to get my $300 back out.

Review Title: Subscription Required - End of an Era
Review Text:
For years, Splitwise was a great app for conveniently splitting expenses among friends, roommates, trip-goers, but has recently neutered the free version of the app and lost many long-time users. 

Splitwise now has a daily limit of adding 3 expenses per day. If you want to add more, they require you to subscribe for $5 a month. This is extremely inconvenient and impractical if you‚Äôre logging shared expenses at the end of the month or during a busy trip/vacation. Instead of just managing your finances all at once and as needed, you must now make it a daily chore. (They also didn‚Äôt announce the change to users at all before enacting it; I only found out when I ran into the new limit.)

This simply isn‚Äôt worth the cost when actual free apps like Tricount, Settle Up, and more exist.

Man this is such a great app! I'm using it to split the living expenses with my roommates! We used to keep all our receipts and I would manually calculate at the end of the month, but this app allows us to keep track as we go. So long mountain of receipts! 

One thing that will make this better is if there is like the ability to create some commonly use expenses. Im just lazy and didnt want to keep tying in "grocery" and electricity etc. Would be nice if the "Type in description" part starts to auto fill with these self created expenses, or maybe just recent descriptions, or an option for a pulldown that type of thing ovok~

Review Title: Premium Subscription Useless Unless Everyone Buys
Review Text:
The main pull of getting the premium subscription is so you can set a default split of 60%/40% for example. You‚Äôd think this would make every expense entered into a group at this split. But, the split would only be set for the people who pay $3/month. So, even if you pay the subscription, not all entries will have correct split if others without the subscription add their own expenses. $60/year for two people to set a default split is not worth the price considering it can be done manually. 

Otherwise, the app is great. Wouldn‚Äôt pay for it though!

Review Title: Formerly Great App rendered useless by greedy developers
Review Text: Splitwise used to be great and was a must have for any trips with friends. We would add everything to splitwise and use it to keep track (book a hotel‚Äôs- put it in splitwise, pay for dinner-splitwise, grab a bottle of water for me and I‚Äôll add it to splitwise). Now you can only add 4 expenses a day without paying which makes it completely useless for the purposes we use it. And having to wait for an add an expense for a premium add is annoying, often times we are just adding something in immediately after purchase before we forget the amount. We are struggling through on a current trip because we already started with splitwise before, but after this is settled up it will be deleted and an alternative will be used.

Great app, my partner and I use all the time! It‚Äôs especially useful when traveling abroad, it will convert the currency for you (if you pay for it). My favorite feature is the ability to scan a receipt and have it itemized so I can divvy it out between people (also a feature you need to pay for). My only suggestion would be to allow the scan feature to scan screen shots/pictures of a receipt you have, not just a physical receipt. Other than that, wonderful app and highly recommend!

I hardly ever leave App Store reviews but I had to for this one. Splitwise is an absolutely genius app for tracking group expenses and simplifying the process of settling up. I used to have an elaborate spreadsheet that I would maintain on all of my group trips. I thought it did a good job and it was certainly better than nothing, but it was pretty complex to settle up at the end of the trip. Splitwise handles all this for me, plus adds even more ‚Äúnerd knobs‚Äù to it, like customizing percentages of an expense, simplifying repayments, etc. I will never NOT use Splitwise on a group trip again.

Review Title: Just what we were looking for
Review Text: We are traveling to South America and wanted a way to split up costs considering that there were a lot of things we couldn‚Äôt split.  This app keeps track of who owes the other, how much, gives the ability to pay them back and more.  Since I wanted to keep track of all the finances (and not just stuff we split,) it let‚Äôs me keep track of things that we don‚Äôt split too.  Also (though this might be something that just I am really stoked about,) they export everything to excel with categories, times, costs, who paid, what currency, etc.

Review Title: Great app with a small issue
Review Text:
I have been using this app for 3 years now and it is very simple and intuitive to use. Payment option using PayPal is great and the balance reminders a boon.

Deducted 1 star because I really hate the settle all feature. Instead of creating a borrowing entry it should record a payment entry in the groups/no Group where money is owed to other person and give the sender option to record any extra amount after all balances as borrowed amount in any one of the groups the individuals share. This helps us keep track of the expenses that have been settled instead of reflecting a borrowing and then balancing all groups.

Review Title: Makes split bills so much better!
Review Text: I would rate this 4.5 if I could. Great app, but couldn‚Äôt find a place to share suggestions/feedback, so doing that here. I would like to see a custom option for repeating bills. One of my bills only comes every other month which is not an option. I‚Äôd also love to see a placeholder option - so you could set a repeating bill without assigning a cost since it changes each period. I am often double checking to make sure I‚Äôve charged all bills to Splitwise and this would automate that effort. Last - please add more integrated payment options. Venmo is good, but Zelle pays immediately.

We used Splitwise for our France trip. It was confusing and not user friendly. When it came to settling up, it excluded some people‚Äôs entire balances. I had to spreadsheet the whole thing to get it right.

I am adding to my review.  I purposefully turned off the Simplify Debts feature because when turned on, you cannot trace the netting of the activity on the app.  Confusing.  Also when an entry is deleted, it shows both the original entry as deleted and the entry to delete deleted.  Confusing.  Also anyone can alter another member‚Äôs information.  It does occasionally notify you of that, but not consistently.  Again, confusing.  I was on the free app, but I wouldn‚Äôt go pro because my experience was so bad on it.  Our group began to not trust the app.

AND IT IS SO GOOD. The simplify expenses setting and ability to add receipt photos aren‚Äôt absolute favorite features. We went to brunch and they hand wrote a receipt and if we hadn‚Äôt added the photo to the app we may not have caught that they accidentally charged us 25$ over! This is perfect for any trip where more than two people are spending money for the group. Less time worrying about being fair and more time just having a nice time with friends and/or family. Would highly recommend this app and we use it any time the crew takes a trip now!

Review Title: Beware, Useless if you don‚Äôt Pay Premium
Review Text:
Would give 4 star for App and 0 star for their poor business tactics to force users to pay. 

 Once upon a time it is a reliable and good app. But without any proper intimation to its users, it reduced the number of transactions you can post. They are using this tactics to force users to pay. Premium is not worth it, for a user who uses this just to monitor how much they owe, most of the premium are meaning less for the price. If the price is lower, people can ignore and pay, but a 40$ subscription price sounds nuts. Charts, categorization and etc all this junk is useless as it is relied on user input not on some AI. 
 Once users walk out, they should realize they are never coming back ..

Review Title: Fantastic App - Experience Ruined by Update
Review Text: I‚Äôve used this app occasionally for trips where my partner and I share expenses. In the past it has been extremely useful for those 2-3 times a year and I‚Äôve raved about it and shared to friends. However the recent update now locks the majority of functions behind a paywall, most notably you are only allowed to post 3 expenses per day now before being locked out. This is sad to see. I feel the payed features are great for power users and I‚Äôm sure many like them, but I felt it was fair that I could use the basic function of adding expenses as a way of logging them without needing to pay but now even that‚Äôs been paywalled. Bottom line, I no longer recommend this app for the average user and I‚Äôll find an alternative.

I have never taken the time to write an app review, but I felt that I needed to now. I am an accountant, and when I travel with my friends, maybe four times a year, I would usually just do an Excel spreadsheet to split our expenses. Then I found Splitwise and what a great app it was, until it started limiting the number of transactions you could  enter per day. We have too much fun on your trips to take the time to enter our expenses on the go, so instead we wait for our pending visa charges to settle up, and then we enter expenses after our trip is over and we have time to sit down at our desks. But now Splitwise limits how many we can enter?!?! Splitwise‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt you just make your money off of advertising? Why do you have to force us to upgrade?

Review Title: How to Destroy Your User Base 101
Review Text:
The free version of splitwise is now borderline unusable. You are strictly capped on how many transactions you can log a day, and I know many of this app‚Äôs users log expenses in spurts. You can no longer do this. If you wait until the end of the month to log expenses (as I do), guess what? You are now logging 4 expenses a day over the course of a week or two. Terrible. If you want to continue to use this (easy to use tbf) glorified excel spreadsheet, you can do so for the low, low price of $5 a month.

I‚Äôm sure this change came from higher up and is gut-wrenching for some of the people who worked to build this app. But it is inexcusable. I‚Äôm done with this app, and if you‚Äôre looking for a good, free app to log shared expenses, you should look elsewhere too.

I‚Äôve been using the free version of this app for quite a while to keep track of charges with my girlfriend. It was fine when it was free, but not worth upgrading, especially since the pro version didn‚Äôt seem to have functionality that would benefit us. They suddenly changed the free version to severely limit the number of transactions you can enter each day as well as making you wait 10 seconds before entering receipts. ALL OF THIS WITH ABSOLUTELY NO WARNING.  I can understand the need to monetize your app to get more paid users, but this wasn‚Äôt the way to do it. I‚Äôll be deleting your app as it is no longer useful to us since we both would enter receipts at one time when we received our credit card statements.

It‚Äôs not clear how certain features work until after you‚Äôve used the app a few times. For example, the bright orange button called ‚ÄúSettle Up‚Äù (button #1 in group expenses) is actually NOT meant to be used most of the time. Pressing this button will remove the debts that others owe you. Most people will want to hit ‚ÄúRemind‚Äù if they‚Äôre still waiting on a payment. Also, it can still be confusing to split a check unequally for someone who‚Äôs not numerically inclined. However, once you get the hang of it all, you can enjoy this app for all of its utility.

Review Title: Could be great, but fails incredibly
Review Text: Anything useful requires pro, every step is a process to complete. It‚Äôs not an efficient design and can‚Äôt even link cards without pro. Could rival Venmo if it was better. But hopefully Venmo takes the best of this concept and incorporates it into their app. Do t understand why it takes days for my payments to come through. Also wish the app would just calculate the actual differences in what‚Äôs owed. I.e. someone owes me $200 but i owe them $300‚Ä¶ can‚Äôt it just cancel out and even us out at me owing them $100. So it reduces the sums of money being transferred especially when it takes days for it to settle. The app is just overly complicated and requires pro to make it easier.

Review Title: Was great‚Ä¶now charges monthly - no one time charge option for ‚Äúlife‚Äù
Review Text: So I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for several years.  It‚Äôs functionality is awesome.  However, they are now limiting the number of expenses you can do each day unless you upgrade to PRO.  Unfortunately you then get tied to a monthly charge (or annual)‚Ä¶this app isn‚Äôt so unique that they have the ability to keep their customer base with this move. I can do just as easily in Excel or with at least 3 other apps that have one time cost (or watch an ad)‚Ä¶so now I‚Äôm moving on.  Maybe the company will get it and make different membership types and option - and not make it an ongoing cost for roommates trying to just split the monthly expenses.

Review Title: The ability to calculate expenses with non-users is a must
Review Text:
Upon purchasing the premium version of this application, I anticipated the ability to effortlessly itemize and split bills among friends who may not be app users themselves. Regrettably, the process necessitates the submission of each individual's email address or phone number. It's important to note that there's no requirement for such personal information to execute the essential function of expense sharing - a task that this service purports to facilitate.

This mandatory data provision raises significant privacy concerns, which I deem a non-negotiable issue. Consequently, I felt compelled to cancel my subscription and remove the application altogether. A subsequent investigation revealed this problem has persisted unabated since 2016, further reinforcing my decision.

Review Title: Makes Group Trip $ So Much Easier
Review Text: Recently went to Barbados with 3 girlfriends and we created a group in Splitwise. Each of us entered our shared expenses as they were incurred, which made it so much easier to figure out who owed whom at the end of the trip. My favorite feature is that you can choose only certain people in a group - for example, one night only 3 of the 4 of us went out to dinner. There app let me select just the 2 people in attendance and shared the cost among the 3 of us. So easy to use, Will definitely use it for all group trips from now on!!

Review Title: Used to use religiously, but daily limit makes it borderline unusable
Review Text:
This app was amazing until they started creating these daily limits. Absolutely worthless to have a trip Splitwise if you can only enter 3 transactions a day. 

I‚Äôm not going to take 3 whole days just to enter 9 expenses for a trip. It truly is easier to calculate it out yourself at that point (and I‚Äôd probably be able to get all the transactions sorted in two days instead of 3üôÑ)

Again, love the app and when you have all expenses in, it works flawlessly - but I think this was a greedy mistake by the app developers. Maybe it‚Äôs paid off for them, but I think it has made this app become borderline unusable.

I‚Äôve used this for years and it‚Äôs always been great ‚Äî not perfect ‚Äî but solid and slightly more convenient than using Google sheets. I‚Äôd probably pay something like $5 or $10 to own it for life. But a monthly subscription of $5/mo when I don‚Äôt even go on trips that often??! That‚Äôs insane. Also the way monetization was introduced is frustrating with the stupid 30 second wait before you can add an expense. Hilariously low free expenses limit too, I think it‚Äôs 3. First thing I did when I hit my ‚Äúmaximum number of expenses in a day‚Äù? I deleted the app and downloaded an alternative! Boo Splitwise, that‚Äôs too bad in all these years you couldn‚Äôt find a reasonable way to monetize your business ‚Äî now you‚Äôre going to lose all your users too.

Imagine having incredible potential. A huge circle of businesses, friends, and families using your product and loving it. You make improvements to be more user friendly. Then greed takes over and you create hostile user interface regressions. Purposefully make it impossible to use the app for the most simple and fundamental purpose unless you pay a monthly fee. Imagine being so blind and hungry for money that you kill your own app with paywall nonsense and ruin your reputation. But you don‚Äôt have to imagine, because you‚Äôre doing it with every update you push out. I would have gladly used the app with ads. Or paid to remove ads. But enforcing a subscription for the most basic service. See ya. I‚Äôll just use a spreadsheet.

I‚Äôve been using Splitwise regularly for a few years now and have found it very useful and easy to use - until their recent update, which essentially makes the app useless unless you pay. Yesterday I tried to enter 3 expenses and had to sit through multiple ads before I could do so. Seeing the negative reviews of Splitwise Premium has made me feel like an upgrade isn‚Äôt worth it. I have no desire to use Splitwise Pay when Venmo is easy, fast and works best for me. I don‚Äôt need charts. Super manipulative move on the part of the developers to try to squeeze money out of their longtime users - who, like me, are probably mostly young people who don‚Äôt have a ton of money to spend on apps. Time to find another app! Annoying.

Review Title: Used to be great.  Deleting and downloading settle up today.
Review Text:
My bf and I loved this app to track our shared expenses. But, without notice, they imposed a 3 per day transaction limit in the free version that makes it far less useful. The subscription price is absurd, at $5/month or 40/year per user. 

Considering at least 2 people must use it in a group, that price is absolutely ridiculous for a very simple app.  Subscriptions are annoying generally, and a reasonable one time fee (maybe $20) after a trial period (which we are long past) would have been palatable. I probably would have even been ok with $1/month or $10/year per user. But, between the pricing and the inconsiderate no notice roll out, we are downloading settle up and deleting splitwise.

Love the concept, the design, and the customizable approach to adding bills. The only thing that‚Äôs lacking is a more developed currency calculator - there is the option to add bills in multiple currencies, but it doesn‚Äôt show you the outstanding bills in your currency of choice and becomes difficult when you use more than two. 

And further, it would be great if it could ‚Äúcancel out‚Äù when you input bills in multiple currencies the way that it does when working with a single currency, so that I don‚Äôt have to do math when trying to figure out how much I owe. Other than that, keep up the good work!

I use this for shared expenses amongst roommates. This apps features cater more to sharing a restaurant bill rather than rent and utilities. This doesn‚Äôt breakdown the charges that people owe, it only shows a lump some. Even after inputting future charges, it shows one whole amount. I tried the pro to see if the extra charts would provide more information, but the groupings by category aren‚Äôt helpful unless your splitting many kinds of expenses. The grouping by person show breakdowns but are inaccurate because there‚Äôs no way to connect a payment to one particular bill. So between not needing the receipts feature and unhelpful charts, the pro isn‚Äôt worth it.

moving features that were previously available behind a subscription paywall? Not cool. I definitely would have paid to purchase the app and I might have subscribed to unlock additional features, but this is sort of alienating. Features I would consider paying a monthly subscription for: auto-billing for recurring bills (including auto-transfer by pushing requests to venmo) and integration/ability to log in to service providers to automatically input new bills and split accordingly. 

Would love to see Plates integrated within the app, though I‚Äôm sure it is not included for a reason.

I've been a long-time user of Splitwise, and I have immense respect for this app, having relied on it for over a decade. However, the recent shift towards restricting free features to push users into a subscription model is disappointing. While I understand the need for revenue, introducing ads or offering one-time payments could have been a more balanced approach. I genuinely value this app and would be willing to support it in a way that doesn't involve a recurring monthly fee.

If this trend continues, I'll have to start searching for alternatives. If none are suitable and the app becomes too cumbersome for free users, there's always the trusty old Excel spreadsheet to fall back on!

To the developers: Please listen to your user base before you start losing them!

Review Title: Got greedy and made the free tier unusable
Review Text:
I have been a huge fan of Splitwise for years. I use it to split expenses/bills at the end of the month with my roommate. 

They‚Äôve recently made a change where you are limited to 3 transactions per day unless you pay for pro, which is $5 a month. That would mean paying $5 for about 20 minutes of usage every month to split up bills, which is a crazy. 

So basically thanks to greed Splitwise has made their app completely unusable for my use case. I would be fine with a monthly limit instead for the free tier of say 10-20, but unless they change this daily limit I‚Äôll be deleting this app soon since it‚Äôs no longer usable for me.

Splitwise has recently introduced a daily expense limit, limiting users to entering 2 - 3 transactions a day. You also have to wait through a short add after entering each of these transactions. Both the limit and the add can be removed by purchasing the pro version. 

This has basically rendered the app unusable for our household‚Äôs purposes of entering shared expenses. It‚Äôs one thing to introduce a paid tier with additional features, but it‚Äôs incredibly frustrating to move core functionality behind a subscription that was previously available for years. 

I would not recommend Splitwise to new users unless you are prepared to pay a monthly or annual fee. Check out other bill-splitting apps.

This app does make calculating balances easy, but the ‚Äúsettle up‚Äù feature is what‚Äôs earning this a 1-star review. The inability to manually add/remove a Venmo or PayPal account from within the app is absolutely criminal design. I just spent three hours trying to figure out where a massive amount of money went after everyone claimed they‚Äôd settled up, and at this point my best guess is that it‚Äôs with PayPal, which I haven‚Äôt had an account with since 2014. I only use Venmo. But because this garbage app assumes that everyone uses the same email address for every financial transaction, I‚Äôm now potentially out hundreds of dollars because the developers were too lazy to add a way to link or remove Venmo and PayPal options. This is garbage and needs to be fixed.

Review Title: Has potential but still needs a lot of work
Review Text: The dashboard is confusing and awkward. If you pay someone individually outside the groups, the app‚Äôs display is a mess and shows two separate fees instead of combining them. The itemized receipt option is the main reason I use it but it‚Äôs not on the app only on the website. After a dinner with a group, I have to wait to go home to go on the website to tell everyone how much they owe me. I‚Äôm forced to use this app to split expenses with my roommates for the past three years. Still no updates or improvements with the interface or making it more user friendly. This does get the job done and could have been great but I guess the app‚Äôs motto is if ‚Äòit ain‚Äôt broken why fix it?‚Äô

Started using this app on a three week road trip with family. Splitwise made it easy to track gas, Airbnb costs, restaurant bills and groceries. 

The app saved us time by allowing one person to pay (we would trade off) so we could avoid the haste of splitting the check. The five of us settled up within minutes at the end of the trip.  

Splitwise was smart to work with Venmo for simplicity and tracking of payments. You can ask for payment and send friendly reminders. Love it and highly recommend it for those nights out with groups.

Review Title: Only using because I have no choice‚Ä¶
Review Text:
I hate having unnecessary apps. In a world of Zelle, PayPal, and countless other ways of getting $ quickly to others, I hate having to use yet another payment app. Additionally, this app is overly complicated: I‚Äôm not wasting my time reading instructions or popups. Every app should be naturally intuitive, and this one is not. If an app is not naturally intuitive, it‚Äôs a failure. 

Once the transitions are completed that have forced me to use this app, I‚Äôm not only deleting the app, but also deleting my account. Because there‚Äôs also the concern that this unknown group could be nefarious, or at least unable to secure vital personal data. Sorry team but why should anyone trust an organization that they know nothing about??

This app used to be quite useful, largely because it didn't require a paid subscription. However they've recently made it extremely inconvenient to use unless you pay $5/month. Most frustratingly, a maximum of 4 expenses can be recorded per day, so now I have to keep track of what I have/haven't record yet, so over the course of several days I can have it all captured to settle up. And if you made an error and need to delete one of your expenses - that still counts as one of your daily 4. Extremely frustrating. 

My friends and I will be searching for an alternative app now. We'll deal with a bit less feature-rich app in the short term, in order to not reward schemes like this with our business.

Review Title: Paywall makes it not worth it anymore.
Review Text:
Used this app for years living with roommates as it‚Äôs an easy way to split bills and make sure I don‚Äôt forget them, I loved the app and what it can do. 
However, and as most people, I am very displeased with the paywall addition that makes it nearly unusable for my case unless I get the Pro version. I understand some of the more fancy features and maybe even the expense wait time to be behind a paywall, but only allowing 3 expenses a day makes this not worth it for me anymore. The use cases have greatly reduced because of this and, even if I can split my bills until multiple days, it is disruptive to me, my process and the comfort this app was providing originally, making it not worth it at all anymore.

Overall, I like the app however there is now way to set a time of day for recurring expenses to appear. It seems as though they will reappear on the date they reoccur at the same time as when you originally entered the expense. I don‚Äôt want to have to wait until the end of the day for all my recurring expenses to occur and it causes confusion among my family as to what time they can settle up. Getting a notification for each expense separately as it shows up is also very annoying. This should be a simple fix that would add a lot of functionality to the app and I am not the only one who has requested it.

For not having to build this customization in excel (which can be done easily), it‚Äôs an easier tool to use. I don‚Äôt really see it being 100% beneficial though for group trips. Features and simplicity could be much easier. Humans forget to enter things, enter then wrong, or just not at all. So it‚Äôs still up to you and your diligence to want to split things at the end hoping you don‚Äôt miss anything (like a car rental, or gas fill up, etc.)

SiDE NOTE: it could definitely show you who contributes more in the relationship if you‚Äôre feeling a certain way. Just as information though, not to argue.

Review Title: Was great until the limit was added
Review Text: This used to be my go-to app for group trips, roommate expenses, and anything else where I needed to figure out group payments. The app is solid and has all the features I want on an app like this, but the per-day transaction limit makes it wholly unusable. I would consider paying a lower price for Pro, but $40 a year is too expensive to restore what was once a core function of the app. Luckily Venmo added their Groups feature, which accomplishes most of what I need, so I have fully switched to that. Hoping that Splitwise comes around and either removes the transaction limit, increases it to a reasonable number, or decreases the subscription price so that I can return to their expanded feature set.

Review Title: Loved this app for years‚Ä¶ until the expense limit
Review Text:
This app has been a godsend for logging expenses for vacations, nights out with friends, and the occasional collaborative gift. I have recommended this app to friends, family, and coworkers because I enjoyed using it that much. Even though there were convenient features locked behind a paywall, the free version still felt like a full app worth using. 

And then, the expense limit. Gone are the days where you can log expenses in the moment: you can now only enter three expenses before the app prevents you from logging more unless you want to drop $40/year. I would think Splitwise users are conscious of their spending; we‚Äôre literally using an app to split expenses amongst other people. I doubt we‚Äôre the correct audience to squeeze money out of.

Splitwise team: I used to really respect the integrity of offering a fully useful app that feels functional while offering cool features for users who can afford to pay for a little extra. Now, you‚Äôre shamelessly trying to upsell while going dark on social media? 

Here‚Äôs hoping you turn this around.

This app was great when I first used it a couple years back. Now you‚Äôre forced to view ads and have limited expenses you can charge per day. So, it‚Äôs very inconvenient for vacation when you‚Äôll likely have to charge your group 3+ expenses per day. It‚Äôs not even noon yet and I have already reached the limit for expenses (3).  So, airport fees and breakfast? Now I have to take note of everything else with a different app. Plus, when  you add an expense, you‚Äôre forced to watch an ad for 6-10 seconds, otherwise you cannot add an expense. If you exit from the ad prematurely, you have to watch it again and for the entire length of the add.  You‚Äôre basically forced to upgrade. You are better off using Venmo!

Review Title: Used to love it, disappointed with paywalls
Review Text: I used to use Splitwise all the time, but their move to putting everything behind a paywall is having me use them less and and less. I can no longer recommend the app. The pro plan features used to be a nice add on, but now you basically need to pay for pro in order to use the app. The practices they‚Äôre using to push people to paid are annoying and disruptive. The plan is also too much money for what it offers. If it was $2/month maybe I‚Äôd consider it, but at $5 it‚Äôs way too much and I‚Äôd rather find a different app entirely instead. Really sad to see the app move in this direction. Hope they change course.

Review Title: More paywalls & limits on free account
Review Text:
It‚Äôs not worth it anymore unless you use all of the app‚Äôs functions, which I do not. I use this app for its most basic feature - to itemize shared expenses & figure out who owes what - so I‚Äôm not upgrading to the premium for something a spreadsheet can do for free.

I don‚Äôt use the charts, tables, analytics, whiteboard, etc. and I don‚Äôt have my card connected for ACH bc security, other apps do it better (i.e. Venmo, Zelle, CashApp) and my banking app gives me most of the expense analysis ‚Äúpremium features‚Äù for free. 

Last month, Splitwise put up more paywalls and the 3 entries/day limit on the free version of the app so that it‚Äôs frustrating to use for its most basic features. I used to promote this app (and its other app, Plates) to friends and family, but will no longer do so. I‚Äôm looking for an alternative app or may even go old school with a spreadsheet and some fun formulas bc this corporate greed ain‚Äôt cute. 

Used to be a 5 star app, but now it‚Äôs barely a 2 for what‚Äôs available for free. Very disappointed in this clear money grab.

Review Title: 3 transactions per day limit for basic users
Review Text:
Splitwise just rolled out a new 3 transaction per day limit unless you pay for pro at $5/month ($40 a year). I split things with my roommates daily but only use splitwise once a week once all the transactions have posted and this has made splitwise unusable for me.

I had splitwise pro for a year and no new functionality was added. Receipt itemization was the main selling point for me and you can‚Äôt even upload receipts, or itemize digital receipts. The only useful feature splitwise pro had aside from receipt itemization was search, which should be a base feature. And instead of working on adding any value to pro they're instead making the basic experience worse.

Very useful app that me and my 4 roommates use. This app makes it extremely easy to keep track of many different expenses. Instead of repaying after every shared purchase, this will combine all the charges into one. 

I have all the utilities under my name, and two others but most of the food. We just add all these charges into the app for our group of 5, and settle up through Venmo once a month. A great feature is being able to put the charge in the one house group but not charge everyone, if one guy didn‚Äôt eat dinner with us for example. 

One problem we keep running into that we would like fixed: when you press settle up you can go through Venmo which is great, but always directs to the email your friend used for this app, which happens to differ from the emails we use for our Venmo‚Äôs.

We‚Äôd like a preference setting to keep using a specified Venmo account, rather than assuming a Venmo account with the same email used for SplitWise

Review Title: Gone downhill with recent paywalling of core features
Review Text:
I am not someone to post app reviews often, but as a loyal user since 2014, the recent limiting of the number of transactions per day makes the app unusable for those who want to settle up a trip in bulk. Typically, in my experience, we add many transactions in a single day, a day or two after the trip. 

Over the years, I have made least 10-20 people to sign up for the app, as I am always responsible for settling our groups expenses on trips. I can no longer recommend someone signup to Splitwise as it is severely crippled with delays and hard transaction limits. 

I will be migrating my friend group to a new app on our next trip - there are lots of options to chose from. Just google.

Review Title: Disappointed by the 3 expenses daily limit
Review Text: I‚Äôve used Splitwise for the last 13 years. I‚Äôm an avid fan. I was delighted when they added Splitwise pay because it would be a way for them to make some money. It seems like that didn‚Äôt work out too well and they‚Äôve resorted to rather aggressive option of limiting the number of expenses that can be added. This is a non-starter for me. After 13 years, I‚Äôm saddened to report that I‚Äôll be downloading an alternative. In fact, there‚Äôs a recent Reddit post where folks have posted a few open source alternatives. Still an avid supporter, but just from the sidelines. I hope they find a more user friendly way to monetize.

Review Title: It used to be so good and they ruined it
Review Text: As others have mentioned the app has become too annoying to use because of all the ads. Not even banner ads, ads that literally prevent you from using the app until you‚Äôve waited for a timer to pass, all so you can do something that is supposed to save you time? I get needing to monetize, but they only offer a subscription, and they don‚Äôt provide enough value to justify that. I would pay a one time fee, but never enroll in a subscription, it‚Äôs just not worth it. I used to recommend the app but now you‚Äôre better off doing the math on a calculator and requesting money on Zelle, Venmo, or wherever else you send money - it will take the same amount of time and be free of ads.

Aside from a few tiny UI tweaks, there‚Äôs nothing that this app needs to make it simply perfect. It takes a very complex task of splitting bills on a friends‚Äô trip and makes it child‚Äôs play. The only challenge you‚Äôll have is convincing your friends to download and try it. Once they do, you‚Äôll all be hooked.

Pro tip: for complex restaurant meals, use the app Tab in conjunction with Splitwise. Tab makes it easy to share meal expenses, then just take Tab‚Äôs totals, and plop them into Splitwise manually.

Review Title: DUMB APP DOESN‚ÄôT HAVE PROPER VENMO INTEGRATION
Review Text: My friend just tried settling a debt on Splitwise and decided to pay me via Venmo. But, since my Splitwise account has a different email address than my Venmo account, that money is stuck in the process. Now he‚Äôs having to go through a great ordeal to get the transaction canceled on Venmo, and I‚Äôm stuck not getting paid in the process. This shows how shortsighted the developers of this application are and how precariously this application functions. You guys probably have all this in the user agreement or whatever to protect your behinds, but mistakes like this can happen in real life. Just stick to just being an application company that just adds/subtracts numbers and simplies connected graphs or whatever, and stop trying to add features that callously handles others people‚Äôs money!

I use this to manage all my roommate‚Äôs expenses and it is very helpful when it comes to keeping track/splitting evenly all our bills, who has paid and how much I am owed. 

There‚Äôs a button within the app that allows them to pay via Venmo or PayPal which makes it pretty seamless. If you are part of a large group of friends or family who routinely alternates payment of meals, entertainment etc. this is a great tool to use as everyone in the group can easily see who owes what. 

All around excellent app, very functional and user friendly.

Review Title: Forcing existing users to pay for features they used to have access to
Review Text: I like the functionality of this app. I totally understand that monetization is necessary for any business. They had, in my opinion a compelling paid feature-set for the Pro version, however recently they have set a transaction limit for the day which has severely impacted my enjoyment of the app. Forcing every-day users who do not need advanced functionality to pay for features that were previously free is not a great way to garnish brand loyalty. This sudden change doesn‚Äôt make me want to start paying for pro, it makes me want to look elsewhere for the same features.

Some team at Splitwise just made some huge strategic error and they‚Äôre about to see their revenue and usage drop significantly. Horrible management decision which will sink them. My partner and I use this to track household expenses between the two of us. Just in the last few days we‚Äôve started getting ads for Pro ‚Ä¶ every single time the app is opened ‚Ä¶and now have a 3 transaction limit per day. We can just track on a Google doc just as easily. I think Splitwise got a little too big for their britches and thought they were providing a much more substantial service than they are. Disappointed we won‚Äôt be users anymore.

I really do love and rely on this app to keep me and my family straight with our shared expenses. The only irritating thing is that when you are settling an expense, you can‚Äôt just apply it to a specific bill, it deducts it from the entire total but doesn‚Äôt specify what‚Äôs left to be paid. For example, if my son gives me $50 for a $80 bill, I can‚Äôt deduct just the $50 from the specific bill he is paying me for. I have to keep track of it and frankly, if I wanted to do that still I wouldn‚Äôt have downloaded the app.

Been using this app for a couple years now but was disappointed when they started limiting the daily entries unless you pay a monthly subscription for Pro version. I only enter basic expenses for the household, I don‚Äôt need receipt scanning, graphs and all those other features that cost $4.99 more each month. That is ridiculously overpriced for people who just want to track & split simple bills. A one time $5 or $10 fee to enter unlimited expenses without adds is reasonable but the subscription fee model was a bad idea. This is not iCloud, Adobe or a steaming service.

I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for years on the free tier for expenses on trips with friends and daily household expenses with my partner. I would also frequently recommend the app to others since it has been such a help. 

However in the past ~6 months the access the free tier gets has become more and more limited. Such as there never used to be a limit on how many entries you had. Now you can only enter so many expenses in a day and after abt the 3rd entry you get an upgrade add. 

And, the other day there was a ‚Äúbug‚Äù with using the connected Venmo account but they so conveniently have a new feature to pay through Splitwise (very sim to Vemno). Which takes twice as long for payment to process. So, I‚Äôm still waiting on settled expenses to hit my Splitwise pay account to then transfer to my connected bank account. 

There‚Äôs ways to still make it work like settling up with cash and using Venmo outside of the app and combining expenses into one entry. 

But it is really quite a bummer to have experienced all of these changes when it used to be so good.

My boyfriend and I have been using this app to manage our shared expenses since moving in together, and it‚Äôs been miraculous for us for tracking expenses and owed money. I loved that there were no ads and that the free version had great features/was very usable, so much so that I was considering upgrading to premium at some point just to support a good company with a great app. Sadly, the latest updates have ruined everything that I loved about it. If you can‚Äôt enter more than a few expenses in a day, the app is virtually useless, and I‚Äôm not going to pay a big fee every year just to do what I could be doing for free in a spreadsheet. We will unfortunately be finding a new app to manage our expenses. Really a shame.

Review Title: Totally User centric and user friendly!!
Review Text: There are many apps in the market but not all think the user-experience process through like splitwise has. Splitwise is end to end thought through. Allows you to split expenses in multiple ways - equally, by %, by headcount/ shares. Combines balances in groups and non-groups with the same person to give single balance per person. Love how well it has been conceptualized!!! I would give more starts if that was an option!! Great product!!

Review Title: I don't silently hate my partner anymore
Review Text: ... because Splitwise is our mediator! It's so good, no awkward conversations, just add what you bought and Splitwise keeps the 'who owes what?' tally up to date. You can even do custom stuff, like $150 of the Costco bill for my expensive, organic vegetarian food, and $55 was your canivourous, meat goods. I have mastered recurring expenses too, for things like our internet bill. My partner too, has been nudged toward more financial mindfulness by having to use this tool. It is a massive win-win! Get it .. and have no more silent financial resentment!

Review Title: Amazing app. Takes the guesswork/math out of traveling with groups.
Review Text: I recently went on a trip with four other people. Between the initial airport to AirBnB Lyft ride and all the meals/rounds of drinks that were ordered, this app was a complete lifesaver. Each person was responsible for their own expenditures‚Äîyou can select who out of the group is a part of the cost. At the end of the trip, it shows who owes whom what amount. Transfers can be made via Venmo or PayPal. This saved the awkward ‚Äúyou owe me‚Äù conversations and allowed us to fully enjoy our vacation. Would recommend.

I downloaded Splitwise for a bachelorette party this weekend and could not have been happier with how easy it was to use! We all were able to add in the expenses we had- split them amongst the proper people and even out our dues to different people SO EASILY. the app connected directly to my Venmo so at the end of the weekend, I had a only a couple of payments that were directly taken care of by Splitwise. The app made it easy to see who owed what, and in the end no one was upset about money, costs or being owed cash. thank you Splitwise!!!

Review Title: Use to love it, now it‚Äôs useless
Review Text: I‚Äôve used this app for years and loved it. I got a ton of my friends on it too. I travel a lot and use this to split expenses easily when traveling with others. Suddenly, ads start popping up between adding each expense, 3 expenses a day maximum can be added, and all the features have been taken away. This app is now completely useless without paying for the pro account. I don‚Äôt even mind having to watch ads. Alternatively, I don‚Äôt mind paying a fee. But to ask users who have had this app for years to suddenly fork over $40/year for the most basic features is ridiculous! I‚Äôm deleting and replacing this app with something else. $40/year to split expenses is nonsense.

Review Title: Free plan expenses limits too low
Review Text: I have loved using Splitwise but their new expense limit, while I appreciate its importance for driving subscriptions and for the sustainability of their business, is too low to be useful for the customer segments who use the free tier. In essence, they‚Äôre making free plan users pay for their poor customer segmentation and monetization strategy. I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if this underserved customer segment migrated to a competitor tool. Other than this, it is a great app with amazing features. I would perhaps recommend they introduce a new plan between the free and pro plans that is close to free but can capture people who might be willing to pay for the way the free plan has been but are not willing to pay for the pro plan.

Review Title: Great app, but has website issues
Review Text:
The app itself is great, but if you get into this ecosystem, be aware that not all the features are available and do not work as well on the website/desktop version as is on the app. It‚Äôs been months where the features on the website are not the same as the app.

I love the many options for splitting things in different ways, pretty much anyway you could think of, you can do. Receipt scanning works moderately well, and sharing features are plus!

Review Title: A great idea that‚Äôs poorly executed
Review Text:
Such a great and simple idea. The UX can be confusing at times. When adding expenses you may add them individually or in a group. Often times it‚Äôs difficult to tell the difference, and getting to the group screen takes too many actions.

The internationalization is buggy too. Using my app in Spanish makes other friends use theirs in different languages too. That needs to be looked at.

Finally, the ‚Äúpro‚Äù version blocks make the simple app barely usable when you‚Äôre on a trip. Feels like a sad money grab for an unstable base product. Hoping they spend time establishing the base product making it less buggy.

Was great, easy, and low key fun to use. Then I came on here yesterday after not using it for a while, as I‚Äôm on vacation with my friends, to discover that unless you pay for their premium subscription you have a limit on how many expenses you put in. So if I fronted a lot of purchases I have to wait literal days maybe weeks to be able to input all the information and ‚Äúsettle up.‚Äù Like at this point I‚Äôm keeping track on my notes app instead and it‚Äôs doing the same exact thing for free. I just have to use a little extra brain power. Suuuuuuper shady and greedy of this app for that. If I could give it 0 stars for this alone I would. And I NEVER write app reviews but this infuriated me that much lol

This app has made mine and my spouses life SO MUCH EASIER. We like to split bills, groceries and even tickets fairly, and this is the perfect way to keep track of everything. I‚Äôve used it for about 4 months and haven‚Äôt had anything to complain about yet!!! 
I believe you can even upload pictures, however with the title being descriptive I haven‚Äôt had to use that feature yet. It is point blank ‚ÄúI paid and we split evenly‚Äù or ‚Äúfriend paid for all, I owe them the whole amount.‚Äù
6 out of 5 stars. Love.

Anyone giving it 1 star makes me scratch my head in confusion.  Its the best designed UI amongst this type of app & the numbers are always spot on.  
The developers must be quite polite! I would have told some reviewers to go jump in the lake...   It‚Äôs a very straightforward, well designed, smarter way to handle bills across groups and people.  I cannot see anyway it can be called ‚Äòerratic‚Äô tbh.  

I have been using it for a few years with zero problems.  Sometimes I use the data for other purposes & have exported the data into excel.  Cross-checked - you can quickly see that it splits up correctly who owes what to whom.   

Handles FX ok, my main gripe is that I want even more from them!  I wish they would add more companion apps/ services to Splitwise.  I would love to set budgets/ spending limits (especially for vacations).   But, it does its stated job very very well.

UPDATE: used to love this app, but now I can‚Äôt have more than ANY two interactions before it locks me out and says I *have to buy the Pro version. Not worth it, and makes accounting way more difficult. Will be deleting - it‚Äôs too bad, this was such a lifesaver before the change.

OLD: Definite recommend for anyone sharing a place to see all the bills and do tracking, due dates, and all the little details. Only wish is that the devs would update the Notifications to allow cellular announcements for due dates - only current option is to send a reminder for the overall total due, so would love to utilize a gentler way to send reminders to individuals over specific charges.

Review Title: Scan Receipt option in Pro Version is highly inaccurate
Review Text: I bought Splitwise pro to keep a better track on my cashflow but somehow I am not all happy with the way "Scan Receipt" works. It detects the bill total on the main screen but when I try to itemize it, the total gets way off. It adds some random items with random prices in the itemized bill making is lot harder and time consuming process to get it sorted. I bet, it would be much easier more me to use the free web version and type out all my items and prices. I was unhappy for having paid for pro version until I cancelled the subscription.

I‚Äôve been on several trips with friends and family now, and have found this to be a very valuable tool to manage expenses with a group. People seem to figure out how to use it pretty quickly. The settling up portion seems to be where things get confusing. I‚Äôve had several situations where we think we‚Äôre settled up and then users suddenly get a notification that they owe someone more money, even though no one‚Äôs entered any new expenses. Maybe it‚Äôs just a learning curve thing?

Review Title: Amazing, But I also have a suggestion
Review Text: I love this app! My only suggestion is some people don‚Äôt use or do use venmo or paypal or zelle specifically, so maybe add a feature on the app where it notes on your profile which platforms that you have/typically use this way someone doesn‚Äôt accidently send money to a platform the recipient doesnt have? Otherwise, it‚Äôs an amazing app and the most helpful tool that I‚Äôve used on my phone in a long time. It‚Äôs perfect if you go out to eat or travel on trips with groups of friends. 1000% recommend.

I never review apps but this made me mad. I‚Äôve always loved Splitwise. It was great for splitting everything from vacations to monthly expenses. However, the recent decision to limit the amount of expenses you can add per to day to just 2-3 hoping to push people into buying pro is horrible. Not to mention there was no clear communication that this was happening. I understand the value of pro for people who need it but the only functionality I need is something I can recreate in an excel sheet. That‚Äôs why it was free with ads. Now instead of using this app I‚Äôll watch a 5 minute tutorial and make my own version. I hope they change this back but if not it will be sad to see the company fizzle into obscurity.

My spouse and I have used splitwise for many years to easily split expenses. We also use the app to split expenses during trips with friends. Its been a great help to us and we frequently recommend it. However, lately the app has become very pushy about the pro version - you can‚Äôt enter more than a few expenses a day before you‚Äôre locked out until the next day (unless you pay for pro). Its a great app but the aggressive approach to getting you to buy pro is a real turn off.

Review Title: Love it but it needs more!
Review Text: First off, this app is helpful and it keeps me organized on how much I'm owed. I have 2 issues I wish they could fix. Firstly, there needs to be an option to pay for specific items thru the Splitwise app. Maybe a person wants to pay 1 of the bills they owe money for but not all of them at once. Second, I would like there to be a notify option for one time charges. You're able to set when the person is notified/reminded about the upcoming charge but you're not able to do it if it's not a repeating charge. Kind of annoying but I hope they add these features in the future!

This app has been a lifesaver when it comes to traveling with friends. It makes life easier when you only have to type the amount in and you‚Äôre ready to go. No need to remember how much you owe, how much they owe or if you got paid back. I also really like the flexibility of choosing how much you want to split, and in what currency. 

I wished I had this when I was living with my roommate. We just kept piles and piles of receipts for a year before we sat down and split the cost. It was a headache to do.

New limits to 3 expenses a day and a push for users to use Splitwise pay add too much friction for everyday users. I've been using the app for over 4 years and am starting to feel like Splitwise is almost no longer worth it. You should not be allowed to send Splitwise Pay money to a user who has not signed up yet. After having to sign up because a friend accidentally sent me money via Splitwise Pay, I'm now waiting for my funds to be withdrawalable while other options would be near instant. But those other options are hidden in the UI and it's easy to miss the "third party app" drop down.

Splitwise helps me and my partner share expenses and not have to pay each other back directly. It is also nice because it allows us not to have to have a joint bank account and be able to use our credit cards for points and rewards and such. 10/10 would recommend. Would be nice if it allowed you to do even more financial things like adding bank accounts and such so all things could be in one place. :)

Review Title: Core Functionality Gone in Free Version
Review Text:
