As many others have pointed out, in the free version you can only add 3 items per day. I emailed the company, and the response I got was ‚Äúhave other people put in expenses for you‚Äù. When we are summing and splitting trips, we might put in 50 expenses a day. Not worth paying for premium when I use this maybe every other month. There are many other good alternatives on the App Store. 

A note to the Splitwise team - typically you monetize awesome extra features, like the Venmo integration or simplifying debts even. Monetizing core functionality is a horrible model for growth of the app - drawing in new users with free features they enjoy is the best way to grow. This is‚Ä¶ surprisingly shortsighted

I‚Äôve had Splitwise for a long time and have used it for every trip I‚Äôve taken with friends. Even with traveling a couple handful of times each year, I still don‚Äôt use this app frequently enough to justify $50/yr with the Pro version. With the recent update, the core functionality of this app is unusable in the free version. 3 inputs per day/per user, and you have to watch an ad each time you add an expense! This app would have easily been 5 stars before the update, but now, you‚Äôre better off using any of the other competitor apps out there. Hope the app devs realize their mistake and undo this change before they lose more customers‚Ä¶

Splitwise makes group-pay situations - housemates, weekend with friends, group trip, etc - so much easier. Just add whatever you pay for to the Splitwise group and it takes care of the rest. Plus there are features to take care of just about every way you might want to split payment. Getting new users set up on the app and payment configured is sometimes tricky, but once that‚Äôs out of the way it‚Äôs pretty much smooth sailing.

Review Title: USED TO be great.. hard pass now
Review Text: I used this app since 2022 for extensive summer trips with friends, and it was a lifesaver! Super easy to use and keep track of expenses. When you‚Äôre traveling with friends, you put so many expenses in at once, it was crazy helpful! I‚Äôm not sure when it changed, must‚Äôve been recently. I‚Äôm updating my charges with my friend and apparently now they have a limit. You can only add in 4 expenses PER DAY. And they have ads for each expense you add, which is annoying but tolerable, but a limit on expenses you can add? Forget it. It‚Äôs no longer convenient at all unless you pay, so that was a poor choice on the part of the app. Will likely look for another app.

Review Title: The deceptive nature of this app is unacceptable
Review Text:
The app does not, upfront, inform you about its limits until the last second to try and scam you into purchasing Pro. 

For example, you and your friends choose to rely on Splitwise for a trip, only to realize 3 days in that you‚Äôre hitting the limit for expenses in your group. You‚Äôre forced to either do the remaining accounting by hand, or purchase premium. 

The app also has intrusive ads where you must watch an ad for prolonged periods of time before you can add expenses. The app is telling you ‚Äúyou can either hold up the line in the airport while we play this ad, or you can pay us $50‚Äù

The app is exactly what I‚Äôm looking for with one exception

Evenly split balances should never be more than 1 penny off, even over time, among the group members.  If you only look at one transaction at a time, a balance that can‚Äôt be perfectly split among members will only be a maximum of $0.01 off, as it should.  However over a course of a number of recorded transactions one group member may owe as much as $0.05 more than another group member.  The difference grows over time.  Unless I‚Äôm misunderstanding something, on Splitwise some people pull the short straw more than others it seems.  This results in uneven splits over time

Review Title: Love the app but will not upgrade to Pro
Review Text: I have loved using this app. It resembles something I put together in Numbers to do the same thing but in a much slicker fashion. I just got the new update. It looks nice and is very intuitive to use. I would like the currency conversion feature of the pro version. I though I would upgrade. Until I saw that it was a subscription model. That is something I will not do. If this was a one time payment to upgrade, then I would most definitely do it. I may even stop using the app and go back to my Numbers spreadsheets for an upcoming trip to Europe because it includes currency conversion.

If you‚Äôre looking to have an app that easily logs money between friends and tracks money owed, THIS IS NOT A GOOD APP FOR YOU ! 

This app seemed at first to be a great way to keep track of who owes what between friends. But after using it now for over 3 years there have been some changes and it seems to make calculations between different groups and friends waaaaay more complicated than it should be. It moves money around without explanation and to groups that money should not be a part of. 

I emailed back and forth for a long time with their support which usually responded pretty fast which props to them thanks. However what they said was happening and what the app was doing were not the same and it seems like they can not explain nor control what it‚Äôs doing at all. There were many times when I knew for a fact that someone should owe me zero yet SW moved money to where it shouldn‚Äôt and all of a sudden they owed me $100s of dollars. WTH ?!?

I will be going back to pencil and paper for actual accuracy till I find an app that can do things right and in a less confusing way.

Review Title: Used to be great till it ruined our trip.
Review Text:
Loved this app till we used the ‚Äúpaid by multiple people‚Äù feature and it was horribly off.  We had to spend hours putting it all into the Splitter app (which nailed it) and excel to double check.

We only noticed it because one person in our 8 person group had spend only 70$ while I had spent over 800$ and it said I owed him! At that point people had already left the vacation and been paid out. We had to figure out all the differences and have people send money back.

My girlfriend and I were using money from our joint bank account to pay  for things and splitting it in the who payed section, but then seeing that we were owed drastically different amounts when everything should have been even.

Luckily I had done AP calculus and college physics so I caught it but who knows what other damage the app has done to its users over the years.

We had used it for many trips and even our housing expenses but I will never trust it again. Stay away if you know what‚Äôs good for ya.

I am with my friends group, and while one of us was always stuck adding the receipts and deducting who owed what, the otherswere questioning if he was always doing it right, or if a simple mistake was ever made. I knew their had to be app to do this kinda math for us, and found splitwise!!! We are so thankful for this app, it does everything so simply!! I love than you can settle up with someone via cash, without going through the app. Simply wonderful. We are so so thankful for you splitwise!!!

Managing payments and ‚Äúwho owes how much to whom‚Äù during trips with family/friends is no longer a hassle. With this app all the shared expenses, no matter how complicated, are kept clear and organized. No more keeping receipts. No more keeping track of how much you owe or are owed by whom. Enter your expenses on the app and forget about it until the end of your trip. Or keep track of monthly expenses when you live with people who share expenses with you.

Review Title: Finally a great money split app
Review Text:
I go on many trips with family & friends and we always pay for different things. This app made the whole settlement calculation like a breeze.

The attention to details is outstanding. Like if you typed ‚ÄúDinner for the group‚Äù as the name of the expense, it changes the category icon to a dinner plate with silverware! It is not a major thing but helps you distinguish between different payment categories much easier

Keep up the good work devs

This app is a wet dream for people who share expenses, whether that be daily or during a trip. I believe this app is in the phase where it is extremely developed, but they are probably looking for a way to get a revenue stream to make it explode. I have never had an issue with it and I enjoy using it anytime I travel with a group, I highly recommend it even if you have to pay for premium features, it is so extremely worth it.

I‚Äôve used Splitwise a couple of times now for trips with a group of friends.  It allows us to simplify all of our restaurant bills by having one person pay, we can track where we are along the way so the person who owes most can start to cover more, and it‚Äôs easy to settle up at the end of the trip.  This prevents us from having to use our brains to either remember things or do math.  That‚Äôs the goal, right? üòä

Review Title: Very disappointed with new, unannounced limits
Review Text: Have used Splitwise for years and previously would have rated 5*. However, I‚Äôm very disappointed in the new and unannounced limit of entering 3 expenses per day. My household of 3 people has used this app handily for 2 years to divide household expenses and manage trip expenses, and the arbitrary limit of 3/day for the free tier makes it much harder for me to enter expenses on a once-monthly basis, as I typically do. I‚Äôve had to write all expenses in my notes app and titrate them, entering 3 per day until they‚Äôre done. We will be looking for an alternative app, unless this limit changes to a more reasonable number (~10-15/day).

I love Splitwise! It‚Äôs made splitting the bills with my roommates, coworkers, and family so easy! I use it constantly because I have so much going on that I‚Äôd never be able to keep track of it all without something like this, and spreadsheets just weren‚Äôt cutting it. I use the free version, and I think the only thing I‚Äôd prefer is if I could pay a one time fee for Pro instead of a subscription. I would buy Pro in a heartbeat if that was the case!

Review Title: LOVE this app!! Simple split of payments regardless of number of  people!!
Review Text:
I have used this app for years, and cannot say enough good about it!  Regardless of number of people, or complexities of splitting various payments, you can enter the he various payments, and Splitwise will automatically split the payments including simplifying when various people in a party owe one another different amounts for different things.

If you are splitting costs with anyone, regardless of your group size , USE THIS APP!

A large group of us downloaded the app to use for a big holiday weekend. We were really excited at the thought of such an easy way to manage our group kitty and to track shared expenses. What started as a way to make the whole weekend feel a little more carefree quickly spiraled into a friendship ending disaster. Arguments ensued about whom to payback when, why and how owed money might change; peoples worst sides came out because of all this confusion about something as simple as our bbq dinner tab! In the end we still had to put it down on paper because duh we‚Äôre idiots. It‚Äôs been three days and we are still sorting this out. Quickly running out of food and water because no one wants to add more to the tab. Plz Send help.

I live with 4 roommates, and while one of us was always stuck adding the receipts and deducting who owed what, the other four of us were questioning if she were always doing it right, or if a simple mistake was ever made. I knew their had to be app to do this kinda math for us, and found Splitwise!!! We are so thankful for this app, it does everything so simply!! I love than you can settle up with someone via cash or check, without going through the app. Simply wonderful. We are so so thankful for you Splitwise!!!

Used to be great for sharing expenses. Now things that were free are behind a paywall. Before you can load a new expense, you are forced to watch a 10 second still picture that asks you to upgrade to the pro version to avoid waiting 10 seconds in the future. If you wait till the end of the trip to load all expenses in one go you will be met with a message saying you have hit your daily expense limit and need to upgrade or wait till tomorrow. No thanks. Don‚Äôt even bother trying to settle in different currencies. That‚Äôs for the pro version. Time to switch apps. Or maybe keep using for 1 offs.

this app is great for keeping track of group expenses, HOWEVER there NEEDS to be a way to link your venmo account besides just assuming the email used for splitwise is the same as for venmo.
This should be part of the onboarding process.
 the amount of times money has been sent into the void because of this assumption, leading to headaches and confusion is far too high.
Is it easy to remedy the problems that arise from this? yes, once you know how. but if we could avoid the issue altogether that would be way better.

Review Title: Makes group trips so much easier
Review Text: Splitwise has been super easy to use and has made trips and outings with friends much less stressful! My first time using it was for a bachelorette weekend, and it was super easy to track and split expenses across the 10 girls on the trip. The app links directly to various payment forms you could use (I linked to my Venmo), which makes settling up charges so fast and easy. Very quick to learn how to use and intuitive.

Review Title: Good but with two little bugs to fix
Review Text:
If you can fix the following two problems, Splitwise will be my all time favorite app!

1. If you do the ‚Äúshares‚Äù option (which is great btw!), it converts the shares into money and saves it that way. If you reopen an expense and go into the shares view again, they all say 0 and you have to redo everything just to make a small adjustment, like adding another share for one person. It would be great if the shares themselves were saved, not just the money conversion, so that follow-up adjustments were easy. 

2. If you change the date of an expense, it resets the split to ‚Äúequal‚Äù. All the work that has been done dividing a bill is lost! The shares/percentages etc of an unequal bill should be preserved if the date is changed. 

Thank you for making such a good app already! It has saved us time and stress. These changes would make it more user friendly!

Review Title: Great but not going to pay to use it 1x/year
Review Text:
Loved this app for the 1-2x a year frequency with big trips but now pay and wait after 5 transactions? I tried to use this to settle up Christmas gifts and will be deleting the app since I couldn‚Äôt even finish that, it forces you to wait till the next day? What a joke. 

Venmo issues: multiple times have I experienced trying to use this in a group and others not realizing old venmo accounts are linked to it. Simple mistake, but impossible to get funds back. Better if not linked at all since it doesn‚Äôt let you edit which Venmo account your funds are sent to.

My wife and I have been using Splitwise for a while to track our spending and split costs, and up until a month ago I would‚Äôve given this app 5 stars. However, with a recent update, Splitwise have decided that locking the basic functionality of their app behind a paywall was a sound business tactic. We now have ads popping up when trying to add expenses, and a limit to the number of expenses that we can add each day. So instead of adding upgraded ‚Äúpro‚Äù features that would actually make the premium option worthwhile they decided to just force their entire user base to pay their exorbitant premium costs.

How desperate can a company be to limit the regular users to only be able to add 4 expenses a day? More than that, you don't even have a buy app option. Just the subscription model. Just to clarify i am not against these "pro" features and subscription model but if you cant take enough photos on a camera why would you have that camera? We're more than happy to pay for the actual pro features like receipts scanning, currency conversion and all. Tbh, expense search should also not be a "pro" feature but I'm still fine with it. But how can you limit people to add only 4
Transactions? Guess i'll have to add one more subscription in my list now!!

I used the app based on a recommendation from a friend for a recent group trip. It was so easy to manage what we spent and how to split the expenses. Generally this process would have been long after you get back from a trip.I was able to update the app as the expense happened so I didn‚Äôt lose track of it and it kept my friends in the group informed. Highly recommend if you do group travel and need to split expenses.

Review Title: Great App - Pro Needs Some Work
Review Text: I absolutely love this app. It‚Äôs made sharing expenses with my boyfriend a breeze. I recently purchased Pro, but probably won‚Äôt keep it. I really was looking to be able to itemize in the app and that‚Äôs not possible if you don‚Äôt have a physical receipt. If you have a physical receipt, then it works beautifully. However, if you get an electronic receipt, there is no way to upload that for itemization. If the developers can add that function, you bet I‚Äôll be giving this 5 stars.

Review Title: Suddenly extorts user $4.99 when least expected
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using this app for years with no trouble at all, and found today that they now charge for the baseline service despite it always being free. Want to add more than three costs in one day? Prepare to pay $4.99 . As we‚Äôve always used it just before our bills come due and we‚Äôre in a hurry, I paid the ransom to continue. I hope the $4.99 was worth losing two longtime users, and having those former users give you as much negative advertising as possible. Greedy, disgusting company. Use anything else for splitting your bills - even if they charge more, at least they won‚Äôt blindside you like Splitwise.

Review Title: Confusing . made my life a hell
Review Text: Sorry but why is this app tossing around debt to people? I get that it is to make the transaction as little as possible but It gets extremely confusing if you have a large group of people because of its automatic debt tossing feature. What it does it is that if someone accidentally charge you you cannot notice that they charged you because that money will be tossed to another person in the group automatically- in the end you don‚Äôt know why you owe certain amount and why you are owed certain amount. Much rather use an app that just keeps track instead of automatically make the transaction as little as possible. I am deleting this app cuz wow I just can‚Äôt anymore.

Review Title: Where has this app been all my life?
Review Text: Seriously this is the best app for traveling with friends and family. You can record who paid & when and who to split the bill with. You can split evenly or by percentage (or other ways too). You can take a photo of your receipt as well which is so nice. You can also enter your bills in other currencies! I just used the app on a trip to Florence and we entered everything in Euros. I also love that you can settle up directly using Venmo or Zelle. Love this app!

I have used this app for years and years and it‚Äôs been perfect, always doing exactly what i need it to do. It‚Äôs very good at letting you enter charges and split charges to keep track of who owes money and whatnot. However I feel betrayed that now there are ads and a LIMITED NUMBER OF CHARGES that you can add per day on this free version. I‚Äôve added 3 charges today and apparently that‚Äôs all I‚Äôm allowed to do now without paying $40/year. As a financially mindful person who is needs an app to keep track of charges, I am not willing to pay $40 to upgrade at this point. I guess I‚Äôll have to find a different app :(

Review Title: Cool tech; they won't release your $$ tho!!!
Review Text:
I recently took a trip with a few friends. We used Splitwise and the technology is pretty nifty ‚Äì one person paid for the hotels, one person paid for gas, another person paid for meals, etc.
The trouble came when trying to settle up -- DONT LET ANYONE OAY YOU INSIDE OF SPLITWISE! Use Venmo or pay each other cash. Splitwise is sitttttting on my friend's
Money (she tried to pay me 4 days ago). I can't pay the 3rd friend yet (would use PayPal or Venmo) because how in the world will I get this *eventual* money out of splitwise, if I don't pass the buck to my friend!?

Review Title: Easy to manage, split and personal expenses
Review Text: I am a student sharing my apartment with five other students. We purchased many things in common and that‚Äôs how to split the amount among ourselves Split come in to picture. In fact, I manage my personal expenses also through Splitwise. Whatever I purchase, I just add here. Being a student, I don‚Äôt have money to pay for pro version. but overall, I‚Äôm happy with this app. Thank you so much.

I love this app for group trips and everyday expenses in the household. It works awesome and is exactly what is needed for organizing money in a group. This would be a five star review if the developers weren‚Äôt going the same shameless money grabbing direction that everyone seems to be nowadays. Taking a good app and rolling back functionality that has always been in the free version to try to force people to pay for the premium is shameful. Do better Splitwise. If your premium product was so good, you‚Äôd be able to get people to pay for it without kneecapping the base app.

Review Title: Nice job on keeping accounts, needs integration with payment services
Review Text:
This app is an excellent way to keep track of group expenses, split shared expenses and remind everyone discreetly of who is owed how much. 

I just wish it had some kind of integration with payment services (e.g. banks ACH or PayPal) that would allow for payment of the amounts owed without leaving the app, and automatic settling of accounts. I haven‚Äôt fully explored the app yet, but it would also be good to have a way to send a polite reminder to people who have forgotten or are too busy to pay up.

I have been using this app with my roommates to split all of our apartments bills and it is going well so far. However, I was wondering if there will be a functionality that allows users to link their credit card statements or checking accounts so that expenses may automatically be split without the user having to manually input the amount? I know the Mint app has a function that links bank accounts and categorizes purchases.

Splitwise is an awesome app that is user friendly. The app is easy to add friends, organize friends into groups, create reports, send friendly reminders, attach receipts plus multiple options to receive or  make payments.  It is definitely beneficial when accounts are shared equally between multiple people with busy schedules. I have 2 roommates and  use  Splitwise for household utilities that are split equally between the 3 of us.  Splitwise makes it convenient, comfortable and  efficient.

Like many, I used this app exclusively for large group vacations, events, etc and it made splitting expenses so easy to do in one transaction vs a bunch of little ones. However, when it comes to vacations and trips a lot of transactions are implemented in one day, especially after the event is over. Getting hit with an expense limit to seemingly push users to their Pro is the reason I won‚Äôt be using the app anymore and will likely just build my own spreadsheet moving forward. 

It was a convenient app, but not a necessity. Take the convenience away, you lose the point.

I used to love this app to organize my travel expenses with friends and family. Like so many things on the internet, they ruined it by getting greedy.
Now they‚Äôve added a daily limit of three transactions if you don‚Äôt have pro, which is asinine because not everyone just enters expenses as they happen.
I would pay a one-time flat fee for the app, but $4.99 MONTHLY is way too much for a task that only takes a tiny bit more work if you use a spreadsheet. 
I‚Äôm locked in right now because I have travel plans in the works and I don‚Äôt want to re-enter the information, but I‚Äôm definitely ditching this app for my future plans.

I love this app and it‚Äôs simplicity, but there needs to be a ‚Äúrepeat every 3 months‚Äù option for trash bills etc. Also, there needs to be a page where you can view and change reoccurring expenses, instead of having to hunt them down individually. When someone owes a balance, it would be useful to be able to click on that balance and see which items are specifically contributing to that remaining balance

I had never heard of Splitwise until a friend recommended that our group use it.  It was unclear to everyone how to use it, so some members used Splitwise Pay and some did not because they were unsure about connecting bank accounts to a platform they had never heard of.  Now some of the funds are sitting in the Splitwise Pay platform and people haven‚Äôt gotten paid, which has made a huge mess of the calculations.  I contacted to support but have not received a response.  There was never an instruction saying ‚ÄúEVERYONE IN YOUR GROUP NEEDS TO USE SPLITWISE PAY OR NO ONE CAN USE IT.‚Äù  To Splitwise support:  PLEASE REPLY TO MY SUPPORT REQUEST!‚Äù

There are many alternatives to this app‚Äôs core function, so it makes little sense that they decided to limit that core function unless you pay for premium. Premium subscription should be for added bells and whistles, like shorter float time, not for core functionality.

Tried Splitwise Pay and it‚Äôs also not worth the wait time to get your money from friends when you have more instant options like Google Pay or Zelle.

I gave 2 stars because I like the interface, but otherwise I‚Äôm deleting and won‚Äôt recommend to friends since I won‚Äôt be using it.

Review Title: unusable after the ‚Äúget Splitwise pro‚Äù update
Review Text:
I used to love Splitwise. I used it for nearly a decade with no issues, loving how easy it was to split costs between travel buddies, roommates, and partners. It was a joy to use! 

Unfortunately, within the last few days the app has become unusable. Want to submit a cost? You need to wait ten seconds between EACH entry, and are limited to three entries per day. 

Truly the slimiest cash grab move, and so utterly disappointing. I understand apps providing additional services for a fee, but this hardly gives an option to use the app without paying for the whole experience. Time to move on to another app.

Two stars for the functionality of the product zero stars for Splitwise pay the launch that recently happened that has been beyond frustrating. 

I‚Äôve been trying to collect money from my bills that I use Splitwise for for the last two weeks and still am in a back-and-forth email conversation with the company, trying to just have them reverse the payment at this point because it‚Äôs so frustrating.

There‚Äôs a way to block Splitwise pay I would suggest anyone going to be using this app to just use any other function for payment. 

They also don‚Äôt get back to you readily fast so right now they just have my money held in limbo until I can get them to just reversed the funds. It‚Äôs a nightmare.

The app has been bugging out my housemates for a little while now soon because her crying to launch Splitwise pay that it‚Äôs been kind of having some few kinks that need to be worked on.

All the functionality I ever needed for a long three-person trip, which costs incurred and shared in every possible combination. I think we used every feature and we enjoyed being able to share the responsibility for data entry and modify entries to keep the labels from betraying any one person‚Äôs shorthand/coded lingo.

Now please add a way to handle a refund with the same functionality. There‚Äôs something called ‚Äúsplit by adjustment‚Äù that doesn‚Äôt do the trick even though it‚Äôs labeled ‚Äú+/-‚Äú. Really just need to enter a negative expense.

Splitwise works great when you don‚Äôt have to itemize the amount. For restaurants, movies, bills, and fixed expenses, splitwise works well and the added features of pro are nice to have. Unfortunately, the main selling point of Splitwise pro is almost completely useless because receipt scanning doesn‚Äôt handle BYO bag rebates or sale prices at all. If your receipt has any correction on it, you can‚Äôt scan it. This makes it useless for groceries, arguably the main reason you‚Äôd want to pay for pro as there‚Äôs a lot to itemize.  Stick to the free version until they fix it.

Review Title: Loved the app until we started settling up‚Ä¶
Review Text: Be sure to not mark anything as settled up until the very end. App worked great until we started settling up and then things went a bit crazy. People who paid were showing them showing they needed to pay more and those who had not paid showed a zero balance to some they still owed. So, we had to do the rest of the balances the old fashion way and it was painful at the end!

I like the whiteboard feature. I put the addresses & other pertinent information to the group for travel. I like the spreadsheet option as well for calculating. A couple suggestions I can make, 1) it would be nice if you could provide connecting links for payment options, so we don‚Äôt have to ask the members for their payment options. (Ie. PayPal, Venmo, Facebook ect) members can pick their payment option and List thier information for ease of transfer 
2) It‚Äôs so awkward to send a private message asking for money, can you add options for Automated reminders?

Review Title: You have to pay for everything now, it‚Äôs ridiculous
Review Text:
I have been using Splitwise since 2017, but a few months ago someone at their company decided to ruin a perfectly good app by making you pay for a subscription (crazy exercise for what it is) just to add more than 3 expenses in a day. This has made the app essentially useless for any of my use cases, like splitting expenses with friends from a trip or putting down expenses to split with my partner. These are all things that you usually add lump sum many transactions at a time.

I highly recommend everyone to switch from this to just using google sheets unless splitwise disables their expense limit.

Review Title: Game changer! Until they started forcing you to subscribe
Review Text: My gf and I use this to balance out our expenses. We used to have to transfer each other money all the time. We haven't had to transfer each other money in a long time now. Whoever owes money gets the bill. So much more efficient! Love this app. Edit: it‚Äôs been many years of using and loving Splitwise. But I was just hit with a 3 transaction limit per day unless I pay $5 a month without warning. I have enough subscriptions. I‚Äôm lowering my score from 5 starts to 2 stars. And we will be switching to a different app.

*Forced wait between split-posts (semi-tolerable)
*Daily post limit‚Ä¶ (intolerable)

**Usable for simple splits done daily
**Unusable when added nuance and doing many expenses at once

***Worth $10 for permanent app? ABSOLUTELY. You see, we used to pay for apps and that was it. Then Adobe created subscriptions to Apps. Now any developer who does essentially nothing will try to milk as much money from users as they can.
Splitwise, you are sick, greedy, and not worth $40/year or $5/month. Disgusting. You should be ashamed.
USERS, DON‚ÄôT LET THIS BEHAVIOR BE THE NORM. THIS ISN‚ÄôT HOW IT SHOULD BE. 
Some companies rent out appliances for those too poor to buy the appliance. It is recognized as essentially abuse to people because of the premium paid. Software companies are trying to make this the norm. Don‚Äôt let it be! They don‚Äôt do enough to warrant that kind of money. Fight back. Use your purchasing power to say NO. Support alternatives that are humane and realistic.

This app allows you to all pay for different things, select who to split each cost with, and then see who owes who what. It‚Äôs amazing. It‚Äôs much better than a similar app (Splid) which I tried first that claimed to perform the same functions, but provided incorrect totals owed to others. It was mind boggling how incorrect the ‚ÄúSplid‚Äù app is. SplitWise on the other hand is absolute perfection.

While I would change a few cosmetic aspects of this app, all around, it‚Äôs fabulous.

Review Title: Don‚Äôt like the per day restriction
Review Text:
Had been a avid user off the app but I hate they bought in the limited number of splits per day option. I understand the push to get users to use pro but there could be better ways to do it. This restriction gives a very bad customer experience.
You could keep the 10 sec waiting piece but please let the user add more number of splits per day.
You can delay sending it to the people one is splitting with but at least let them add it.
Please bring it back to as it was before.

I really like splitwise in general. It has been a big help with keeping track of shared finances in my household. But the new Splitwise Pay is seriously lacking. Other money transfer services give you the option of waiting 3 days or transferring money instantly. But the only option I see with Splitwise Pay is waiting 3-5 business days? That is way too long. I will definitely not use the new payment system again when I can send/receive money in way less time using other services.

Having Splitwise has helped on at least three separate trips that I have taken with Friends. Before using this app, it would always be a chore to figure out who owes who what at the end of the vacation.  By adding in your expenses in real time and being able to split things in a number of different ways, this app has really made travel expensing so much easier.

I was a fan of splitwise until they started adding pay walls. I usually mass enter expenses from trips which is no longer viable since I‚Äôm only allowed to enter 4 expenses per day. Subscribing to splitwise does not make sense when these features can easily be replicated in Excel. Not as fancy or with graphics of course but it‚Äôll get the job done. The subscription model has truly ruined so many innovative apps. I would highly urge them to consider just running ads on the app and doing away with this subscription model pricing. (You would also have to convince your friends to subscribe if you want them to use the app as well)

Review Title: PAY TO ADD MORE THAN 3 TRANSACTIONS PER DAY????
Review Text: This app has completely sold out and is now impossible to use without paying for premium. It now gives a ‚Äúwait ten seconds or get premium‚Äù popup add EVERY TIME you try to add a transaction, and after the THIRD one you add it says you can‚Äôt add any more today unless you pay for premium! This awful change is new as of December 2023!! I‚Äôve used this app for nearly a year now and it has been amazing for managing the accounting during trips - which always have more than 3 transactions per day, thanks! If you want people to pay for premium maybe add more valuable features RATHER THAN TAKING AWAY BASIC FUNCTIONALITY OF THE APP AND PUTTING IT BEHIND A PAYWALL!!!

The app was great until they started showing an ad after every three records. Now, it‚Äôs really hard to use because of this change. It‚Äôs unfortunate that the product manager decided to shift from encouraging users to pay for cool, extra features to annoying them into paying. This approach feels like extortion, especially for those of us who have been using the app for a while and feel stuck with it. I think many people will end up switching to other platforms like Tricount, despite the hassle, because of these changes.

Review Title: Upgrade prompts will kill me as a daily user
Review Text: The latest update is I can‚Äôt add more than 3 expenses per day.  Also making me wait 10 seconds to add expense.  Highly annoying and effective as a potential catalyst for upgrades, but, if you aren‚Äôt properly using the ridiculous amount of data you have gathered from me and your users, you have failed your value proposition.  I‚Äôm giving you free data, so you give me this functionality.  That is the give get.  If you want me to give you money as well, you have failed your business model and your competitive advantage. You have no empathy for your users, who give you so much data.

Review Title: Great for individuals.  Confusing for families
Review Text: I love the way this is so easy to use! When it came time to settle up though, many people in our group did not understand the way the payments were simplified. We had several different sized family groupings who were paying together and the simplification logic just made it more complicated when one person was paying for the family. Also people in the group seemed to have a hard time getting a breakdown of the calculation of what they owed.

I never write app reviews but felt I had to for splitwise!

A group of 10 of us (9 newbies!) used this all weekend and it was great! I liked that you could log all or some portion of the bill as the expense (think equally split, % split, only 3 of the group took part in the expense, etc.), and that you could track money you lent to others as well as shared expenses to be split equally (like uber). Settling up was a breeze. Using this for all trips and group outings. 5/5!

This app is a lifesaver. We just used it for a 7-person trip and everyone in our group added in separate expenses and split things differently. It worked seamlessly and broke everything down for us which was so helpful. After it all we were able to settle up via multiple payment options (like venmo and PayPal) and could see in the app once someone had paid us. You really need this app for your next group event!!!

Love this app, makes it easy to keep track. But really am missing a couple of things that would make it easier to use when you have multiple groups going. 

- the ability to organize/drag the groups into a different order, i.e drag the active group to the top, or organize alphabetically if that is your preference. 

- the ability to archive groups and preserve the list of transactions. For example, my friend paid me for a trip and when I hit ‚Äúsettle up‚Äù all the transactions went away. Would love to be able to archive and yet keep the transactions for reference. 

- more options for the landing screen to only view the ones you want, maybe by date even if there is still a balance showing. 

Thanks for considering.

I have been using this app for many, many years. I used to recommended it to friends and family. But the developer now charges $40/year to use the app. Without a subscription you can only input 3 expenses a day and have to wait 10 seconds before inputing each one. This was implemented with no warning, no grandfathering of previous users, and no tiered pricing with more affordable options.
I understand development has costs, and that the developer wants to make a profit for their work, I'm not against subscription models. But $40/year as the only option is unreasonably expensive.

I‚Äôm new to the app thanks to a friend. It‚Äôs excellent and very intuitive. A lot of thought has gone in to it.

As a global traveller, here are a couple of things that would make it a little more seamless for me:

‚Ä¢ multiple phone numbers (I have 1 primary number and 2 eSIMs for Mexico and Kenya and will be adding eSIM for the UK in May)
‚Ä¢ Option to toggle auto switch to local currency
‚Ä¢ Option to toggle auto time zone switch or phone‚Äôs default
‚Ä¢ pay whole bill. For example, I‚Äôd love our whole group‚Äôs expenses to be tracked. But there are some bills that I want to pay for the group as a gift. It would be great to be able to record the expense and then record the payer as myself 100%. So the group can see that I bought that round of drinks or that cab ride or that meal.

These ‚Äúsimple‚Äù features would be awesome!

Review Title: Great app for managing your expenses
Review Text: I would love to see the items in the Activity list grey out if they are just passing information. It gives a toast with a weird message for instance when you delete a group. Instead, that item can simply be greyed out because the title and the subtitle of the list item display sufficient information related to that activity. I frequently use this app and really love it but it bugs me that this has not been thought of yet.

I have used this app for trips with friends, meals, etc. for the past two years.  I had not used it since a trip in November 2023 until today white trying to enter some birthday party expenses. Now I am encountering problems. ‚Ä¶ Whereas before I could enter as many expenses as needed,  it has now locked me out because ‚ÄúI have exceeded the number of entries‚Äù and cannot resume until tomorrow ‚Ä¶ UNLESS I want to download ‚ÄúSplitwise Pro‚Äù for a monthly fee. I now have two other people wanting to know what they owe, but I cannot tell them for another 24 hours. ‚Ä¶I am now immediately searching for another app.

Review Title: Big mistake on charging users now
Review Text: The product team assumes that Splitwise has a solid user base now to begin charging us and limit the number of transactions we can input per day. I think this is a wrong move. This past year, my friends and I went on a month-long trip out of the U.S. We decided to record all our shared transactions on Google Sheet without using Splitwise and we found no problem of this transition. I recommend Splitwise to reevaluate the value you truly are offering to users before charging them. I‚Äôm not confident about this decision of yours will retain most of your existing customers, let alone attracting new customers.

Review Title: Useful but doesn‚Äôt connect with Venmo correctly
Review Text: It‚Äôs useful in tallying amounts and making it easier to track information. However,  sometimes when using the app to pay through Venmo, it has difficulty in correctly doing so half the time. Second time using it with a big group and this issue came up, we decided to just use it for tracking, but not using it as a platform to connect payments.

Review Title: Need more choices; icons and fill in words
Review Text:
We need to be able to enter our OWN ICONS and words for icons. 

For example; 

Ambiguous icon; can be photo of our own.

OTHER can be: Monthly STORAGE unit rent, or our own verbiage fill ins. 

I‚Äôm ADDITION to those suggestions, 
It would be NICE to have a continuous running REAL TIME, TOTAL BALANCE due. 

It would be nice to see it update alongside EACH NEW TRANSACTION. 

Also, NEEDD MORE ITEM ISSUE space to detail the individual new events added‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a pain having to abbreviate to just SEE new items I‚Äôm adding in screen on original page, and the FULL DETAILS only show up in the SENT PAGE‚Ä¶ 

Also it would be AWESOME to be able to SAVE A DEDICATED ICON AND CUSTOM VERBIAGE to be able to just CLICK again that same symbol and verbiage again each month on re-occurring entries. 

Other than that,‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs pretty streamlined and easy to use compared to most. Overall pretty well done.

Review Title: How can I not rate this great app
Review Text: Just recently me and my friends took a trip to Vegas. I took the responsibility of maintaining the expenses. The only solution available to me was this application. There were no less than fifty entries which included one dollar tips as well. Entry is so easy it‚Äôs just a single tap. The Seattle up feature is mind blowing. You just cannot not have this great app while traveling with friends or family. My rating five stars hands down.

Your app implies that everyone uses PayPal and Venmo, and payments are made that will never work or that will be a major inconvenience to the user.  I have ‚Äúreceived‚Äù payments via a method that I can never cash.  I use one but not the other.  It‚Äôs each person‚Äôs right to choose who gets their bank account information.  We chose to limit exposure to such sensitive data.  No one gets to choose that for us!  You should and must include a user preference on payback method.  Give the user the option to show PayPal, Venmo, and/or cash as methods for settling up (why not show ‚Äúcheck‚Äù also?).  It isn‚Äôt just millennials using the app.

Review Title: Too many ads to upgrade to pro
Review Text: I'm not a heavy user. Maybe a few transactions here and there or for sharing monthly bills with roommates. But the app keeps bugging you to upgrade for a rediculous cost compared to my very casual use of the app. Even though it has a nice interface and makes tracking expenses across groups easy, I would not recommend for any casual users. I'd only recommend if you plan or want to be over charged for the pro plan. I'd give it 5 stars if they had a basic plan for how I actually use it and only charged a dollar or two.

Review Title: Easy money tracking for traveling in a group
Review Text:
This app is great! I found it as we were traveling with six of us. 

As an example, there were some meals when one person would not eat. The app lets me percentage wise make it so that person does not have to pay. 

It also can handle any currency which is great for traveling. 

It also lets me enter cash that other people, Pitch-in or payments made by others. 

It also allows me to see how much they each owe each other. 

On my two big trips I was the money person (oddly, I don‚Äôt consider myself the money person lol ). And each trip others ended up not using the app. But I could send them screenshots. I was able to see what they owed each other. It‚Äôs awesome!

I used to use this app for everything from managing roommate expenses to making groups for trips, but with this new change of limiting how many expenses you can add in a day is crazy. It actually makes the app completely terrible, like its just to split bills. I can use a calculator or find another app, if you are having trouble monetizing it, I recommend finding another way instead pushing me to pay money for an app that helps me get money back when I pay for other people. Completely insane that people who are supposed to be intelligent software engineers made such a poor design decision .

The arithmetic being incorporated into this app is nothing groundbreaking; however, the developers have thought about any possible splitting that people may want to do. Renting a Vrbo with friends and someone is leaving before everyone else? Splitwise can handle. One friend was only around for lunch, but everyone else went out for dinner? Splitwise can handle. Really clever app with intuitive design.

Review Title: Sudden paywall, will need to look for new app
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for years to manage bills in my house, first with roommates and now with my husband. I‚Äôve also used it on trips to divide expenses among friends. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed that the app now only allows 3 expenses per day without paying for pro. I would potentially pay a one time fee but a monthly fee isn‚Äôt justified when there are other apps out there that can do the same thing for free. I don‚Äôt need any of the other paid features, I just want to be able to add more than 3 transactions in a day. Sadly, I will plan to find a new app to use to manage my expenses.

I love the idea of this app. Easy to add friends and share expense. 
However I would like to see a feature that allows you to select multiple expeensives at the same time. For example there are 6 times/ expenses you owe. But you only want to paid for 3 of them. You can select the 3 and the 3 selected will total automatically. 

Perhaps maybe rename the settle up buttons to Pay Up. It was a little confusing when I 1st used it .

Review Title: Nice app but need better integration
Review Text:
Better if Splitwise is able to 
1) find the right person in Venmo. We all knew Venmo is horrible in finding the right person . Lots of people have similar names but they are not your friends. Splitwise should be able to let us confirm, edit or mark which Venmo is associated with payees in each group. Also Splitwise should be more comprehensive to ensure each transaction is indeed done before marking them settled 
2) Integration with Apple Pay, Facebook payment, chase pay etc .

We had a group of 10 and a total cost of $1600, and the total owed by me was not $160 & I didn‚Äôt pay any of the individual costs. Also we couldn‚Äôt figure out how to stop and individual from the group once we got started and they had been added by mistake. System is very sophisticated. A group should be able to share some costs with a sun-group (Ie liquor cost for only those drinking). If it‚Äôs there it‚Äôs not obvious. 
I won‚Äôt use the App again, too easy to figure it out on your own.

Review Title: Amazing app, helps to save lots of time
Review Text: I've been using it for a month now, used for tracking a group tour of a few people. As I go to group tours frequently, I know how painful and time killing it is to calculate and split all the expenses manually. This is where splitwise comes in and helps to totally get rid of of all that unnecessary pain and time killing. Its very easy to use and provides accurate calculations.

Review Title: So confusing - more trouble than its worth
Review Text:
I could have settled up my groups expenses in 10% of the time it took me to do it in Splitwise. First of all it allowed group members to pay to a Venmo account that didn‚Äôt exist (simply because my splitwise email differed from my Venmo email.) 
Secondly, when I corrected an corner (changed it from one group member to another) the accounting went haywire and double charged everyone. 
I‚Äôve use Splitwise before without trouble so I‚Äôm not sure if there‚Äôs a glitch in an update or what happened. But after this debacle, I will not use it again if I‚Äôm the one in charge of settling expenses for a group.

Great app! Makes it easy to keep everything fair. I mainly use it with my partner who I live with, but we‚Äôve also used it on trips with other couples which was super nice- Little things add up on trips, and it‚Äôs nice to track them and not having to be asking people for small sums all the time. Also like that we can ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù if we‚Äôre behind by paying for the next few outings and usually only have to settle up once rent is due.

Review Title: Awesome but one key feature missing
Review Text: I love this app. I use it frequently with my roommate and my travel BFF. The only thing that would make it a perfect 5 stars is if you could add people manually who don‚Äôt have the app. Especially when there‚Äôs a big group and everyone doesn‚Äôt have space on their phones, it would be so helpful in splitting expenses especially because those larger groups are more difficult to keep track of. Please please pleeeease make that an option!

One year at the beach, there was 12 of us that needed to split some expenses incurred that week and this was before SplitWise. I was able to do it in a spreadsheet but using SplitWise is a lot easier plus the added feature of the other people in your group can enter expenses without the added trouble of giving them access to a spreadsheet

This app is becoming a pain to use. The ads are invasive and the daily limits on the number of expense entities is absurd. I have been a long time user of Splitwise, and told many friends about it, but I am going to look into Splid and Tricount as alternatives. If I could watch ads to not have a limit on the number of expense entries, that would be one thing, but I'm not watching ads for a downgraded experience. No thanks. I understand the developers want to make money, but I'm not paying $40/year for a glorified Excel sheet.

I have been a loyal Splitwise user for years and even gotten many of my friends to sign up as well. I used to love Splitwise. 

Recently, Splitwise has changed how they operate and only allows you to split 3 prices per day before you are locked out and asked to pay for the pro model. This completely ruins the experience for me as well as my partner and our friends, and we will be seeking an alternative solution unless this decision is reversed. 

I understand the need to operate as a business, but restricting your core functionality and purpose is not the way to go about that. Shame on you Splitwise team.

Just ran into a limit for daily expenses (I put 3 in!). Super annoying and obnoxious way to push people to the pro version. I also down like how they‚Äôre trying to make it seem like paying on Venmo is almost dangerous because ‚Äúthe emails may not match up‚Äù. Again, another very heavy handed way to push towards their features.

Try actually providing more value instead of taking away features and making your users upset. Time to find a new app!

Review Title: Great way to track expenses in a group
Review Text: Went to a wedding with a group of friends and everyone was picking up a tab here and there. This app allowed everyone to log their expenses and for the whole group to split the costs for the whole trip. Also allowed to add expenses if someone decided to skip a meal or bar by taking them off of the bill. Great app. Extremely easy to use.

Review Title: Easy to Use! Has multiple splitting options!
Review Text:
I love this app! Hardly ever use it as the need doesn‚Äôt arise but when we do group trips, makes it so easy to quickly and accurately divide up costs! Loved that I was able to do it by shares instead of just a standard equal split! Highly recommend! 

Only downside is: it makes everyone join via an email link so those that don‚Äôt have a Splitwise account won‚Äôt see the info.

Review Title: Clunky, bad graphic design, money stuck on one end.
Review Text:
First off, the user interface of this app is trash. The design of this app is archaic and confusing, with the seamlessness of app design nowadays, this is an embarrassment. 

Also, the new in app payment system is ridiculous. My partner paid me just for it to be stuck in my account, and it took the payment out of his account before i accepted it or had payment set up, so now it‚Äôs stuck in there attempting to ‚Äúverify‚Äù? Just wasting away as the app is collecting interest on this money while it‚Äôs not being allowed in my bank account. Would not recommend to anyone.

Used to be a great app for my partner and I to divvy up expenses. Also great for traveling abroad with auto currency conversion. But now, as with everything, they are squeezing every penny out of their customers they can by limiting how many expenses you can enter per day (good luck sitting down to do bills quickly) and removing the currency converter, unless you upgrade to the ‚ÄúPro‚Äù version and subscribe with a monthly cost. Again, the pro version doesn‚Äôt have anything NEW to offer, simply releases the restrictions on helpful functions that WERE ALREADY INCLUDED in the basic app. 

Bullsh*t subscription economy. Time to find another app.

App used to be amazing. I used it for years, and even supported them with the $2.99/month pro price at times. A recent update limits the number of expenses you can enter per day to 3. This basically makes the app unusable as the app is now paywalled. In addition, they have raised their price to $4.99 a month. All this comes without any warning or communication from Splitwise leadership. This is not the way to treat your users. Maybe some communication and a steady ramp up in fees may have worked better. This move seems to have alienated many of their loyal users based on the recent reviews.

Review Title: Good app, unfortunately not worth it anymore
Review Text:
Wonderful app that makes it easy to share and split expenses with other people.

Unfortunately, now can only add 3-5 expenses in a 24h time period before getting a message that your "expense limit is reached", and you have to wait until the next day before adding more expenses. The only way around this is to pay $5/month for their splitwise Pro app. Makes it pretty inconvenient when trying to add up expenses and take care of some financial business on a day off. Would not recommend Splitwise to anyone at this point after this latest money grabbing change

My friend sent me a link to a group split situation. When I open the link (on web) I signed in with Google the link told me to open the app, I open the app and there was no sign in with Google option. I then tried to sign in with an email and password that I use for Gmail but that didn‚Äôt work I needed a sign in with Google option. I then tried to create a new account but it said that my account was already in use and asked then to reset my password and I never got an email this literally took 40 minutes. Please get sign in with Google on the app if you have it on web.

I just moved into a 5 roommate situation and this app has been absolutely perfect EXCEPT for the app sometimes not responding to anything, and needs to be force-closed and reopened once or twice in order to proceed. Happens on my roommate‚Äôs phone too so I know it isn‚Äôt just my phone being old and causing it. There‚Äôs also an issue where at times when an expense I am owed for is settled, it will say that I owe someone else the money they just paid me, but everywhere else shows that everything is settled. 5 stars once this is fixed!

Review Title: One more company, gone to corporate greed
Review Text:
Me and everyone around me used Splitwise for our daily expense splits. Now, it's fallen to the greedy managers who are only interested in showing quarter on quarter profit than actually delivering good service. We used splitwise because it was free and convenient. But since you've fallen to the level of allowing only 4 expenses a day, I promise me and everyone I know using it has vowed to stop using this "useful" app as soon as the current splits are over. 
What makes you think there aren't any more free apps to calculate your shared expenditures?
I'm so disappointed. Thank you for Netflixing the app. Bravo. And bye.

Review Title: Free tier was gutted to push users towards paying, no longer worth it
Review Text: Used to make use of this app religiously whenever going on trips with friends, but now it barely lets you add a transaction or two before forcing you to wait and is limited to letting you add less than 5 a day. Terrible business practice to remove basic functionality and hide it behind a paywall that does not offer much besides an opportunity to restore the app to the way it used to be for free. It‚Äôs insulting to the point that I would rather not use the app even if it was technically better than every other alternative.

Lived off this app for finance, and used it for all of our household expenses for years. Went to add in expenses today and could only enter 2 before hitting a pay wall. There was no warning/email/notification of this change and now we have to transfer all of our expenses elsewhere which is very time consuming‚Ä¶why even bother having a free version if you can only enter two expenses? It‚Äôs deceiving. We‚Äôve loved splitwise over the years, and maybe would have paid for the app if we didn‚Äôt find out of the changes in this fashion.

My household has used Splitwise since 2021 to keep track of shared expenses and it‚Äôs been great! They recently added a paywall and limited usage to 1 or 2 expenses per day and it renders the app useless. $40/year just to track expenses is too expensive when there are similar, free, apps out there and Venmo is in the process of rolling out a Groups function. Also not a fan of the Splitwise Wallet feature- it takes longer than bank transfers from other apps and Splitwise forces the feature by having removed functionality it used to offer from other, more popular and user-friendly, wallet apps.

Review Title: Please stop calling this a free app
Review Text: With the latest updates Splitwise has basically killed the Free Tier. They limit you to 3 transactions per day (across all groups/individuals in total), asking you to upgrade to Pro if you want more than that. As a person who‚Äôs used this app for almost a decade, the changes were sudden and done without any warning. It took me 5 days to update expenses for a group holiday because we all decided to use Splitwise and the changes happened mid holiday. Just absolutely terrible decision-making. THREE expenses per day is a horribly low number to cap the free tier on. It makes the free app not usable at all.

Splitwise is a great app that does a lot of things well, but they recently started forcing a 10 second wait on entering transactions and a daily cap of 3 transactions per day. To me this changes it from a 5 star product to a 1 star product, and I‚Äôm going to convince my friends to move to a better app.

I don‚Äôt mind paying for good apps and would even consider paying ~$3/month for Splitwise, but for it to be useful it needs to have a usable free tier, otherwise there‚Äôs no way I can convince my friends and family to use it, and unless everyone is on board you can‚Äôt really splits expenses. Goodbye, Splitwise.

The worst part is ironically the payments. All the app does is calculate how much you owe. It would be nice if you could connect payment providers directly to the app, I don‚Äôt see any way to do this that is immediately obvious. There is Splitwise pay also but the verification process is not very user friendly: you have to enter your information and then you cannot go back if you make a mistake. They only accept certain document types (pdf only?) and you don‚Äôt find this out until after you get all your documents downloaded and ready. Overall I‚Äôll just use my calculator instead.

The easiest way to keep records of money split between friends or roommates, etc. it‚Äôs all there in black and white so you never have to feud over sharing expenses again! Best way I have found to keep a clear record without the awkward conversation of reminding someone they owe you money.  Just the perfect amount of info, quickly add or settle up with your contacts without over complicating things!

Review Title: Where has this been my whole life?!
Review Text: Gone are the days of trying to remember who paid for what and feeling like you got screwed in the end! This app makes it so incredibly simple to keep track of what is owed and then settling up. You can easily customize each expense for the people who should be included. You can also add tip or split it based on percentages. Absolutely amazing. I will use this for the rest of my life.

This app used to be really really good; and then instead of coming out with new features to change for, they created a Splitwise free tier that not only limits  the number of transactions in a day, it‚Äôs also impossible to attach a receipt. Imagine you are setting up a household with a new roommate, you can only add four bills each per day. It will take days to get a household set up. Not being able to attach a receipt makes the app have little value as there is no proof of expenses between group members  within the app.

Review Title: Rate limiting makes the app borderline useless
Review Text: **TL;DR: Don‚Äôt waste your time getting used to this app which is clearly on a path to being subscription-only.** Fully functional as a free app for years, and then they add a daily transaction limit for free users without so much as a warning! The limit has also slowly been decreasing, so I imagine it will be completely inaccessible for free users eventually. $40/year is an insane price when you could spend less than 10 minutes finding a better, free app‚Äîor even replicating the old free functionality in Excel or Google Sheets. Seriously, look elsewhere.

My partner and I have been using Splitwise for a little more than a year to split household expenses. It was great until they added a 3 expense daily limit to the free tier with no notice. Since I add all of my expenses at the end of the month, this just doesn‚Äôt work for me. 

I understand that they are trying to push more people to the paid subscription tier, but making the free option virtually unusable for anyone who doesn‚Äôt want to immediately log their expenses is feels underhanded. It‚Äôs a bold move considering the service they provide can be replicated fairly easily with a free google sheet.

I love the app but the pro subscription is expensive. I understand the company needs to make money but should allow basic app functionality for free and make other features like receipts/groups/stats/currency premium only. Maybe try adding a cheaper subscription just with unlimited transactions and receipts or a one time lifetime subscription with all the pro features for a decent price! Thank you!

Love the idea of the app but lacks a few things. While I am the admin of this trip, I didn‚Äôt pay for all expenses in need of splitting. When I would add a balance to split to another person, but remove me it still showed me as being owed. Somehow I need to show the one who paid and who should split that balance with that person. Also, users were able to show payments for an amount they gave to me (outside of thehowever the activity wasn‚Äôt in the app so it showed as if I owed them.

This is a super useful app. Just used it on a trip with 10 people and it made keeping track of payments super simple. The pro version looks very useful but I wish it was not subscription based. I would absolutely purchase pro if there was as an option for one time purchase or even the ability to apply pro features per group/trip. Again, can‚Äôt recommend the app enough

If you‚Äôre on a trip with friends for example, this app is a must have. It‚Äôs REALLY easy to keep track of expenses, who paid what and when. My friends and I went on a road trip and it really made our life a lot easier. By the end of the trip we already new exactly the amount we owed each other, the app makes all the complex calculations (including foreign currency). Totally recommend this app.

I always have trouble keeping track of who owes what when doing anything that requires more than one expensive with a group of friends. SplitWise is a brilliant and simple ways to keep track of who has spent what in order to avoid that awkward moment when everyone‚Äôs individual totals don‚Äôt add up. I have told everyone that I know about the app and will be continuing to use it in the future!

I used to use this app when I lived with my housemates. It was the perfect tool to track all of our expenses and I was very satisfied with the app. But of course just like any other greedy people on earth you need to pay $5 a month to have unlimited expenses added and they force you to watch them ask you to upgrade to pro to skip ad for 8 seconds. It use to not be like this. You where able to put as many expenses as you want and not forced to wait 8 seconds. I‚Äôm so disappointed but what can I do right?

Amazing app but have a couple feature requests!..would be so helpful if everyone got a notification when you go to pay to make sure that everyone‚Äôs submitted all their expenses! Could also be accompanied by a requirement for everyone to agree that their expenses are all in. We just often have issues with people settling up before everyone is done submitting!

I have used (and loved) Splitwise for years. I sat down today to do my end of the month expenses, which included adding things to Splitwise. I discovered they‚Äôd switched to only 3 expenses per day and you‚Äôre only able to add the expenses after staring at ‚Äúswitch to pro!‚Äù screen for several seconds. I was given no heads up that this change was happening. So now I have a month‚Äôs worth of expenses, and I‚Äôm only able to add 3 per day. I‚Äôll definitely be using a different app (or Google Sheets) moving forward. To make this kind of change without notifying users is not okay. Do better, Splitwise.

Review Title: Get rid of the combine debts option!
Review Text: Used Splitwise for the first time a couple months ago with a group and it was fantastic. Used it again this time left it at the default setting of combing debts and it screwed up everyone‚Äôs totals as it lumped other friends‚Äô side meals or drinks and created havoc. Splitwise does not really explain the difference. Really should not ever have the combine feature as this lost a lot of trust in newcomers to the app that said SplitWise really mucked things up as each person paid, it lowered other people‚Äôs debts inaccurately. Remove this combine debts option! It‚Äôs not clear with the description.

Splitwise will go down the drain mark my words, with growing costs, economy etc. I understand the purchase model etc. Splitwise used to be a favorite app among friends since it was easy and free to use and it'll immediately send notifications, I have been using since the last ten years but now it's changed to a monthly subscription model which I strongly detest not for it asking me to pay but there are other models with which the developers completly forgot. I hope they understand. Us friends used to split expenses even before Splitwise existed for free on a good old excel sheet. Bye bye splitwise.

Review Title: Used to be good, don‚Äôt bother downloading
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using this app for years and WAS an amazing service for trips with large groups of friends. Now they limit only 3 entries per day (unless you go pro) which clearly is just strong-arming everyone into their paid version. I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying except they‚Äôre lying to their customers telling them it‚Äôs ‚Äúto prevent bots spamming‚Äù and didn‚Äôt warn any of their current customers about this change, had to find out the hard way at the end of a big international trip. Very disappointing and won‚Äôt be supporting this business by paying them.

Review Title: Good app but 3 transactions limit is very low
Review Text:
I have been using split wise since 2018, loved the app as it makes splitting travel expense convenient.
Now they implemented 3 or 4 expense a day limit on the free version. This restriction makes the app more restrictive to use. I dont want to pay 40$ a year or 5$ a month to just split the cost.
Hopefully app developers come up with some alternate way to make money like showing you add after 3 transactions or increasing a limit to 10 transactions or something

This app is great for splitting money between group work! My friends and I use it for when we have group projects at school and it‚Äôs really helpful. My only wish is that you could directly apply your preferred forms of payment in the app instead of just using the connected email. This is just because sometimes your account isn‚Äôt connected to your payment forms (Venmo, PayPal) and then you have to track people down for cash or else wise.

Review Title: Fails constantly, can double bill you.
Review Text: My housemates used this app to pay bills, and it was absolutely awful. I don‚Äôt know what about our setup made it so bad, but i would say about 50% of Splitwise bills I was sent would get screwed up when I tried to pay with Venmo (Splitwise would think I paid and I didn‚Äôt, or the money would go through but Splitwise would think I didn‚Äôt pay). I just settled up my last bill with Splitwise, and it double charged me through Venmo. Horrible application, I will be deleting it now that I‚Äôm moving and will not be using it again. Without exaggeration, this is probably the worst app I‚Äôve used in any context.

Love using Splitwise with friends and family, especially on trips. Recently though, Splitwise has made changes to the free app functionality that are frustrating. Free users are now limited to 3 expenses a day so trip expenses to take a while to input, and I can no longer settle up only ‚Äúnon-group‚Äù expenses if that person is also in a group with me. 

And the constant pushing for Pro is annoying.

Review Title: Incomplete app for tracking shared expenses
Review Text: This app is almost there but lacking a major part to make it a full intuitive and usable app. Unless I have missed something there is no way to deduct just a single persons portion of the a bill without re-editing the entire bill. I don‚Äôt want to delete the whole  payment just one persons portion of one bill when they have paid it. Completely lacking fluidity through the app. Only thing this app is good for as it is set up now is to tell you a total of all bills people owed. Unless they make a full payment it does not work

It used to be a great app and I used it multiple times to split expenses during several trips with friends and family. Worked flawlessly. But they got greedy. Now every time you want to add an expense you have to see the same silly -and annoying- ad pushing you to subscribe, you can‚Äôt skip it or turn it off. It is in your face whether you like it or not. If this was not enough, now you have a limit of 5 expenses you can add per day!  What?! 
Needless to say, my entire group will now delete this app and we‚Äôll look for one less desperate to grab your money. Sad.

Review Title: Ridiculously low limit on adding expenses
Review Text:
Don‚Äôt use this for trips with friends. I had to download this because someone else started a group here but it quickly became a problem when we realized you can only add 3 expenses per day before they ask you to pay. It‚Äôs an unusually restricted limit on what I‚Äôd consider the main function of the app. The payout system through other apps is also buggy.

There are free alternatives to this with more functionality, I‚Äôd suggest doing a quick search for those instead.

Review Title: Used be great but now can‚Äôt do anything without paying
Review Text: Used to be awesome until they decided to limit how many expenses can be put in over one day unless you pay for pro. Not to mention the addition of annoying pop ups every 2 seconds that ask you to sign up for pro. I will probably find another app that does the same thing without the limitations. Too bad - this was one of my favorite apps and I‚Äôve used it for years now. Worked great for splitting household expenses with room mates and for group trips.

I‚Äôve been using this app since grad school in 2008. It has been an amazing, easy app to use for occasional group expenses- a night out or a trip. Where you‚Äôre keeping track of multiple expenses all at once. 

I probably use it once every 2-3 months for a couple of days at a time. 

This new update where you can only submit 3-4 expenses a day is really frustrating. It could be usable, maybe, if you put in expenses as they happen and divide them among the group. But as someone who is the main ‚Äúbookkeeper‚Äù of my friends, I run out way too quickly. 

I don‚Äôt need any of the pro or premium features. I just need to add expenses and get a number at the end. I could see paying $5-10 a year for the basic feature set, but the annual price is $35, or $5.99 a month which is highway robbery. 

Please fix this or you‚Äôre going to lose a lot of subscribers. I‚Äôm already looking at other options.

I used to love this app because I didn‚Äôt use it a ton but when I went on trips with other people.
There were never ads or limits on transactions you could add, but now there are! I understand they need to make money, but I don‚Äôt use this app enough to pay for a subscription and the ads and daily limits have made it almost unusable. I also don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs cool to start charging folks for a service that was always free‚Ä¶ the premium should offer premium products. Not the normal Splitwise product.

Like the majority of end users on here were tired of the subscription model on everything we enjoy using in life. I have been an avid user of this app for over 3 years and now I have to pay to add more than 3 expenses. 

Splitwise you have had over a month since you rolled this out to back track and save your reputation. Clearly all you care about is profits over people. I think the majority of us free users would rather have ads then forcing yet another subscription model down our throats. 

I‚Äôm moving on to alternatives for now. Good luck

Too expensive for what it is. Barely better than a spreadsheet so I definitely won't pay subscription cost. Free version can only input 4 expenses per day, for no good reason other than to try and convince you to upgrade to a subscription. Seriously, one of the main functions of the app is limited. Maybe if they added the ability to forward an email receipt and it automatically entered the cost then I would subscribe. But it's such a basic app that it's not with paying for.

This is one of the top apps i have seen/used to coordinate spending as a group. Very efficient flow, convenient ways to settle.  Deserves 5 star!

Unfortunately, those kind of expenses happens not often for me, hence my only wish is to have a more flexible payment option- like a per group payment (paying for one specific event) etc..

This is really a nice addition to travel apps.  I only have one complaint and that is the ability to edit at multiple levels of the app. It is not clear where to find the edit function. For example, I wanted to change the label for my trip and for the life of me can't find a way to edit.  An edit function should be labeled and clear.  If traveling to multiple countries, its important to list them separately.  Still figuring things out.

I‚Äôm a long time user (all couple, trip expenses for 4+ yrs) and I‚Äôm migrating off. 

Free tier is a joke. 
- My main use case is trips with friends, which rack up more than 3 expenses per day between meals, rentals, activities. Splitwise was great for being able to log expenses before you forget, which is now not the case
- Each expense takes 30+ sec to log because I have to watch an ad for the pro tier, EVERY TIME. I already have reduced benefits on the free tier. Now I need to spend more of my time as well? No thank you. 
- My partner and I each have to pay $40/year to get old free capability back?? That‚Äôs half the cost of Netflix 

To the Splitwise team: I know you need to monetize. I get it. But this is not it. Some suggestions 
- Revisit how you estimated customer elasticity
- Consider combos like unlimited expenses + ads
- Consider a middle pricing tier. I don‚Äôt need analytics, but I would consider paying for more expenses + no ads

Review Title: Great way to share expenses for roomies or adventures!
Review Text: Looking into Splitwise premium after using free version for the past year to track expenses with roomie after losing my job and fighting with the state for 8 months for my PEUC! We still use it to track shared expenses at home, out, & traveling. Now learning to include individual expenses to be able to use reports to manage spending stress free.

Review Title: Unable to log in with Facebook
Review Text:
I was sent a link to join a group and logged in through Facebook. Now when I download the app I cannot log in through Facebook on the app because that feature doesn‚Äôt exist. 

I‚Äôm supposed to be able to log in through my browser through Facebook and then either set or reset a password. However the link to ‚Äúcontinue to the Splitwise website‚Äù doesn‚Äôt work and just leaves me on the same page. 

And when I try to use the reset my password link by giving them my email it takes me to a page to reset it, but tells me there was an authorization error when I enter my new password. It tells me I need to enable cookies or something but cookies were enabled by default in both my safari and chrome browser and it still doesn‚Äôt work. 

So now without an actual desktop or laptop I have no way to access my account.

I wish I had this when I was splitting an apartment with my sister and best friend!!
