We always wanted to make sure we were paying each other equally so no one felt burdened for picking up the tab or grabbing groceries and not getting paid back later. This would have been a lifesaver! I‚Äôm so happy to use it now with my friends!

Review Title: Yeah, paywalls for more than 4 uses is garbo
Review Text: App is well designed and is great for making life easier. Used it for several years with relatively no issues. Then the paywall hits after 4 daily uses (not to mention two 10 second pro-features ads for the last two uses). I haven‚Äôt looked into the pro features all that much, but for an over-glorified calculator that is most useful for students and young adults, this is such a waste of our money. When my balances with my contacts zero out, I‚Äôm deleting this account and going to find other alternatives.

Review Title: App was better before they added splitwise pay
Review Text: It used to be much simple to transfer and withdraw funds using Venmo or PayPal. Now they‚Äôve added their own account so there‚Äôs another balance to keep track of and another app that has my financial information. It added an extra unnecessary step and a pain point for the users. You can still use venmo and PayPal but it‚Äôs hidden, which means someone in your group will likely send you splitwise bucks and you‚Äôll have to buy into their system to retrieve your funds. I‚Äôll no longer recommend this app for group expenses.

I‚Äôve been using the free version of this app for years and it used to be awesome.  However, they ruined it by requiring users to watch an ad EVERY time something is added.  I get that app development and ongoing support costs money, but 1:1 ad to entry is excessive.  I don‚Äôt have time for that.  I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying a small fee but I think the month/annual fee is too high for this type of app.  Another app I use for tracking travel budgets has added the same functionality, so I guess I can just eliminate this one.

It takes a little tutoring to make sure everyone understands how to split unequal expenses, but once everyone is on board, works great! Make sure you turn on ‚ÄúSimply Group Debts‚Äù under the settings for any group you set up. Vastly minimizes the number of transactions when settling up. For our group of seven, it reduced the number of payments from 21 to 6.

Review Title: Keeps things on the up and up
Review Text:
I‚Äôm so pleased to have found Splitwise! My partner and I use it for all our shared expenses and we keep things 50/50. 

This makes it so easy, transparent and saves us from any conflict or misunderstanding.

Plus when you add friends, gone are the days when paying last at a group dinner leaves you with the short stick.

I love this app!! It keeps our household accounts super organized! My husband and I split everything, but we only have our individual bank accounts... so this app is super useful to keep track of who paid what and make sure everything is fair. This app is perfect! I just wish they had an "individual" section to keep track of my personal expenses as well.

The idea for this app is rock solid but what it delivers does not. My roommates and I got this app so that we could split utilities easier and it kinda worked. First, the UI is wildly confusing, and the screen is a bit cluttered and often times it is unclear who‚Äôs paying for what. Second is the clunky way the splitting up is handled, I really can‚Äôt describe what‚Äôs going on but there seem to be ghost expensive and some roommates paying more than others, it‚Äôs all rather hazy and unclear. After awhile we just went back to the old fashioned way of using a calculator.

My family loves this app because we always forgot who paid who for family events and presents. This way as soon as you pay for something you enter it and then my family can pay me whenever but at least I didn‚Äôt forget!  Plus it is connected to Venmo and other easy ways to pay.

I downloaded this when it was free and convenient. Now Splitwise requires a paid subscription or else you sit through a ten second ad before every transaction entry and even then you‚Äôre maxed out at a handful of entries per day. So effectively the ‚Äúfree‚Äù version is an excuse to trap people into the concept. Marketing, eh?

I‚Äôm an accountant and i just made a spreadsheet in 5 minutes that does what this app wants payment for. In fact, I‚Äôm now going to create a competing app that stays free because why not? It‚Äôs a free country. I‚Äôll do what I want.

Splitwise was a beautiful idea to help people until greed came into play.

Review Title: They just made the free app so much worse
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using Splitwise for 5 years now. It‚Äôs been a great way to split up expenses at home and between friends on trips. It has always been free, until they just recently started limiting the number of expenses you can enter on their free version. Today I could only enter two expenses, and got hit with a pop-up saying I need to upgrade to Pro or wait until tomorrow to enter my third expense. This app is essentially a glorified Excel spreadsheet. I will happily delete this app and create a cloud spreadsheet myself over paying a cent for a glorified calculator. Good riddance!

It seems like there is now a cap on the number of expenses you can add in one day.. the cap is 3 expenses/day. Surely, The team at splitwise have lost their minds by adding this constraint. 3 expenses in one day make absolutely no sense, I would understand the concept of capping at a certain number of expenses to maybe 7-10 but 3?! If the cap isnt lifted in the near future then splitwise will definitely loose my account! Unacceptable, why on earth would I pay extra money just to keep track of the money i spent for a slightly better experience compared to writing it down on a notes app?!

I loved Splitwise and it was an easy way to share expenses. I‚Äôm not a ‚Äúpower user‚Äù by any means, and the free version was adequate for my needs. I‚Äôm an effort to push you into spending $5/mo, they‚Äôve m recently limited the free version to three entries per day. Seriously? Normally, I go days or weeks between hitting that limit but I just got back from a trip and wanted to backdate some of expenses. Looks like it‚Äôs going to take me four days to enter 10 things. I‚Äôm not paying $60/yr for that privilege. So long Splitwise, it was nice while it lasted and thanks for alienating your user base.

This has been so helpful for me and my roommates, me and my friends when we go on a group trip, and now me and my partner in our relationship. It‚Äôs fair, it balances everything out, and this way we don‚Äôt have to worry about paying each other back after every single little purchase, we can wait til the trip/month is over. I highly recommend it!

Took a trip to Europe with 12 fraternity brothers. I don‚Äôt know what we would have done without this app. Some people had international fees on cards so others would front a lot of money. We pretty much evenly split a lot of meals and this app made it incredibly easy to keep track of everything, especially since it gives you the option to make entries in any currency.

Review Title: A Good Thing Comes to an End - 3 Expense Limit
Review Text: I only use app maybe once every year for trips with friends, it was very handy to keep track of expenses, but sadly all good things apparently must come to an end. Delays due to popups to subscribe makes it easy to forget amounts entering.  And only allowing 3 transactions daily has made me look for alternatives.  Understand need to monetize and I wouldn‚Äôt mind a one-time small fee ($5) to allow more daily transactions but $40/year as only alternative to use once a year is unreasonable.

Used to be a great app for splitting expenses. Now they only allow 4 expenses per day unless you upgrade to Pro. There‚Äôs no way I‚Äôm ever upgrading to Pro for this service. In order to upgrade to Pro, there needs to be a value add for Pro. A feature like ‚ÄúReceipt Scanning‚Äù is a value add that could make a user want to upgrade to Pro. However, a feature like ‚Äúunlimited expenses‚Äù is a base level feature that makes this app usable. It needs to be part of the free tier and you should not be forcing people to upgrade in order for this app to be usable. Time to switch away

Review Title: Forced to pay or find an alternative
Review Text: Their recent update to the free/paid tiers has made me looking for alternatives. Now I only get to put in a maximum of 3 expenses a day without paying $5/month or $40/year for the pro version. In my opinion, the prices are steep and I‚Äôd entertain them if they were lower. The additional functionality of the pro version was never useful to me which is why I‚Äôve never considered paying. We‚Äôve been using this app for over 3 years now. It‚Äôs a very useful app and I‚Äôve recommended it to many, but now I‚Äôm looking at what else is out there.

Review Title: Great App, needs custom fields for currencies.
Review Text:
It‚Äôs fine if they can‚Äôt be converted, but often time debts are expressed in terms of other than fiat money, for example work, cryptocurrency, time spent, even physical assets (case of beer or fixing something you damaged.

If you added support for this, I would definitely give five stars. If you added integration for custom APIs providing the price of the custom currency in USD, well that would be amazing.

Review Title: Splitwise sent my venmo payment to a wrong account
Review Text:
Splitwise assumed the email i used to sign up was the email on my Venmo app so someone sent a payment there now I‚Äôm grappling with Venmo to get that money. I don‚Äôt know why Splitwise didn‚Äôt ask the user to verify what their actual Venmo is first to avoid this??? 

Also the Splitwise pay is currently holding $1k in my cash while they verify my social security card and tax receipts to verify my identity. All seems a bit much over an app to split bills. Way too many steps when there are way easier apps out there like Splittr which i wish i had used now.

How can an app make assumption on where to send the money?  PayPal and Venmo linking can‚Äôt be a side effect of setting up an email.  Splitwise assumes the email is shared between splitwise and PayPal.  With Venmo, it assumes that the app installed on your phone is the way to go.  With money transfer, things need to be explicit and not a side effects.  I need to be able to select a PayPal account or Venmo account.  I also need the ability to allow usage of Venmo or PayPal, again it is implicit. If the password for Splitwise is leaked, all of a sudden I am getting all the Venmo money for this user. That is messed up and insecure.

Review Title: Such potential but too many issues at the moment
Review Text:
I love the idea of Splitwise, I really do, but there are various issues. 

1. Why is there no option to reverse an action if someone in the group settles up too early? Makes it very complicated. 

2. There should be the option for one person in the group to be the captain or CFO, and only that person can give permission to everyone to settle up. We used it all weekend and one person settled up too early and now the whole tab is messed up and we have to redo it by hand. 

3. Also, originally (when I first used Splitwise over two years ago) Splitwise would make it so you owed the the least amount of people in the group and the least amount of people owed you. The past two times I‚Äôve used it with a group, I‚Äôve had to pay numerous people and numerous people have had to pay me. Seems like something has changed.

My cousin and I used this app to keep track of our expenses as well as what we owe each other during our 17 day trip to Europe and it was great. Not only does it allow you to pay attention to how much you‚Äôre spending, but it also allowed us to ‚Äúsettle the debt‚Äù in one payment rather than us trying to pay each other back throughout the whole trip.

I‚Äôve been an evangelist for this app for my friends for years due to it simplifying keeping track of group expenses. It‚Äôs always a challenge to get the skeptical to download another app but I have always thought the group ledger was worth it over individually tracking in spreadsheets. However, with the bait and switch to the new ‚Äúpro‚Äù version, the developers have rendered the app effectively useless without paying a ridiculous fee. I now have to eat crow to my friends after I convinced them to use the app and use one of the many free alternatives out there.

It finally happened. This used to be the greatest app. But now requires a subscription for any kind of practical use. When your competition is a free Google spreadsheet, I have no idea where the developers get off thinking a $5/month fee is justified. I tried to use this on my most recent trip and was saddened to see its use gated by a fee. Took me all of 30 seconds to find a free Google spreadsheet tool that does the EXACT SAME THING this tool did. I uninstalled immediately after this change. Find another way to monetize the app but a monthly fee is not the way.

Have been using Splitwise for 5 years. They updated the app so that you must wait ten seconds to enter every expense while you get spammed by Splitwise wanting you to upgrade to Pro. In addition, now you can only enter 5 expenses a day. 

Before this update, this app was very useful. Now it‚Äôs useless to me. The cost of upgrading to Pro is ridiculously overpriced for the service it provides. I would consider paying $10 once for the pro version, or $1 a month or less. But I will not pay the current asking price. I will be finding an alternative.

I‚Äôve been a long time user of Splitwise, and I have recommended it to friends and family with no hesitation in the past. But they have recently rolled out an expense input limit (appears to be 3 per day) with no warning. I assume this is to push users to paying for pro, which I‚Äôve felt no need to do until now. I use this app regulatory for splitting costs in a shared household and I think it‚Äôs really unfortunate that they‚Äôre sacrificing a great, easy-to-use app in hopes to get a few more profits. At the very least, they should rethink the 3 expense per day limit for free users.

Rarely write app reviews, but this app is a literal godsend. I have no idea what we‚Äôd do without it, keeps track and automatically adds recurring bills, we use it for splitting groceries, dinners out, random household items, virtually everything, and let‚Äôs us do one easy payment to whoever owes the most once a month. The Venmo integration is super easy and makes it nice and smooth, no excuses with this app! 5/5!

My friends and I used to love this app. 

However recent changes have killed the fun. Restricting use to certain intervals to push us to the pro version is shady and annoying.  I think you guys need to remember you‚Äôre literally just an automatic spreadsheet and calculator app.   The subscription model isn‚Äôt worth that for me or anyone else I know. 

Let‚Äôs talk about how absolutely terrible Splitwise pay is too.  My friend paid me on 3/3 via Splitwise pay.  It took 4 business days to hit my Splitwise wallet where I then had to transfer it to my bank and as of 3/11 I still don‚Äôt have the money.   Why in the world would anyone use this over Venmo?  Oh let me guess the pro version clears your money faster right?

Dear developers,  stop this attempted cash grab and go back to being a humble free app.  Otherwise you‚Äôll be replaced by the notepad and calculator that are free on my phone.

Review Title: Removed features and now restricts transactions
Review Text:
They removed the quick add feature so I can‚Äôt easily type in what I want, a feature I‚Äôve used reliably for years. They also now restrict me to 3-5 transactions per day which would mean I would have to keep up with this every day rather than do it once a month, or I would have to pay for premium.

Edited to reply:
I can‚Äôt add expenses normally for me. I used the quick add feature exclusively and plus it‚Äôs limiting me to 3-5 per day. I‚Äôm only planning on catching up and switching to another platform. It‚Äôs a shame.

Review Title: Over monetiziation has ruined a once great app
Review Text:
The app itself is great when it works, however pretty much immediately you are bombarded with messages asking you to purchase a subscription for the pro version.

They intentionally diminished the experience of the app and made it harder for users, in order to monetize it. You can only log a certain number of expenses a day, must wait 10 seconds after clicking buttons, and even are not able to convert between different currencies, just in the name of monetization.

Very frustrating experience.

Review Title: Became unusable since they started pushing Splitwise Pro.
Review Text:
Being limited to three expenses a day along with unskippable ads‚Äîwhen I‚Äôm usually bulk-adding expenses for a trip all at once‚Äîhas made the app nigh unusable. I‚Äôd happily pay a one-off fee for the app, but adding yet another $40 annual fee is completely untenable. Remarkable that they‚Äôve managed to tank the functionality of this app overnight, and have vastly overestimated the value the app provides.

I‚Äôve recommended this app to so many people over the years, and it‚Äôs so disappointing to finally have to uninstall it and find something new.

Review Title: This app used to be great
Review Text: This app used to be so easy to use. I recommended it to all my friends until they started putting restrictions on the number of expenses you can add daily unless you buy the pro plan. 3 expenses per day is an absurdly low limit if you‚Äôre traveling, have roommates etc. Also the app says you can get rid of ads by buying the pro plan but I‚Äôve literally never have any ads on the app UNLESS they‚Äôre for the pro plan. Unless the developer removes these feature, I‚Äôll be finding another app to use or just switch back to doing the math myself.

Hi Splitwise! My friend group uses your app all of the time for trips. It is great. The one note I have is you should ‚Äúgate‚Äù the settle up feature. Inevitably, one person always ‚Äúsettles up‚Äù too soon and we have to go back and correct things. Maybe make a gate so that the settle up is only offered when everything is in. 

Thanks for hearing me out!

Split reminders is a wonderful feature to use if I don‚Äôt want to manually send a text to someone regarding the payment. But instead of just sending them an email, it would be wonderful if the other party receives it as a push notification and they also see it in their activity section.
Great app :-)

Splitwise is super useful for road trips where you have a lot of different people taking on various group expenses. Splitwise makes it really easy to assign who paid for the expense, and provides a lot of surprisingly user-friendly flexibility in assigning who should pay back the expense and how much they should pay back. It‚Äôs very well conceived and designed.

I used to love this app and recommend it to everyone I know. However now when I add expenses I got a message after just TWO expenses that I had to get pro. It didn‚Äôt even explain that I would only get 2 per day and that I could come back and add more tomorrow, so not only was I frustrated with the limiting but I was also very confused about what was actually happening. I don‚Äôt need any of the pro features so I don‚Äôt want to pay for it, but adding 2 transactions per day is pretty much useless. I‚Äôd rather just make an excel sheet at this point.

Review Title: Used to be great - 3 expenses per day limit killed app
Review Text: I‚Äôve used Splitwise for many years, and recommended it to friends. The recent update 3 expenses per day + 10 second waiting screen between expenses makes it unusable. I recently took a trip with a friend and have approx 20 entries to make, which in the current ‚Äúfree‚Äù tier will take me literally a week of visiting every day which wastes a ton of time just to settle up. Since I only take a few group trips a year, Pro isn‚Äôt worth it. Would be better if daily limit was 10-15 entries. Will be looking for an alternative.

They took the thing the app did well and added harsh restrictions and intentional delays. Now it does less than it used to. 

They could have convinced people to pay for the subscription by adding features, but instead they just throttled the core functionality. Shrinkflation in software form. 

They probably don‚Äôt care if they lose 90% of the users that wouldn‚Äôt have paid anyways, but this kind of change sure won‚Äôt convince anyone to start paying when other free options, which now perform better in comparison, are out there.

Unless you really need currency conversion or just enjoy paying another subscription for the sake of it, move on and find another option.

I‚Äôve used the app for years to track bills and expenses with roommates as well as traveling groups and outings for work or with friends. It used to work well in all of those cases.

The recent update now only allows 3 expenses per day to be added for free tier - this makes the app all but useless for any but the most minimal user. I‚Äôm doing the same once my last few expenses are settled up.

It seems that Splitwise is looking to boost their premium subscriptions, but hasn‚Äôt been able to find a way to offer services worth paying for. Instead, they‚Äôve decided to make the free version considerably worse in the hopes. 

As of recent changes, free users can only upload 3 expenses per day, and must sit through a 10 second unskippable ad to do so. I‚Äôve happily used Splitwise for years, but will now be looking for alternatives. I seriously don‚Äôt recommend anyone use this app or support their garbage business practices.

Review Title: Great AP but they want too much $ for it
Review Text: I‚Äôve been using the free version of the ap for a while and it works well but they have introduced a 10 second delay before I can log a transaction in order to push me into paying $40 a year for the ‚Äòpro‚Äô version.  I appreciate that they need to get a return on their product but $40 one time let alone annually is too much.  $10 or $20 one time would be worth it for the basic version.  The pro version doesn‚Äôt add anything I need.   I guess we will be using a shared google doc going forward.

Amazing app to use to capture shared expenses and balance things out. I‚Äôm using it on a 6 week trip with spouse and in-law, and it AVOIDS ALL THE ARGUING. Each person can see where they are, and pay the next expense if they‚Äôre down. Doubles as a log of where we‚Äôve been and what we‚Äôve done. Using the free version, may upgrade for other features.

Review Title: This App is a must have!
Review Text:
It is an awesome reliable tool to use. Its great for keeping track of expenses & splitting it or just self tracking. 
It would be cool if the app allowed you to use your location so it can just automatically capture where the expense occurred in real time. Not sure if that falls under the paid version or not. Good job app geniuses!

Amazing app! Resolves what I usually have to do with Excel and many formulas. Great time saver and makes things clear for everyone. 

It would be nice to have the ability to store the IDs for the integrated applications (Venmo, Paypal) as it uses the member‚Äôs email address and this creates a mess when using the great integrated payment feature. 

Also including an integration to Zelle would be nice to have.

Review Title: Great App, wish more people utilized it!
Review Text: Having had roommates for most of my life, sometimes splitting bills and utilities can be hectic and obnoxious. This definitely is a game changer for you to make sure your roomies are paying their portion, and the bills are paid on time!  Highly recommend for busy young adults, simplifying something that can get complicated easily, but doesn‚Äôt need to be!!

adding expenses is fairly simple and "settling up" with someone is quick. however, it would be nice to see an individual list of what i owed because in the "group view" things get convoluted. i personally like sending my venmo requests with context saying "im paying you back for _specifics_" so it would be nice to have that feature. its also another way for an individual to "audit" their spending and correct anything on the group's end if there's any discrepancy.

You guys have a fantastic app that makes everything very easy. But your recent limits on transaction and mandatory 10 second adds for pro are really scaring people away. At this rate, a competitor is going to snap up your user base because people are sick of them. Already, friends prefer to use venmoed new group feature for convenience. I like your app, and I just hope you don't get buried because of this.

I used to love this app and used it every time I went on a trip with friends. I tried to use it today since I‚Äôd just finished up a trip and it‚Äôs littered with ads for the ‚Äúpro version.‚Äù So you have to wait 10 seconds before you type in your expense which is annoying in itself and on top of that you only get 4 expenses per day. Absolutely ridiculous that they‚Äôre basically forcing you to upgrade to the expensive pro version just so you can type in all your expenses at the same time. Not worth it anymore.

UPDATE: the limit of adding 3 expenses a day makes this even harder to use, as most people are using it after complex group trips etc.  ORIGINAL: The main problem with Splitwise is that it‚Äôs not clear when transactions are final, so you get people ‚Äúsettling up‚Äù before everyone has put in their expenses. And then everything has to be refigured out. The app should have a clear process for this. Also I have 2 accounts that apparently can‚Äôt be merged because someone set up a group with my alternate email. Overall a poor use experience.

Was it Einstein who said that things should be as simple as possible, but not simpler? That‚Äôs what this app is. Granted, we had a small group and few transactions - but it made things soooo easy. Hoping I‚Äôll be able to convince my retiree lady friends to use this for our next trip (still working on getting them to use Venmo :/).

Everything is perfect. Just I have one suggestion. If someone joins the group after some costs are already recorded, the newly joined person should be automatically included for all share-by-all entry. Right now I have to manually select this person after joining, for each pre-existing cost entry.

I used to track shared expenses on a Google sheet and because it would take forever I always put it off for weeks! Now I just add something right when I pay it and my roommates get notified. It also makes it so they are responsible to put their own stuff in so that I don‚Äôt have to!

This app is the best way to split up group travel expenses ‚Äî it provides multiple methods for allocating group expenses for a trip (dollar amount, percentage, shares) to the members of the group, and allows users to select different allocation methods for different expenses and include different group members for each expense. Takes all the complexity and stress out of computing and settling up the balance.

What a game changer! Used this on a trip with several friends. Rather than stacks of receipts and excel spreadsheets, we used Splitwise to divy up 10 days of expenses from grocery store runs, to guided fly fishing trips. We settled up via PayPal, Venmo, etc which allows others to pay with credit cards if they want so they can get miles and points as well-rather than just writing a check. LOVE THIS APP!

I love the new 15 second timer that keeps me from adding an expense to my group, while I view an ad for Splitwise premium. It‚Äôs my favorite, absolute favorite way to spend my time. I might have to go take a a break from writing this review to go watch that ad again. Wow. To all the product managers who decided that monetization is now required, I have something important to say: I love you. I hope you keep on monetizing, everywhere you go in your career. Make the world a better place! You‚Äôre doing great!

Review Title: Putting limit to adding expenses just shows how badly they want your money
Review Text: First of all nobody would pay $4 each month just to add a few more transactions in a day. So not sure what was the Splitwise team thinking when they decided to annoy and irk their long time customers by putting a cap on no of transactions you can add in a day. Do you really believe I would so badly want to add all my transactions in just a single day that I would pay $4 for it? If anything you just made me search for alternatives and you lost me as a customer forever. Good bye and good riddance.

I love Splitwise and had been using it for years. However with the recent changes to only allow adding 3 expenses per day along with the other pay walls is ridiculous. $40 a year is too much, I would be open to paying a larger one time fee of $40 but that amount yearly is ridiculous, especially when you consider that price will likely continue to increase. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in this newest update to Splitwise and actively working on finding other options.

Review Title: Splitwise pay is incredibly confusing for your friends!
Review Text: So it makes sense that you would be able to pay someone through Venmo in the app and settle up instantly. Do not use Splitwise pay. I have now spent the last four days with a friend trying to figure out how to get the money out of it, and in a big group, it is its own form of confusing and frustrating. Just stay away from it if you want to save yourself the confusion unless you and your friends are particularly tech savvy.

We just started using Splitwise on our vacation. With seven people with mixed allocation for each expense it is a lifesaver. A little confusing initially, it didn‚Äôt take long to figure it out and, once learned it is both very easy to use and very able to meet all the different charge allocations. Kudos to the developers.

Took a group trip with 6 people and 3 countries. This was SUPER easy for all of us to use, helped simplify bills, reduced stress, and allowed us to even balance along the way in terms of who was ahead/behind to reduce the burden on any one person.  The only recommendation I‚Äôd make is allow the app to input an exchange rate and auto convert back to one common currency if people are traveling abroad!

This has been fabulous for group trips and splitting expenses easily. One request would be for the person being paid to specify if they want to be paid via PayPal, Venmo or cash. Or maybe add a Zelle option? We‚Äôve run into issues where a person was paid via a method they did not use and it was a hassle to get the $$. Thank you for your consideration!!

The whole point about having a handy app to track expense with friends is to update everything TIMELY so you don‚Äôt miss anything. The daily limit is stupid, digging the app‚Äôs own grave. Yes I understand the developers deserve to earn money, but the daily limit straight up pushed my to use Notes instead. I‚Äôm fine with waiting a bit with the crab, but daily limit is too much. Would not use after settling everything up with my friends

I love being able to add one time and recurring expenses, so everyone knows when and who to pay and how much. I also love that it simplifies balances and evens payments out so we have to do less transactions to settle up with everyone. 
It does get a little confusing sometime remembering where to go if you‚Äôre doing personal vs group expenses, but overall it makes life so much easier.

The app works well enough, but as a loyal user for years I was really put off by their sudden paywall for basic features. Now you can only input 3 expenses/day. It‚Äôs not like this is prohibitive ‚Äî you can just wait a day to put stuff in ‚Äî so it‚Äôs designed to just annoy you to buy the ‚ÄúPro‚Äù version. No way is it worth shelling out that cost for what this app does. You can build an excel sheet with the same functionality. I understand the developers need to monetize, but springing this onto legacy users without any notice or justification feels scummy.

I think Splitwise has been awesome for the past 6 months I have been using it. It has been super helpful being able to track spending across people in an easy to use app!

It doesn‚Äôt handle Yen fully correctly, but the tech team was very quick to respond to my suggestion.

Review Title: A must for group travel expenses!
Review Text: This app is genius! Once you all sign up, it‚Äôs a piece of cake to enter the costs. Keeps track of  expenses between two or more people without the headache. Such a relief to not have to keep calculating and jot down expenses or pay as you go. Settling up at the end is much easier.  You‚Äôll be happy you used Splitwise!

Review Title: One of the best expense tracking app
Review Text:
Love all the features. But i think the app should focus on allowing some shortcuts for common action. Like learn from previous reported expenses and show the shortcuts. Sometimes transaction are not monthly/weekly kind of usual repetition. 
In this case you start with duplicating existing transaction, update few fields and save.

Review Title: Great app when traveling with friends
Review Text: Thanks to Splitwise we‚Äôve moved from trying to add up and divvy up who owes what with hand writing it out on the last night to just adding expenses in Splitwise as we go and it keeping a tally of who owes who. Great way to keep track and monitor when you need to step up to pay and work down your shared allotment owed. Splitwise is a group travel game changer!

Splitwise is for adults! No more confusing text threads or people ‚Äúforgetting‚Äù to pay you! It‚Äôs one of the first things I set up on a trip with friends, and I don‚Äôt consider my trip complete until all expenses are in and have been paid in Splitwise. A friendship saver and life hack! What did we do before Splitiwse?!?

The 5 entry daily limit is ridiculous and completely handicaps the app. It‚Äôs a nice idea, but the free version is way too limiting and pro just isn‚Äôt worth it when I can easily use a google sheet. No currency conversions is also just icing on the cake. Will be deleting after my trip is over. I‚Äôd advise the splitwise team to consider ads instead because crippling your very simple, nonessential app in order to force people to get pro is not gonna work, at least not for me.

Review Title: Used to be good until they added a paywall
Review Text: I used to love using Splitwise with my friends but now that you can only add a couple expenses per day unless you pay $5 per month it‚Äôs almost useless because it takes me a week to add in everything I need. $5 per month is crazy, it should be like $1-2 per month. I hope the developers see all this feedback and change their minds or lower the price, because it‚Äôs a great app and they‚Äôre losing a ton of users because of greed.

I used to receive notifications from Splitwise but now I never do; and when I look in the settings, it just has a blanket statement that I have unsubscribed from all email notifications from Splitwise with no ability to resubscribe. This is followed by a list of possible notifications, most of which were toggled on for both push alerts and email notifications. No amount of toggling and saving would actually restore notifications for me. I assume we must now pay to receive notifications.

I have been using this app for about 2-3 years now and have absolutely loved it. However, this new recent update that essentially forces you to get pro as it limits you to 3 transaction adds per day is absolutely brutal. Not only is the price of pro OUTRAGEOUS, it also doesn‚Äôt even add any good features. Very disappointed by this move as $42 (after tax) per year or 8-9 after tax monthly is just way too high. Review Title: Makes Splitting Expenses easy as pie!

Review Title: Ok; but could be a lot better
Review Text:
This app is on the way to being very good. Easier to add members of a group and add in bills that need to be shared. However it needs 2 simple improvements to be as good as it should be as settling up is much more complicated than it needs to be. 
First highlight whether a member of the group can be paid by PayPal and ideally which email address to use. Including how to settle up in a ‚Äòhelp‚Äô section would also be very useful. 
Second I only expected to pay my net balance So for example I owe other group members ¬£30; they owe me ¬£16 so I expected to only pay out my net balance of ¬£14. However the way settle up works means I have to pay out ¬£30 and then wait for group members to pay me back the ¬£16: not only does this add complexity and delay it also increases PayPal costs as you pay a %.

We went on holiday with two other families. This app stopped any tricky conversations and also allowed us to just buy stuff for other kids and adults without any feelings of being taken advantage of or knowing we owed someone loads! 
As the week went on, we actually used to app to decide who should pay for things so that the differences were minimal at the end of the holiday. 
Not sure if the app already does it but would be nice to be able to attach a snapshot of a receipt for each thing but that would just be a bonus on a well working app. 
Highly recommend

Splitwise used to be the go-to bill splitting app. I used it with friends, flatmates, and my partner. Recently, though, they‚Äôve got really aggressive with the Splitwise Premium ads, even adding limitations on the number of expenses you can add per day in the app for free users. 

I understand the need to make money to keep a service running but limiting the core function of an app just feels hostile. There are plenty of reasonable scenarios where you may need to add more than a few expenses at once, yet it doesn‚Äôt seem prudent to spend ¬£40/year on this feature. I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying a few quid a year for it, but ¬£40 is just not good value (ironic for an expenses app!). So I‚Äôm sad to go, but Splitwise isn‚Äôt the best value any more and as a result I‚Äôll be using a competitor instead.

The only thing it needs is the option to convert different currencies to one main currency at the end of the trip. The ability to track them separately is useful but it is difficult to then work out how much is finally owed when combining the currencies at the end.

Review Title: Easy and makes living with people 100x easier
Review Text: I use this so we can keep track of money spent in my flat with my flat mate. We know exactly what we owe each other and we never have to pay each other back for anything anymore. It‚Äôs a good app but the thing that is annoying is that you now need to pay to add more than approx. 3 expenses every 24 hours or so ‚Äî which didn‚Äôt use to be the case. Other premium features seem reasonable to charge for, but the daily limit seems a bit restrictive to me and makes the app less useful as I need to remember to submit expenses on the day they were not incurred, making it a bit of an admin overhead to remember.
I hope you‚Äôll reconsider your position, or at least raise the daily limit to approximately 10 or similar.
Thanks for your hard work on this app.

This is a gem of an app. I use Splitwise with my partner almost daily. The real value for me is in the mental space it frees - I know longer have to think about whether we‚Äôre being fair, or who is in debt to whom. It means whoever has their card out first can just pay and we can split the bill later. 

Also recently used it on a holiday with three people and the ‚Äòsimplify debts‚Äô feature made settling up at the end very easy, requiring two of us to make one payment each. So nice not to have to think about money while on holiday! 

Thanks Splitwise :)

With mainstream accounts from the likes of Monzo, Revolut and even high street banks and stalwarts like PayPal offering similar or better ways of splitting bills, what‚Äôs the point? On a recent trip my 40+ year old friends didn‚Äôt get what SplitWise was supposed to do and laughed when I told them no money changed hands. At a recent weekend away with a different group, despite paying for the ‚ÄòPro‚Äô subscription, the promise of scanning receipts was not achieved and I felt let down. I‚Äôm not a student or 20-something who shares a house with people that skirt on the edge of liquidity, day-to-day, I was just looking for a better way to handle group expenses. This isn‚Äôt it.

Review Title: Used to be great - now ruined by limitations without subscription
Review Text:
This was the best app for many years - countless holidays and monthly shared expenses logged. I used to subscribe to the pro version but their standard offering met my needs so didn‚Äôt subscribe this year. They have now put the prices up and added adverts/time-limits before expenses are logged and given a max number per day. Completely unusable without a subscription (which isn‚Äôt able to be shared with members of your Apple Family). Very disappointing to lose such a brilliant app. 
Why the usual adverts model other apps use to generate revenue without effective mandating subscription was not implemented rather than this is beyond my comprehension.

Review Title: Best pop up kitten app ever
Review Text:
This is the best pop up kitten app I‚Äôve ever used!!

However, it is also handy for splitting expenses on a group trip. We‚Äôve just come back from a six person climbing trip in Spain, we all arrived separately and didn‚Äôt do all of the same things at all same time, so figuring out the costs would have required a lengthy spreadsheet and long dialogue. Remember this when you are thinking about what pop up kitten app you choose.

Review Title: Good but free version now restricted
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used Splitwise for a few years and have found it super useful for balancing out expenses with my partner. We use it for our weekly food shop and any weekday expenses, e.g., a coffee out. Normally I tally it all up for the week on one day and dump onto Splitwise. It‚Äôs transparent and clear.

But now Splitwise have restricted how many expenses you can add per day to just three. If you want to submit more, you need to pay for Pro subscription. So now I cannot use the app as it‚Äôs intended for. I would have given 5-stars if it wasn‚Äôt for reduced offering by Splitwise

Review Title: You got greedy Splitwise. Once my fav app, now redundant. Back to TriCount
Review Text: I've been a free Splitwise user for over 5 years now, mainly for holidays with groups but also for keeping track of household expenses and up until recently it was great. Pro was an option for multi currency and receipt scanning but relatively unnecessary. I've just tried to input a few expenses after a month or so of inactivity and the app is now effectively redundant, 3 expenses a day limit, having to wait 10 seconds between each one. Pro being ¬£40 a year (per person) makes it far too expensive for a glorified spreadsheet. You got greedy Splitwise, looks like you have p*ssed off a lot of people! Back to TriCount then.

Was a game changer for our group holiday. All rounds accounted for, taxis, trips etc so no one had to keep track.
We made a point of putting the expenses in as soon as possible and allowed the app to correct for minimal transactions. No one was worried about not buying a round or who kept going to the bar or jumping out of a round every now and again.
Will be using it repeatedly and sharing it with other friend/family groups

I changed the date of a reoccurring payment from a date in the past to a today‚Äôs date so that the payment would occur today but the amount owing didn‚Äôt change. So when the money was set as paid, it changed from someone owing me money to me owing them money.

This app makes it harder to manage finances than using a notepad.

It is incredibly confusing when dealing with multiple reoccurring payments where dates change often and payment dates vary significantly. The app just does not handle variation well and I‚Äôm still wishing for better functionality like the ability to simply create a money owed for something and then the ability to mark it specifically as paid and done with.

This app was so helpful for planning with my partner but now the new limits are so stupid. I wouldn‚Äôt even mind watching a few ads, but each time I try and ad a new expense it gives me a pointless purple screen which means you‚Äôre not even getting ad revenue and then decides to tell me I can‚Äôt add more than 2 expenses a day unless I pay 4.99 - which feels ridiculous - I‚Äôd at least want a joint subscription to make it worthwhile. As that  between me and my partner 10 a month to manage expenses, I‚Äôd rather just go back to using excel - or use other apps which have similar functionality without the stupidity 

Used to me one of my top apps, what a shame

Review Title: Great app, crap scanning/OCR of Receipts
Review Text: I really like the app, it does all the things you need in terms of regular payments, splitting the bills etc. However the scanner is awful, after paying for the pro version to get this functionality 9/10 times it doesn‚Äôt pick up the store, the amount or the items on the till receipt. The local Co-op, always becomes a shop in Calgary. The total is never correct and it doesn‚Äôt pick up the individual items. So basically you have to enter the details manually and the scan function is just a photo taker...

I‚Äôve been a free Splitwise user for over 5 years now, mainly for holidays with groups but also for keeping track of household expenses and up until recently it was great. Pro was an option for multi currency and receipt scanning but relatively unnecessary. I‚Äôve just tried to input a few expenses after a month or so of inactivity and the app is now effectively redundant, 3 expenses a day limit, having to wait 10 seconds between each one. Pro being ¬£40 a year (per person) makes it very expensive and I‚Äôll be hunting for a better, cheaper alternative now. Way to go Splitwise, from the recent reviews, you‚Äôve p*ssed off a lot of people!!

I used to love this free app. It was so useful for splitting bills and for holidays where you didn‚Äôt have to worry who paid for what. It completely took the angst out of the money side of things. Now they‚Äôve got greedy and only allow 3 transactions a day unless you buy the expensive pro version, we are halfway through an 8 week trip with friends and we‚Äôre using our payment cards a lot. But now you can only do the limited daily transactions it‚Äôs going to take us weeks to catch up with transactions before we can settle up. So, so disappointing. I‚Äôll be looking for an alternative app before I go on holiday again with friends.

I love this app.. So much! It is very easy to use, includes enough details of our expenses and it helps us calculate everything accurately. My flatmates and I used to have to do this manually with pen and paper but now Splitwise does it for us! Makes our life much easier! Thank you to the people who created this.

P/s: minor improvement that can be made- For settling up, it would be nicer to know what items we have or have not paid for. But other than that, this app is perfect!

Splitwise really helped us keep track of our complicated series of expenses which included multiple payers and unequal splitting. At the end of our trip there was no hassle trying to calculate how much each person owes or is owed and with the simplify feature, only one transfer was made by each person - reduces confusion. Also using this app for expenses with my circle of friends and housemates, where the viscous circle of debt never seems to end. Very recommended.

Basic features have been moved behind a paywall, annoying for long term users, but fine. More frustratingly, basic actions like adding expenses - the core function of the app -  have a forced delay of 10 seconds, during which you are shown a message asking if you want to pay for Pro, to go faster. Abysmal experience, throttling my use of the app doesn‚Äôt make me want to give you money, it makes me want to find an alternative, especially since this is basically a calculator with a nice UI. 

Why on earth would I trust this developer not to play the same shady games with me once they have my money?

While I rate splitwise as a cost tracking service 5*, it frustrates me that it tries to offer a payment settlement service as well that is poorly designed and there is no opt out from. I‚Äôve just apparently been sent nearly ¬£100 from a friend via PayPal, except that my paypal is linked to another email so no one actually knows where the money has gone. Further, I didn‚Äôt want to receive the money via PayPal, and splitwise should offer a clear toggle to turn off payment receipts. 

Ultimately splitwise is useful to save the hassle of payment netting when spending with a group, eg on a holiday. However it has caused more inconvenience in this one instance than it will save over the holiday.

Having used the app for a couple years I‚Äôve recommended it to many friends and it‚Äôs certainly a great tool for tracking expenses between a group of people. 

However it now seems the app has changed its strategy and placing an expense not only entails a 10 second advert but now there‚Äôs also now a 2-3 expense daily limit unless you purchase the ‚Äúpro‚Äù version. 

Personally I believe this is a poor way to attract people on to a paid model and considering you can easily do the same thing with a simple spreadsheet I‚Äôll now be looking for an alternative.

Review Title: Good but expensive for what it is
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used this app for a couple of years and it‚Äôs good. However, if I want to upload more than 3 expenses in one day, you now have to pay ¬£4 a month (or ¬£40 a year). I‚Äôd happily pay a bit for this app, but not that much. I‚Äôd rather just split my monthly uploads across 2 days and treat myself to a cup of coffee each month instead. It‚Äôs a shame Splitwise have got greedy. If the cost was half that, I‚Äôd pay, but otherwise, this is just ANOTHER subscription on top of the many I already have.

Review Title: Actually really useful and easy to use
Review Text:

Review Title: Will cheat you off your money
Review Text:
I‚Äôve been using splitwise for at least 6 years. I have had no complaint with it until now and in theory it should deserve 5 stars.

Except that today, they have introduced a daily expense limit, which means I can‚Äôt add more than 3 (?) items per day unless I pay for Splitwise Pro. Pretty shameful.  Thanks! üòä

Review Title: Makes group trips a lot more simple

Review Title: Needs ability to search for a payment
Review Text: A great app but biggest annoyance is your can‚Äôt search for an item - especially handy if you have a long standing house account or friends bill and want to see if something has already been paid (instead have to scroll for ages). It‚Äôs a quick fix I think and would be super handy!

Review Title: Ok, but struggles with group holidays abroad.

I have used Splitwise for years and it was great for group holidays etc. Now the limitation of adding 3 expenses a day makes the whole app completely pointless. I‚Äôm so disappointed. 
Now if you have a group wanting to split expenses we‚Äôd all have to have premium or else load one person with all of the admin - which again defeats the point of splitwise. 
I‚Äôd rather have ads or something if they need to make the money but to put the main function of the app behind a paywall means I‚Äôm just going to have to go and find a different one now.

Limiting the free version to only 3 expenses per day, and making users wait for 10 seconds for no reason other than to create friction are terrible monetisation tactics that have made this app borderline unusable.

It‚Äôs makers clearly do not care about their users, nor value their time. Rather than imposing arbitrary friction on the free experience, they should focus on making amazing premium features that users want to upgrade to.

If you‚Äôre considering downloading this app, save yourself (and your friends) the hassle and go for an alternative.

Review Title: Recent update makes the free version unusable
Review Text:

Such a sudden limitation hinders the app's usability and goes against the convenience it once offered. It feels like a downgrade from the user-friendly experience I initially enjoyed. It‚Äôs the perfect app to split expenses with someone. It‚Äôs not completely intuitive the first time you use it, but becomes second nature after a few mistakes (which are easy to correct).

Difficult to tract what the money is owed for. Very confusing how it calculated money. We love this in my flat, it stops the ‚Äúwho owes who what‚Äù and we use this for all things that we buy as a flat (boring stuff like toilet paper) we also use it when one of us goes to the supermarket, or to buy drinks and we can easily keep track of who has spent what. 100% would recommend best thing ever!

Review Title: Used to be 5* now they‚Äôve limited how many expenses you can enter
Review Text:
Used to love this app, used it for many holiday and house bits.
Very very disappointing that they‚Äôve locked unlimited expense entry behind a paywall, it‚Äôs literally the core feature of the app and I can‚Äôt even watch an ad or something, just a hard nope, go away u til tomorrow or give us ¬£4.
Splitwise ‚Äúpro‚Äù should be for what it says, pro features, not a money grab on the basic functionality of the app especially after years or being free.
Highly disappointed and will now go find an alternative.

Also the lack of ability to link out to Paypal or similar from within the app is a frustration and has been for years.

Hi Team, This app is too good but yesterday I found some Issue there. I was able to see one api error directly.
There is some error handling work for your team.
I have already emailed issue with attachment to splitwise team.
Let me know if you want me to share error screen shot again.

It was a really good app for holidays and in general life with my girlfriend however now they have restricted the spending to 5 a day it‚Äôs useless. 
I don‚Äôt need any of the features of Splitwise Pro and ¬£5 a month is insane for what the app does. I wouldn‚Äôt mind if they had adds and unlimited uploads and the upgrade for all the other features.
I‚Äôve just downloaded Splid which is almost as good but completely free, would recommend that instead

Housemate & I use this to split bills -makes things easier, clear cut who owe who what, without need for awkward conversations. 
The fact that you can add a comment & attach a photo is handy- shows the bill has been paid or can include a note about the billing period. 

Makes life a lil easier!

Have been evangelical about the app for ages, but recent changes make it frustrating to use. 

Forcing users into a recurring subscription model (and quite an expensive for what you actually use it for) is appealing. 

The subscription cost for this app is just a bit under half of what a month of Netflix costs, does that seem reasonable?  

Offer a one time lifetime fee, at a reasonable price and I‚Äôll be happy to pay.  Otherwise just stick with an ad supported free tier, instead of kneecapping the functionality of your users. 

3 transactions a day seems fine, except the main use of this app is when on holiday when their are several small purchases to add. 

1-stat based on company greed.

Review Title: Great App for travelling with friends
Review Text: Love this app. It makes travelling with friends so much easier than before. It would be amazing if you could like your card/bank to the app for quick and easy payments üòäüòä

Review Title: You have just killed this app
Review Text: This used to be a great app which I‚Äôve been using for over 7 years. The introduction of ‚Äòdaily limits‚Äô (restricted to 2) is another pathetic way of pushing people to pay a ludicrous amount for a basic service. Will move to the next competitor. Learn the lesson, people couldn‚Äôt care less about your brand or product. They want the functionality and they will move if they find it elsewhere.
This is a fantastic tool to very quickly and simply keep track of shared expenditure. We use it for a night out, events, etc and it‚Äôs made life so much easier to keep track of who owes who what

It used to be a great app and I used it in my household for 6 years. Clearly the company is now in a rush to make money and totally disregards the user experience and demand. If you are a non-paying user, you have to watch 10 seconds of ad before logging one expense, and the daily cap is 4 expenses. It hurts to see this once amazing app is going down this wrong route. I struggle to reason myself to continue using this app.

I have used this app before for a holiday with friends and it worked perfectly. 

I tried to use it with my housemates for food shops and other expenses and it simply didn‚Äôt work. It would display completely random amounts that each person owed. 
For example my housemate made two small trips to the shop and I owed him ¬£1.25 for one trip, and ¬£2.00 for the other, the total on Splitwise came to ¬£6.00. Now I may not be the smartest guy on the block, but I‚Äôm pretty sure ¬£1.25 + ¬£2.00 does not equal ¬£6.00.

Review Title: Not so user friendly app but does the job
Review Text: The app can be simplified a lot but still keep it‚Äôs main features of splitting. Another thing that would be extremely useful would be if people could add their bank details so other people cam transfer them money without asking them. This would ideally be information shared amongst the members of the group.

Over complicates transactions by putting them ‚Äúas part of a set‚Äù... so for example I settle up, paying my friend ¬£109, then my friend gets one notification saying I paid them ¬£109, and a second saying I paid them ¬£119.

It is very difficult to account for the ¬£10 discrepancy. Splitwise notes this, and says they are part of a set, go to ‚ÄúAll expenses‚Äù screen for details. I cannot find an all expenses screen.

Also is ugly.

Review Title: Why i see islamic months instead of Gregorian
Review Text:
Why i see islamic months instead of Gregorian in the expense  details for each friend? (Month grouping is based on islamic months) 

There is no setting for this. I even changed my time zone but didnt work. 

Please fix it back to Gregorian

I wish they had an option to analyse expenditures, it‚Äôll be great if you can view how much you‚Äôve spent this week/month/year. Maybe even categorise how much exactly is spent on food, household, transport. Just an idea I hope the developers are working towards :D
We use splitwise for bills and household items in our shared house. I also use it when on holiday with friends. It works everything out and makes it so easy! Highly recommend.

Got this for a group holiday and it worked perfectly- saved splitting dinner bills etc and meant we didn‚Äôt need to keep receipts etc. 

The simplify debts option made it even easier!

This is a great app, works like a charm for splitting bills of any sort. The only thing missing (that I would really like to see) is some option to convert foreign currencies back to local currency (eg GBP) at the end of a trip, rather than be stuck with different debts in different currencies.

Review Title: Was a great app - but totally ruined by the new pricing structure
Review Text:
As an app it works great and I had been using this for years. However the free version is now extremely limited (3 expenses per day + 10 second ad everytime you try to add more expenses). 

The premium version is way too overpriced at ¬£5 per month subscription (or ¬£40 per year). Especially considering the premium features aren‚Äôt that significant. Would consider paying ¬£5 for a lifetime payment, but unfortunately I will have to move to a different app for now. 
The management of the change was also not communicated well - no warnings or consultations with long time users beforehand! All of a sudden the change was just implemented. 

Very disappointing!
Great app, helped us organise a stag do of 18 people. Would have been a huge pain working out who owes what without this little gem! We‚Äôve needed something this clever for years. Highly recommend!

Great app to keep track of who owes whom. The only thing I‚Äôd improve on is the Pro version. I would happily pay the developers for their work but I would prefer a one off payment, not the currently proposed annual subscription.

I used to love this app & used it with my housemates to divided all our bills. Now you can only add two items & watch an ad to add a 3rd, after three items it stops you from added any more expenses that day. Now I can‚Äôt go in and add in all the monthly bills, internet, water, electric, gas, council tax without upgrading to the pro version. I have been a loyal user for years but now I will have  to switch to an alternative.

Review Title: Once a great app but has been ruined due to greed
Review Text:
App is very difficult to use now due to ads and they even lock you out after a certain amount of use. Splitwise have neglected their long term users most of which do not want to spend money on something like this. 

I have now found an alternative and suspect others are doing the same.

Makes everyone‚Äôs life so easy. For groups on holiday, and for housemates or couples ongoing finances. Hassle free! My boyfriend and I have a group that‚Äôs been running between us for about 2 months, just to keep track of whose spending what! Love it

Nice one, helps us to manage our badminton expense as different players play each week and different ones pay each week. We used to manage this in an excel spreadsheet, but hopefully we can manage it using Splitwise going forward!

Not the simplest to use. 
Wanted to simply add house bills for future dates for a regular bill but only let me set it up as, ‚ÄòMe‚Äô paying the bill and everyone owing the money to me (including myself owing the money to me). Also, it told everyone they owed the money now. 
General expenses (like lending money and people owing money) is easy to set up and use but not particularly good for house bills.

I‚Äôve used Splitwise to split expenses on group holidays, between family members, and even with my partner. Fantastic app that is very user friendly and does exactly what you need it to. 10/10 recommend!

Review Title: Keep track of holiday spends effectively!
Review Text: I can‚Äôt imagine going away without the app! Easy to track group spends and input expenses. Highly recommend for holiday goers! You can use the webpage app just as easy too.

Review Title: Makes travelling with friends super easy!
Review Text: Fantastic app. We all put what we have paid for on behalf of the group and it does all the maths for us. Really excellent app. Especially the simplify debt setting, so you make the least amount of transfers possible.

Review Title: Ruined by recent changes and unrealistic subscription model
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used this for years, but a recent change has made it unusable.

You frequently get a 10second Lock Screen preventing you entering any expenses unless you upgrade to Pro

I‚Äôm more than happy to pay an amount for this app, but there is no model between ‚Äúfree‚Äù and a very expensive subscription model (presumably for heavy business users)

It really needs to introduce a middle model of a small one off payment with a more reasonable restriction eg 15 entries a day, or they‚Äôll lose all their non business customers.

Multiple threads online (including Reddit) for alternatives, but going to stick with it a little and hope they change their mind.

Amazing app me and my sister love it and find it so helpful in keeping track of payments to each other. Super easy to use and I love that you can make group expenses too.
Genuinely changed my life

Review Title: Perfect app to manage group spending
Review Text:
This is easily the most clever app for controlling a kitty or a group spend budget.
I‚Äôve been using it for a month now & it‚Äôs so easy & the various options are ideal!

This app is easy to use and has  great functionality and cute interfaces! I strongly recommend if you'd like to keep track of expenses among friends/partners. I have been using it for almost 2 years now for all my trips. Thanks!
I have been using this app for family financial planning for years now and it is still as essential as it‚Äôs always been

The app freezes at some point while trying to edit a payment, and since then when i try to open it spend few min trying and close itself again.
The app it‚Äôs good but not working ok in my iPhone 6

Review Title: Wish you could pay someone using the app
Review Text: Or at least see their bank details. You have to leave the app to ask someone for their account details, then pay them somewhere else. It‚Äôs all just a bit of a faff. I just asked everyone to get a monzo account for our next holiday - it makes this app completely redundant.
Fantastic app for group trips where you can take it in turns to pay for things without messing about trying to split between multiple cards at the time. Amazing!

Very easy to use once you‚Äôve found your way around. Saves endless time on a calculator and trying to remember who paid for what and when. Great. Probably saved a lot of friendships from meltdown. Recommended.

Perfect for group trips!! Made it so much easier, one improvement could be adding an option to take a pic of the receipt to ensure accurate recording and so others can see it too, otherwise brilliant app!

Good little app.  It can be confusing at times as it‚Äôs not always immediately apparent how the debt transfers have been worked out.  It would be great if it had built in account facilities and the ability to pay people electronically.  Maybe in various currencies.  A link to TransferWise would be great.

Can't think of one way to improve this app. 

If there was a way to pay a small fee during the settle-up process, I would have done it. These guys deserve donuts. 

Don't forget to turn on "simplify" on the group settings. We did.  üôÄ

Review Title: Practically unusable with the new adverts
Review Text:
I‚Äôve used this for a while and had the subscription every now and then for longer trips and so had been worth it. 

Unfortunately now with the adverts on every single transaction the app is practically unusable without an expensive subscription. I‚Äôll be looking for alternatives that are more cost effective.

This is awesome.... as much for splitting a dinner bill as a week‚Äôs holiday with friends!  Makes life soooo much easier to share costs and means no one has to hold a kitty or monitor costs.  Anyone can pay a bill and just stick it in the app.... we love it.

This app saved a lot of hassle on a recent friends ski trip. No need to keep a kitty and  ask for top ups this app lets you keep track of costs who was there and ask for a settling up at the end of weekend. 

A few minor tweaks still required but overall a great app.

I‚Äôve been looking for an app that enables easy splitting and tracking of expenses for some time and am gladly leaving behind paper and spreadsheets for Splitwise. It‚Äôs intuitive and works perfectly. Currency converter is available in the Pro version. Thanks for the great app.

Well structured, intuitive and does exactly as expected. Offers many options, like for bilateral expenses within group expenses. Excellent. 

I was first taken aback by need to register, but makes sense: expenses in cloud, all members can add their expenses. 

Really good job by developers.

Review Title: Could probably be one of the most useful apps I have
Review Text: I often go on trips with friends sharing costs. Instead of scribbling shared costs down on paper or in iOS Notes, this app does all the work for me.

Review Title: Fantastic app for groups of friends so no one gets stuck with a large bill!
Review Text: Juts trust the app and you be fine. Simplify is a great feature at the end to prevent having to send pods of kent to different people. Great app üôåüèª

Review Title: The best app I‚Äôve ever downloaded
Review Text: Makes travelling SO much easier, have recommend to all my friends and family!! SO easy to use and makes working out money so much easier. Honestly wouldn‚Äôt travel without it!

This is a great app that does all the hard work for you! Splitting bills couldn‚Äôt be easier. I have used this app for almost five years and I can‚Äôt imagine not using it to manage any shared expenses.

Just perfect for festivals or holidays. Makes it so easy. One person picks up the bill, adds it to Splitwise and says who was there. Job done. Normally find there is very little to be left to settle up after the trip. Love it!
Very useful app when you are away with friends. So good at dividing bills, even when some are not involved in all the action. Thank you Splitwise for making life easier!!

It would be nice if you could break down expenses into individual items.

Otherwise this app is perfect for keeping track of group expenses.

Splitwise is a great app. Easy to use and great to track expenditures among friends. 
The only thing missing is the ability to group family members. So that we can settle family to family rather than individuals settling.

Following up from my previous review, to support a situation where you also need to represent income into a Splitwise group, 'reimbursement' works mathematically but is confusing to read. It says eg '8 people paid $80' if you get an $80 reimbursement. 

Ideally there would be an 'income' type, then whoever received the income would show '1 person received $80', and in balances you'd see the $10 owed to each other member. 

I can understand why you might not want this - perhaps it's going beyond splitwise's scope. But please do add reimbursement to the mobile app.

Thanks

Using this now on our girls holiday & it‚Äôs fantastic! Easy to use, you can put your transactions on in most currencies, split between all or just some of the group!  No more kitty money for us it‚Äôs brilliant!
Extremely useful app. Used it recently for a long trip with many people. Very easy to use and works out brilliantly. It's OK even if one person is sorting it all out too.

Solid app and easy to use. Premium version is far too expensive in comparison to competitors. Overall it‚Äôs really missing the chance to insert budgets as a household/group and then assign every expenses to specific budget categories. 
This little but powerful feature would bring my vote all the way up to 5.

Honestly one of the most useful apps on my phone. I use it daily for household expenses and it comes in extra handy for trips. I‚Äôve used it for local travel and internationally (you can capture multiple currencies).

I found using Splitwise very good.  The features are fit for purpose but I ran into an annoying bug with pro (which led to me going back to regular).  Some of the receipts (no matter how you do it) do not get itemised correctly.  Otherwise it is very good and worth using.

Lifesaver on a group holiday with 9 people. Easily store payments and figure out who owes what at the end. Only feature it would be great to see is a currency converter to see the final total in our home currency.
Fantastic app with lots of features to help keep track between multiple friends and groups. Only thing that could be improved is an option to pay directly in the app when ‚Äúsettling up‚Äù!

Review Title: Brilliant app with groups of friends
Review Text: I use this app all the time when travelling with friends. It‚Äôs so easy to use and makes shared bills simple to settle. Highly recommend!
Can‚Äôt imagine a group holiday without  Splitwise to help us sort costs between us all. So simple. No arguments. An incredibly easy-to-use app. Would give 10 star if I could.

This app does not do anything that it promises. It does not factor in how much you owe the other when calculating expenses. Also, the app could be improved so much by small things such as an area where bank details can be provided and copied easily, or a link to the bank account. It basically is a glorified notes page, and it has potential to be so much more.
This app has saved our lives. There was 11 people on holiday and this was the best way for us to sort out costs. Defo recommend it for anyone going on group outings

This was a great app! My friends and I went on holiday and used this. It was excellent and it allowed us to keep track of our savings. 

Highly recommend!

Great at managing little trips away, splitting fuel, food and other costs. 

And also great managing finances as a couple. Making it easy to remember who‚Äôs paid for what and when. 

Been using it for years. No issues üëç

Bought this as the pro version based on functionality. I tried twice and both times it didn‚Äôt work so I cancelled my subscription. Needs a lot of work. Would‚Äôve been quicker to do it by hand üòû
Very good app to keep track of spending on friends‚Äô group holidays or activities. Very easy to set up a group and then split equally or between certain people. Well worth downloading!

Easy solution: create a reference number that people can use to join the group or allow the weblinks (or text) to take them through to the group - but they don‚Äôt have this at the moment. Review Title: Loved it until a rude surprise
Review Text: I used to love Splitwise and would have previously given it 5 stars. However the company decided to introduce a daily expense limit for free accounts‚Ä¶without bothering to tell anyone about it. Nor was there any official information about what this expense limit was. Unless Splitwise seriously changes how it treats its users, I cannot in good faith recommend this to anyone.
Great app, used for a group of 12 on a abroad wedding. Can‚Äôt complain about the app very useful and easy to use. To get Splitwise pro the annual subscription is quite expensive concerning.
Made my life so much easier when living with friends. Highly recommend this app if you like to keep track of your Money.
I always use this app while abroad with friends and works perfectly everytime. No need to split bills and no one minds paying for the group because it‚Äôs all fair and even

Review Title: Another great useful app changed to a subscription
Review Text: Was brilliant until today. Basically now you are forced to buy the pro version if you want to log more than 10 expenses per day :( sad to see this app just become like every other out there. Currently looking for an alternative because ¬£40 per year for this is ridiculous.

It is very good app.

I‚Äôm really unhappy that they‚Äôre basically forcing you to get the PRO subscription if you‚Äôre a regular user now. I‚Äôd pay a one off fee, but a monthly payment seems ridiculous for an app like this. There‚Äôs no way I will be upgrading so I will have to look into other options.

Review Title: Great until they start forcing you to take Pro

Great when travelling with friends. Helped to sort out some tricky situations where people paid random amounts and owed others random amounts. Splitwise did all the hard work.

This app is not worth 4 pounds a month come on guys:) I will move to another app soon if this doesn‚Äôt stop
Love this app. Put your holiday buddies in and it doesn‚Äôt matter who pays for what, just track in the app. Then magically at the end of your break, you can all settle up. Clean and easy to use.

Used to be incredibly useful. Now limited to 3 expenses per day without Pro paid version. Useless if you want to put something on the record while you remember it, only to find you have to wait until tomorrow to add another expense.

It‚Äôs made transactions so much easier especially with the option to simplify debts. It would be great if it were possible to click ‚Äòsettle up‚Äô debt and pay directly from the app

Easy and efficient to use. Makes recording of shared billing simplistic. My dad n I use this for shared household bills and it‚Äôs excellent

Completely understand they want people to pay for pro, but 3 expenses per day makes it useless, I don‚Äôt use it every day but then when you need it like on a holiday the 3 expense limit renders it useless. Maybe if the daily limit was higher or there was a decent monthly limit?

¬£2.99 a month is ridiculous, if it were a one-off expense, I‚Äôd consider it. We only use it for holidays!

Wow, this makes accounting for the group kitty so easy when away with mates. I guess there are loads of situations where this works too, but for cycling holidays it‚Äôs brilliant

Review Title: Interface, Design and UI is so dead
