This has been the single best app innovation I‚Äôve managed to get into my home. It‚Äôs Luddite friendly, and has meant arguments over who‚Äôs turn it is to pay have been eliminated.

Please implement Peer-to-Peer Apple Pay and PayPalMe integration. That would make it perfect
What a wonderful app. One of the most useful app have downloaded by far. Was on a trip with the guys and this was a lifesaver. And everything was in black and white.
Love this simple to use app to keep track of payments. Used to keep receipts and manually check if one of us was out of pocket. This app makes it so much easier.
so good for splitting bills, automatically shows what you owe for each individual person and calculates everything
Makes traveling so much easier with friends.
I am using Splitwise since 2016. It is a very good app to maintain the general ledger details. Loved it!! I strongly recommend this app for anyone.
Really great app. Easy to use. Visual information is great. Highly recommend
Easy to use, and a perfect set up for shared living situations.
Removes the awkward money conversation from any relationship.

Review Title: Wonderful but doesn't work with 3rd party keyboards
Review Text:
Makes life easy; now I never forget to add an expense and I can keep track of my spending!
It's fully featured and has everything I need. Updated often and makes the most of the new iPhone features - one of the first apps I had that was updated promptly to take into account the bigger iPhone 6 screen too. The only issue is that it's buggy when using third party keyboards - I mentioned this to the developer months ago but it still isn't fixed.
So handy for managing finances ‚ù§Ô∏è
This is an excellent app.

My partner and I run our finances separately and use Splitwise to keep track of our joint spending (and to make sure we maintain an equivalent position).  In short,it's great .... We've been using it for over 2 years and find the ease of entry for costs and the easy visibility of current balances to be very useful.  I also download as the transactions every couple of months into a spreadsheet so we can analyze our spending patterns  using the categories.
Splitwise is very easy to use and the developers seem to do regular updates, I'm very happy with it.

The phone app doesn't allow you to match a payment to an expense or expenses to mark them as paid.  It only keeps a running total, automatically offsetting everything.  That's fine if everyone pays and enters everything promptly.  If they don't, you have to reconcile everything manually and outside the system to work out what debts are outstanding, which undermines the whole point of the app. In practical terms, it's useless.  Actually, it is worse than useless - this app has wasted a lot of my time and created unnecessary tension between me and my housemates.  We would bd much better off having a list on our refrigerator and manually striking debts out as they are paid.  Or doing it through a google spreadsheet and emailing/smsing each other once an expense is added.

I've been using Splitwise for about 4 years, and I love it. Every time I travel in a group, I make sure we all have it, set up a group for the trip and we just take turns paying and keep everything in Splitwise. Towards the end of the trip, we make sure we are getting close to even, and then repay each other on the last night or when we get home.

I also use it for a performing group I belong to, we use it for things like registrations for events, buying sheet music and equipment etc.

One if the best apps I own.

I've been using split wise for years. Like most accounting software it's not for everyone - some of my friends get pretty sensitive about money and how debts are tracked (for example, they'd like to think buying a beer = helping with their rent :P). My partner, housemate and myself love it though. We just keep any receipts for shared expenses in our wallets and stick them in split wise once a week. The whole service is updated regularly with new features and UI tweaks coming out at least once a month.

Review Title: Basta a menare soldi! Equo ed imparziale
Review Text:
Con questa app mi trovo benissimo.
La uso sempre durante i viaggi in coppia e con amici. Non serve ricordare chi ti ha prestato e quanto (e viceversa), basta segnare e lui fa tutti i conti e tiene aggiornato sempre il bilancio. Imperdibile!

Ideale in viaggi di gruppo ma anche tra poche persone. Utile anche nella vita di tutti i giorni con coinquilini. Ti permette di non pensare alla divisione dei costi o di incastrarti in calcoli infiniti. Super innovativo, semplicissimo da usare! Approvato e promosso a pieni voti!

Ho scoperto questa applicazione per caso appena prima di partire per un viaggio con altre 3 persone, e ci ha ‚Äúsalvato la vita‚Äù. Siamo riusciti a non impazzire tra conti, debiti e crediti.
Applicazione veramente consigliata anche nella semplice versione gratuita.
Un app davvero facile da usare molto semplice e intuitiva, unico neo toglierei la pubblicit√† senza dover far pagare il servizio. Infine attendiamo release per permettere il pagamento diretto

Mi capita spesso di organizzare gite e vacanze con tanti amici, o magari solo anche cene in cui √® difficile fare ‚Äúalla romana‚Äù.
Con SplitWise, specialmente l‚Äôinvito via SMS, la registrazione non obbligatoria di tutti e la funzione semplifica debiti, √® veramente stracomodo organizzarsi per tenere i conti e mettersi a posto solo alla fine, evitando mille giri di soldi inutili, approssimazioni e resti che fanno solo confusione e ci fanno sempre rimettere qualcuno!

Review Title: Great app but a small feature request
Review Text:
The app is great and pretty clean and simple to use. 
Most of us sharing a flat generally add expenses at end of week so to add to experience if you could give a simple add and subtract feature while typing in amount. For example I bought grocery worth 330 on day 1, 200 on day 3 and 696 on day 6. Now on day 7 I have 2 options I can add three different expenses or i can calculate these 3 days on a calculator and add as one. What would be great is if you could add a simple add button so I can add these 3 days expense directly on Splitwise and store it as an single expense. Hope this makes sense

Review Title: The pro version is not very intuitive
Review Text:
I have used Splitwise for years and it‚Äôs been useful when I had to split expenditures with flatmates.
But now as a homemaker, I am really struggling to leverage this app to store collective and individual expenditures.

I can only enter my individual expense on the group I share with my husband. He has to do his data entry by himself. Else we have to choose a ‚Äúsplit‚Äù option. Why would you force that???
I should be able to do all this data entry by myself, even if I have to do it for the other members in my house!!

The below review is for Pro version:
Charts are restricted to a pie. 
Only absolute nos. no percentage split
No way to see who contributes how much share of the expenditure. 
In this post CoViD world, when all receipts are digital, I don‚Äôt see the point of receipt scanning.
Itemisation barely makes sense if you give just limited Color palette for high level items in the charts to start with.
In short, there is no way to analyse the Data if visualisation is so limited. Charge me for subscription but at least make it worthwhile.

It‚Äôs turning out to be a disappointing journey in managing expenditures using Splitwise, when one moves from one stage of life to another.

I have been using Splitwise for quite sometime now. But recently noticed I have been getting ‚Äúyou have reached your daily limit expense‚Äù notification when I had just added 4 transactions. There is no heads up or info anywhere how much is the limit for daily transactions. In the past I have added 15-20 transactions in one day. But off late this daily limit is frustrating. Crappy move to persuade free users to move to the paid version. I don‚Äôt want the features in paid version. Just want to add simple transactions and manage finance. Seems like I am going back to maintaining the excel sheet again. Splitwise team you just lost a customer.

Review Title: Life saver, huge scope for improvement
Review Text:
Really a very useful app. One of the essentials apps for me. Best thing about it is its simplicity. However, some attention to improvement is required. Such as -

1. Better charts and drill down capabilities in Pro. I see the bars, i see a spike in a monthly expense, but I can‚Äôt drill down to that expense category to see what exactly caused the spike.
2. Settle all balances are treated as expenses. Due to this there are spiked expenses data, not very easy for analysis.
3. Integration with spend sources, like bank apps, apple pay etc will enhance its usability.

Review Title: Better if there‚Äôs an option to add taxes
Review Text: Often the food bill in restaurants includes a certain percentage of tax. While we can split the bill among all based on what they have eaten , it‚Äôs painful to calculate the exact share of tax for each individual. Often we resort to adding the extra tax amount equally among all in a separate entry. It becomes worrisome as the group size increases . It would be better if we an option to add the tax percentage in that country , say 8% for everyone involved in that bill.

With group members joining and leaving at separate times, certain expenses being shared by a limited number of different group members, and different members paying at different times, sharing expenses would have been very complicated. Splitwise makes it so easy to enter and apportion the expenses. I have now been using it for several years and find it essential whenever we travel in a group.

Such an app might be slow, but it wouldn‚Äôt be ‚Äú10 seconds between expenses, and limited to 3 expenses a day‚Äù slow! Will be moving to a competitor, thanks!
